description:
About Innowave Tech 
 Innowave Tech is an Artificial Intelligence (AI) company offering solutions for the Semiconductor and Advanced Manufacturing industry. Utilizing deep industrial domain knowledge, proven experience, and innovation, we provide expert AI solutions and systems to address various industry pain points. 
 
  
 Why Join Us 
 As our clientele expands within the semiconductor and advanced manufacturing sectors, our team needs to expand accordingly. If you possess quick learning abilities and thrive in a rapidly evolving environment, this is the perfect opportunity to join us ! 
 
  
 Key Responsibilities 
 1.Assist in the development and maintenance of C# Windows Forms applications. 
 2.Contribute to the development of console applications using C#. 
 3.Work closely with the development team to understand requirements and implement solutions. 
 4.Participate in code reviews and adhere to coding standards and best practices. 
 5.Help document code and maintain software documentation. 
 
  
 Qualifications 
 1.Currently pursuing or recently graduated with a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field. 
 2.Basic understanding of C# and .NET framework. 
 3.Familiarity with Windows Forms and console applications development is a plus. 
 4.Strong problem-solving skills and a willingness to learn. 
 5.Excellent communication and teamwork skills. 
 
  
 What We Offer 
 1.A collaborative and supportive environment to grow your skills. 
 2.Hands-on experience working on real-world projects. 
 3.Guidance and mentoring from experienced software developers. 
 4.Opportunity to contribute to impactful projects.

description:
Regal Law LLC is a full service law firm with a commitment to provide only the best quality of service and legal assistance to our clients. 
 
  
 Overview: 
 As a Legal Intern, you will gain hands-on experience and exposure to various facets of legal practice within our organization. You will work closely with our legal team to assist in research, drafting legal documents, attending meetings, and providing support in various legal matters. This internship offers a unique opportunity to develop practical skills, expand legal knowledge, and contribute to meaningful projects. 
 
  
 Key Responsibilities: 
 Legal Research and Analysis 
 
  Conduct comprehensive legal research on relevant statutes, case law, regulations, and legal precedents.  Analyze legal issues and provide summaries, memos, or reports to support decision-making processes. 
 
 Document Drafting and Review 
 
  Assist in drafting legal documents such as contracts, agreements, memos, and correspondence.  Review and analyze legal documents to ensure accuracy, completeness, and compliance with applicable laws and regulations. 
 
 Case Management Support 
 
  Assist in organizing and managing case files, including maintaining electronic and physical records.  Prepare materials for hearings, depositions, trials, and other legal proceedings as needed. 
 
 Administrative Support 
 
  Provide administrative support to the legal team, including scheduling meetings, managing calendars, and coordinating communication with essential parties.  Assist in the preparation of other legal resources. 
 
 Collaboration and Communication 
 
  Collaborate effectively with lawyers, paralegals, and other members of the legal team to achieve project goals and objectives. 
  Communicate clearly and professionally with clients, vendors, and other external parties as necessary. 
 
 Qualifications (preferred) 
 
  Currently enrolled in/recently graduated from a law school program.  Strong academic record with coursework in relevant legal areas such as contracts, torts, civil procedure, and legal writing. 
  Excellent research, analytical, and problem-solving skills. 
  Proficiency in legal research tools and databases. 
  Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. 
  Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. 
  Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management abilities. 
  Professional demeanour and a commitment to maintaining confidentiality. 
 
 Duration and Compensation 
 
  This is an internship position with a flexible term, with the possibility of extension based on performance and business needs. 
  Compensation and benefits will be provided according to company policies and applicable laws. 
 
 Note: This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the internship and the general nature and level of work performed. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required. Responsibilities and duties may change over time, and the intern may be required to perform other duties as assigned.

description:
Responsibilities

 Collaborate with senior managers and mentors to understand the company's strategic goals and objectives.
 Contribute to various projects and initiatives within assigned departments, taking ownership of tasks and delivering results.
 Analyze data and market trends to provide insights that support decision-making and process improvements.
 Assist in the development and implementation of strategies that drive operational efficiency and business growth.
 Learn and adhere to company policies, procedures, and industry regulations.
 Participate in workshops, seminars, and training sessions to enhance your professional development.
 Embrace challenges and actively seek opportunities to learn and take on increasing responsibilities.

Requirements:

 Strong interpersonal and communication skills by working with different teams and interacting with clients.
 Recent grad, early-career professional, or mid-career switch individuals with a passion for learning and growth may apply.
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and propose innovative solutions.
 Proactive attitude with a strong willingness to take on new challenges and responsibilities.
 Adaptability and flexibility to thrive in a dynamic and evolving work environment.
 Possess leadership skills, confidence and, the desire to develop into a management role.

Benefits 

 Competitive base salary with performance-based incentives.
 Comprehensive training and professional development opportunities.
 Opportunities for career advancement within the organization.
 Mentorship from experienced professionals that will help with personal development, growth and self-discovery.

Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $3,000.00 - $4,000.00 per month
Benefits:

 Cell phone reimbursement
 Dental insurance
 Health insurance
 Professional development

Schedule:

 Day shift
 Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

 13th month salary
 Performance bonus

Work Location: In person

companyInfo/companyDescription: Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: “for every future,” we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets. With a team of approximately 100,000 employees and assets of approximately $1.2 trillion (as at January 31, 2020), Scotiabank trades on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: BNS) and New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: BNS).
description:
Requisition ID: 195323  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
 
  Purpose
  Contributes to the overall success of GRM Enterprise Risk in Asia Pacific ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities are conducted in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures.
 
  Accountabilities
 
   Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
   Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
   Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
   Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.
   Assist the Enterprise Risk team in executing operational risk 2nd line accountabilities in accordance to the Bank’s policies and frameworks, including governance and oversight activities in the Asia Pacific region, via tasks that may include but are not limited to the following:
   
     Prepare reports and presentation decks for regional committee meetings, including Operational Risk, Third Party Risk Management, committee meetings.
     Review, update and maintain Regulatory Libraries, ensuring Obligations are properly captured and correctly mapped to Controls.
     Coordinate, gather and organize inputs from various stakeholder teams, to support assessments related to compliance with regulatory notices/ obligations.
     Assist in updating and maintaining local enterprise risk policies/addenda to ensure continued relevance and effectiveness with alignment to Head Office’s global policies, frameworks, risk appetite and compliance to local regulations.
     Support the team’s review and objective challenge of operational risk matters through the application of operational risk management tools such as Operational Risk Events (ORE), Risk and Control Self Assessments (RCSA), New Initiative Risk Assessments (NIRA) and Key Risk Indicators (KRI). 
    Assist in performing quality control reviews on third party contracts in the Third Party Risk Management (TPRM) system.
     Support the team on other periodic or ad hoc requests or projects as required, including: audit or regulatory requests for information, Records Inventory Management initiative, Compliance reviews etc
   
 
 
  Experience / Other Information 
 
  Fresh graduate with studies in Accountancy/Economics/Business/Finance/ Engineering/ Science with keen interest in Finance and Risk Management. Data management and analytics skills a strong plus.
   Strong facility with Microsoft Office Suite including Word, Excel, Powerpoint. Skills in data visualization software e.g. Power BI highly-desired.
   Strong sense of responsibility and personal initiative, highly-organized, strong detail-orientation, excellent time-management skills, curiosity and drive to learn.
   Ability to work well both within a team and independently on tasks. Strong team-orientation. 
  Strong writing skills an asset.
 
 
  Location(s): Singapore : Singapore : Singapore  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.
descriptionHTML:
Requisition ID: 195323

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.


Purpose

Contributes to the overall success of GRM Enterprise Risk in Asia Pacific ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities are conducted in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures.


Accountabilities

  • Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
  • Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
  • Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
  • Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.
  • Assist the Enterprise Risk team in executing operational risk 2nd line accountabilities in accordance to the Bank’s policies and frameworks, including governance and oversight activities in the Asia Pacific region, via tasks that may include but are not limited to the following:
    • Prepare reports and presentation decks for regional committee meetings, including Operational Risk, Third Party Risk Management, committee meetings.
    • Review, update and maintain Regulatory Libraries, ensuring Obligations are properly captured and correctly mapped to Controls.
    • Coordinate, gather and organize inputs from various stakeholder teams, to support assessments related to compliance with regulatory notices/ obligations.
    • Assist in updating and maintaining local enterprise risk policies/addenda to ensure continued relevance and effectiveness with alignment to Head Office’s global policies, frameworks, risk appetite and compliance to local regulations.
    • Support the team’s review and objective challenge of operational risk matters through the application of operational risk management tools such as Operational Risk Events (ORE), Risk and Control Self Assessments (RCSA), New Initiative Risk Assessments (NIRA) and Key Risk Indicators (KRI).
    • Assist in performing quality control reviews on third party contracts in the Third Party Risk Management (TPRM) system.
    • Support the team on other periodic or ad hoc requests or projects as required, including: audit or regulatory requests for information, Records Inventory Management initiative, Compliance reviews etc


Experience / Other Information

  • Fresh graduate with studies in Accountancy/Economics/Business/Finance/ Engineering/ Science with keen interest in Finance and Risk Management. Data management and analytics skills a strong plus.
  • Strong facility with Microsoft Office Suite including Word, Excel, Powerpoint. Skills in data visualization software e.g. Power BI highly-desired.
  • Strong sense of responsibility and personal initiative, highly-organized, strong detail-orientation, excellent time-management skills, curiosity and drive to learn.
  • Ability to work well both within a team and independently on tasks. Strong team-orientation.
  • Strong writing skills an asset.


Location(s): Singapore : Singapore : Singapore

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.
positionName: Trainee, Enterprise Risk, GRM APAC (6 months)

companyInfo/companyDescription: Emerson is a diversified global manufacturing and technology company. It offers a wide range of products and services in the areas of network power, process management, industrial automation, and tools and storage businesses. Recognized widely for its engineering capabilities and management excellence, Emerson has over 66,000 employees and 130 manufacturing locations worldwide.
description:
Job Summary 
 If you are a Supply Chain professional, looking to expand your career in the Manufacturing space, Emerson has an exciting opportunity for you! The Senior / Post-Production Planner will manage the post-product request and requirements. This role will plan the post-production activities to improve shipping capacity. You will coordinate all projects postproduction execution activities from entry to completion. 
 In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be: 
 
  Lead project post-production requests and workflows for one or multiple type of postproduction requirements. 
  Review and plan all post-production activities to optimize daily shipping capacity. 
  Lead projects postproduction meetings with various functional team to strategize plans to meet customer’s postproduction requirements. 
  Plan and prioritize packing sequence and exceptions request by the required deadline. 
  Establish postproduction forecast plan to support shipping operations capacity and workforce planning. 
  Work closely with various function teams to arrange workforce and capacity to meet customer’s postproduction request. 
  Identify gaps and improvement plans to address any issues faced during postproduction activities. 
  Expedite relevant functional groups immediately when there are any potential postproduction schedule delays and adjust the schedule as needed. 
  Complete other tasks assigned by supervisor/manager. 
  Implement key organization process improvement plans through Perfect Execution activities and fulfill operations measures. 
  Support digital transformation, progressive changes to existing process to keep pace with efficiency gains expectations. 
  Follow Company’s policies and procedures on work safety. 
 
 Who You Are: 
 You use customer insights to drive and guide the development of new offerings. You understand interpersonal and group dynamics and react in an effective manner. You actively listen and check for understanding. You always keep the end in sight; put in extra effort to meet deadlines. 
 For This Role, You Will Need: 
 
  Minimum 3 years of production planning / master scheduling / data analyst experience. 
  Experience with Oracle MRP, Microsoft Power BI and office suite is a plus. 
  Good excel and analytical skills and attending to details. 
  Experience chairing and facilitating cross functional meetings. 
  Thinks systematically and prioritizes tasks to work efficiently and effectively. 
  Demonstrate dedication to work and initiative. 
  Positive and can-do attitude as well as willingness to accept challenges. 
 
 Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart: 
 
  Degree or equivalent in Business Management, Supply Chain Management or Computer Science or any related field 
  Good written and verbal communications skills, ability to work well independently under pressure and as a great teammate. 
  Drives for result, customer focused, detailed oriented, interpersonal savvy. 
 
 Our Offer To You: 
 By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do. 
 Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets . We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees. 
 We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion . We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship . 
 We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential . We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company. 
 We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office. 
 Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities. 
 Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent. 
 Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion 
 At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers. 
 This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson . 
 If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .
 


 WHY EMERSON 
 Our Commitment to Our People 
 At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration. 
 We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor. 
 
 At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together. 
 Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation 
 If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com . 
 
 ABOUT EMERSON 
 Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability. 
 With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety. 
 
 We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go! 
 No calls or agencies please.

description:
Purpose of the Role: 
 Due to K2 expansion, APAC technical and delivery team looking to hire Engineering Trainee to support our internal design team management and design review work. This person will be working closely with SG HQ based Project Management team to handle the daily design related issues for existing and future projects in APAC region.
  
  Responsibilities: 
  
 
 
  Assist Assistant Project Manager or Site Delivery Manager in data centre design and construction phases for site management and construction quality control.
   Help to monitor construction activities closely on a regular basis and ensure the data centre facility is built to group's standard. 
  Help to review design consultant’s work to ensure design documents are sufficiently developed with all necessary engineering calculations in place.
   Help to maintain K2 internal engineering standard with particular focus on HVAC and plumbing systems.
   Help Assistant Project Manager in works related to project commissioning and final handover activities.
   Help Assistant Project Manager in K2 internal engineering design and development activities.
   Help to uphold the engineering and operation procedures following K2 standard.
 
  
  Working environment entails: 
 
  Walking job sites which have areas of uneven terrain.
   Work at heights.
   Work in a noisy environment.
   Work in confined spaces.
   Work environment applicable to operation team 
   
    Regularly lift and/or move items and participate in group lifts. 
    Work shifts longer than eight hours in duration. 
    Co-ordinate body movements when using tools or equipment. 
    May require bending or twisting the body to access equipment while working.
     Involves performing physical tasks all day. 
    Use hands to manipulate small wires and objects. 
    Push or pull objects into position.
   
 
  Skills Set and Qualifications Requirements:
  
 
   Fresh Graduate with Bachelor’s in Mechanical or Building Services Engineering
   Working experience in building services design and construction project delivery (data centre projects preferred).
   Good knowledge in Electrical HV/LV distribution Engineering with interest in understanding on data centre project and protection study preferred
   Proficiency in MS Office (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc) with experience in Electrical or Mechanical calculation software, such as Etap, IES, E20
   Good command of written and spoken English is required. Additional language skills such as Chinese and/or Bahasa Indonesia/Malaysia will be preferred.
   Candidates who are active, initiative, conscientious, sociable, flexible and optimistic.
  
  Interpersonal Requirements: 
  
 
  Committed to the delivery of excellent customer service.
   Calm Manner, able to work under pressure.
   Self-motivated, ability to work on own initiative.
   Punctual and reliable.
   Good attention to detail.

Responsibilities:

description:
We see mostly dogs, cats and pocket pets! Continuing education is strongly supported for all staff. We are booked in only during opening hours, and strictly close during meal times to enjoy meals together. Clinic outings are a regular activity as well! Qualities we look for: strong ethics, genuine love for animals, excellent communication skills, and keen interest in building long term rapport. If you’re looking for a supportive and fun workplace, with exposure to gold standard veterinary care – then Brighton Vet Care is the place for you. 
 
  
 We have all the necessary equipments to work each case up thoroughly, and most importantly, lovely clients who want the best care for their pets. Special interest and intention for memberships will be an added advantage. Mentorship and induction support will be provided for recent grads. Did we mention, once again, our nice clients who love to feed us?

description:
Key Responsibilities: 
 
  Assist in the coordination of franchise development activities, including prospect research, franchise agreement preparation, and franchisee communication. 
  Conduct market research to identify potential franchise markets and analyze market trends. 
  Maintain accurate documentation and records related to franchise agreements, legal documents, and franchisee correspondence. 
  Liaise with internal stakeholders and external partners to ensure smooth communication within the franchise network. 
  Provide administrative support and assist in special projects and initiatives related to franchise expansion. 
 
 Benefits: 
 
  Exposure to a global brand in the franchising industry. 
  Mentorship and guidance from experienced professionals. 
  Networking opportunities within the company and with franchise partners. 
  Potential for future career opportunities based on performance. 
 
 Job Requirements: 
 
  Currently enrolled in or a recent graduate of a Bachelor's or Master's degree program in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field. 
  Strong organizational and communication skills. 
  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite. 
  A proactive and collaborative mindset.

companyInfo/companyDescription: Whether you are a supply chain expert, software engineer, engineer, customer service agent, salesperson or a finance professional, we have your dream job.
description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
  THE FUTURE IS WHAT WE MAKE IT.
  
 Project Engineer (Fresh Graduates)
  Changi, Singapore
 
  Start your career by making an impact and real connections with some of the most meaningful challenges around. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our performance culture comprised of diverse leaders, thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who are changing the future.
  
 Make the Best You.
  Working at Honeywell is not just creating incredible things. You will have the opportunity to work with our talented and friendly team of professionals and be part of a global team of future shapers.
 
  Join Us and Make an Impact.
 
   At Honeywell, we're constantly seeking ways to build a smarter, safer, and more sustainable world. Our HPS division is at the forefront of this mission, blending cutting-edge technology with engineering prowess to solve complex challenges. As a Project Engineer I, you'll be thrust into the heart of this endeavor, working alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.
 
 
  Key Responsibilities:
 
   Schedule and Milestone Development: Play a pivotal role in creating detailed schedules for projects, ensuring milestones are clear, achievable, and effectively communicated.
   Customer Relationships: Forge and nurture strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and ensuring their satisfaction with our engineering solutions.
   Technology Understanding: Stay abreast of current and emerging technologies relevant to our industry, and leverage this knowledge in your work.
   Cost Development: Assist in developing accurate project cost estimations, contributing to the overall financial planning of projects.
   Budget Analysis: Engage in thorough budget analysis to ensure projects remain within financial parameters, identifying cost-saving opportunities wherever possible.
 
 
  MUST HAVE:
 
   Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in a technical discipline
   Major in one (or more) of the following concepts: Instrumentation, Control Automation, Electrical Engineering, Electronics
   Internship experience, preferably in Oil & Gas, Petrochemical, Process Plant, Refinery industries
 
  
 WE VALUE: 
 
  The ability to follow specific action plans to promote project success and customer satisfaction. 
  A knack for promoting and enhancing customer relationships. 
  A deep understanding of technology and its application in our field. 
  Creativity and the ability to convey complex messages clearly, tailored to the audience. 
  The skill to find the right balance between demand and capacity when setting organizational priorities. 
  Initiative-takers who are consistently driven to accomplish tasks and meet goals. 
  Self-motivation and the capacity to work independently with minimal supervision. 
 
 
 About Us 
 The world is changing. And it’s a familiar story at Honeywell. Our $36 billion business was founded on a legacy of firsts spanning 130 years. We’re building a safer, smarter, and more sustainable world through our technology and software across each of our 930 sites globally. Our impact is seen in every shape and size around the world. Our solutions are felt daily in aerospace, buildings and cities, retail, chemicals and materials, safety, industrial and manufacturing, safety, and supply chains.
  
 
 Discover More 
 We’ve been innovating for more than 100 years and now we’re creating what’s next. There’s a lot more available for you to discover. Our solutions, our case studies, our #futureshapers, and so much more. Learn more at careers.honeywell.com/us/en/ 
 If you believe what happens tomorrow is determined by what we do today, you’ll love working at Honeywell. 
 The future is what we make it. So, join us and let’s do this together. 
 Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer, and we support a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.
  
 Copyright © 2023 Honeywell International Inc
  Additional Information
 
   JOB ID: HRD225257
   Category: Engineering
   Location: 17 Changi Business Park Central 1,U01-01/09, #02-01/09, #03-01/09, #04-01/09 & #05-01/05,Singapore,SINGAPORE,486073,Singapore
   Exempt

Our solutions are felt daily in aerospace, buildings and cities, retail, chemicals and materials, safety, industrial and manufacturing, safety, and supply chains.


Discover More

We’ve been innovating for more than 100 years and now we’re creating what’s next. There’s a lot more available for you to discover. Our solutions, our case studies, our #futureshapers, and so much more. Learn more at careers.honeywell.com/us/en/

If you believe what happens tomorrow is determined by what we do today, you’ll love working at Honeywell.

The future is what we make it. So, join us and let’s do this together.

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer, and we support a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.


Copyright © 2023 Honeywell International Inc

Additional Information

  • JOB ID: HRD225257
  • Category: Engineering
  • Location: 17 Changi Business Park Central 1,U01-01/09, #02-01/09, #03-01/09, #04-01/09 & #05-01/05,Singapore,SINGAPORE,486073,Singapore
  • Exempt

description:
Job Summary 
  Job Type
  Permanent 
  
  Seniority
  
  
 
  Years of Experience
  Information not provided
 


 Job Description 
 
 
  
   
    We are seeking for interested candidates who wish to pursue a career in cybersecurity to support our cyber technology and operations services to keep the Board’s computer information systems secure, to develop security programs and implement them across the Board and most importantly to build a resilient and safe cyber environment for the Board.
     
     In this role, you will use a variety of cybersecurity technical tools and skills to provide hands-on technical engineering support to keep the Board’s computer information systems secure.
     
     What We Are Looking For
     
   
   
     Passion to pursue a career in cybersecurity
     Good knowledge of information security concepts and technologies
     Specialised skills such as Web Application Firewall (WAF), SIEM and Database Activity Monitoring (DAM) will be preferred
     A meticulous eye for detail and ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment Flexible in work assignment and willing to gain experiential learning by working in diverse functions where opportunities avail 
   
   
     We welcome Diploma/ Degree graduates, without working experience to apply.
     
     To allow us gain insight into your academic background, we would request for submission of official or unofficial copy of academic transcript and any other additional documents or certificates that you believe are relevant to your application.
     
     What you can expect
     
   
   
     A challenging and rewarding career
     A variety of formal and informal training where you can hone your skills in the evolving technology landscape
     Promotion opportunities through your capability and on the job performance
     A friendly work environment with like-minded colleagues to co-create and collaborate together
     A hybrid work model where you can work remotely up to 50% of the time
     A productive yet growth-oriented workplace with flexible dress code where you are empowered to decide your appropriate outfit for the day
     Comprehensive rewards package
     Annual leave and pro-family leave
     Medical and dental benefits
     Access to recreational activities
     Position is on 2-year full time contract directly under the payroll of CPF Board with potential for emplacement into permanent position

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Omnidesk™ was founded with a free-spirited and an ambitious objective: to offer height adjustable standing desks at a revolutionary price, while leading the way for healthy-lifestyle conscious businesses.



The best ideas usually come in response to an important problem. Ours was simple: standing desks are too expensive. 



We were a bunch of small business owners/tech consultants cum retired gamers, and the ageing factor started to set in as we spend 18hrs at the desk daily. With all the hype of big companies out-fitting their offices with standing desks, we decided to try them for ourselves too. The costs however were so exorbitant and we were surprised how hard it was to find a decent standing desk that didn't require us to munch on bread and biscuits for the entire month. Even at those prices, choices and designs were also very limited. So where were the options?



Turns out the ergonomics industry is a niche market monopolized by just a couple of big companies that have been able to place extortionate markups on prices while profiting from consumers who have no other options. 



We started Omnidesk™ as a spinoff from our sister company - Aftershock PC to create an alternative. A Revolution. A disruption. 



By implementing a direct sales model, bringing design and R&D in-house, and bringing our signature Customer Service (from Aftershock PC and Prism+ sister companies) to engage with customers, we’re able to provide higher-quality, better aesthetic, more functional custom standing desks at a fraction of the going market price. 





"Why should a 1.5m tall person use the same standard-height desk as a 1.9m tall individual?"



 "Why should healthier ergonomic alternatives be priced out-of-reach to the masses and only the affluent can afford them?" 





Not all workspaces are created equal.



We believe everyone should have easy access and be able to afford a lifestyle-changing standing desk (or furniture) and even customize it to their needs. That goes from entrepreneurs with home offices, small businesses, students or just people who wants a standing desk at home for work or play.



Our straightforward mission: Bringing quality and affordable customisable ergonomics to the masses.
description:
We are currently seeking a highly motivated and HR Assistant cum PA to join our team. As a HR Assistant cum PA you will play a vital role in supporting the HR & Managing Director of our company. If you are meticulous and possess excellent organisational skills, we encourage you to apply. 
 
  
 Role Responsibilities: 
 Human Resources 
 
  Assist with employee onboarding/offboarding procedures, managing paperwork and updating personnel files (P-Files) 
  Support recruitment process, such as job postings and scheduling interviews etc 
  Assist in payroll processes to ensure accuracy and efficiency 
 
 Personal Assistant 
 
  Managing, coordinating & organize meetings, calendar, handling agenda preparation 
  Participate in meetings, ensuring precise documentation of discussions 
  Other ad-hoc duties assigned by MD 
 
 Role Requirements: 
 
  Educational Background: Currently enrolled in or recently graduated, with a focus on Business Administration, Human Resources, or a related field. 
  Organizational Skills: Demonstrates strong organizational abilities, excels in multitasking, and exhibits a meticulous attention to detail. 
  Communication Skills: Possesses excellent verbal and written communication skills. 
  Initiative and Team Collaboration: A self-driven individual who proactively contributes as a team player.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Unser Antrieb ist es, Unternehmen dabei zu unterstützen, die absoluten Top-Talente für ihre offenen Positionen zu entdecken, während wir Kandidaten dabei begleiten, ihre beruflichen Ziele in greifbare Realität zu verwandeln.

Wir setzen auf den Aufbau nachhaltiger, vertrauensvoller Beziehungen zu unseren Kunden und Kandidaten, indem wir ihre individuellen Bedürfnisse und Anforderungen nicht nur verstehen, sondern intuitiv antizipieren. Unser Fokus liegt dabei auf innovativen Lösungen, die sich von der Masse abheben.

Durch einen proaktiven Ansatz und ein ausgedehntes Netzwerk sind wir ständig auf der Suche nach aufstrebenden Talenten. Unser Ziel ist es, sicherzustellen, dass sowohl Unternehmen als auch Kandidaten von unserer wegweisenden Dienstleistung profitieren. Wir streben nach einer Win-Win-Situation, indem wir hochqualifizierte Kandidaten mit Unternehmen von heute und morgen zusammenbringen – ein Erfolgsschritt für beide Seiten.

Vertrauen Sie auf Right Search, wenn es um Ihre Personalanliegen geht. Wir setzen auf einen einzigartigen, zeitgemäßen Service und bringen mit professioneller Leichtigkeit die besten Talente und Unternehmen zusammen.
description:
Responsibilities: 
 
  Cultivate and build positive relationships within the industrial sector by collaborating closely with union leaders, members, and management partners. Strive to create a cooperative and favorable industrial atmosphere that maximizes advantages for workers. 
 
 
  Manage grievances, mediate conflicts, and engage in negotiations for collective agreements to ensure the well-being of employees. 
 
 
  Champion initiatives aimed at empowering workers to acquire new skills, boost productivity, leading to enhanced wages and an improved quality of life. 
 
 
  Strategize and execute activities of varying scales to engage members and foster positive labor-management relations. 
 
 
  
 Requirements: 
 
  Possess a degree/diploma in any discipline, with varying years of work experience. 
 
 
  Welcome applications from entry-level candidates. 
 
 
  Demonstrate exceptional interpersonal skills and effective communication across all levels. 
 
 
  Showcase strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities. 
 
 
  Adaptability to think on one's feet. 
 
 
  Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team. 
 
 
  
 We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified

description:
L'Oréal Graduate Trainee - Commerical is a 12 months full-time program designed for ambitious, compassionate, resilient and agile in learning Gen Z who is looking for an exciting opportunity to kickstart your career in the Commercial, Retail field
 
  By joining our program, you will not only have the chance to discover the beauty industry but also be exposed to various business models, build your network, and gain an overview of L'Oréal, our culture, and our working environment. This experience will prepare you for the next steps in your career.
 
  Division: Consumer Products (L’OREAL PARIS, MAYBELLINE, GARNIER)
  Function: Commercial
  Role: Retail Excellence Assistant
  Job Mission:
 
   Manage Category and Brand projects – mainly MAKE UP
   Compile and clean up data retrieved from total SAPMENA. Upkeep in available dashboard.
   Manage stakeholders within BD and Merchandising community
   Support curation of make-up category guideline - mix of brands and channels requirements
   Support brand specific merchandising guideline in accordance to global vision and zone strategy – POG, imagery, right point of navigation that works in market’s retail requirement
   Monitor execution in market to deliver best practices. Compile and share trade executions within the community.
 
 
  -
  At L’Oréal, there is never a dull day, the beauty lies in the freedom to go beyond with our empowering entrepreneurial culture. You will be given responsibilities, goals to work on supporting business operations and delivering the real impact to brands, people, consumer, customers, suppliers, and other partners.
  We are looking for:
 
   Bachelor's or Master's degree holder in any major, less than 1 year of work experience.
   Fully committed for full-time job for 1 year can start working since April 2024
 
  Who have:
 
   Strong analytical skills:
   
     able to use data (numbers and consumer insights) to identify trends, understand brand & market performance to draw strategic solutions
     tackle problem solving per market and derive in creative yet rational solutions
   
   Project management
   
     Keen to work with teams of very diverse culture and bringing them together as a community to ensure project continuity
     Agility to work in different time zones and manage urgencies unprecedentedly
   
   Interpersonal skills
   
     Able to motivate oneself in a zone environment with independent working style
     Collaborate effectively across different functions (DMI, brand, commercial, country stakeholders)
   
 
  It’s a PLUS if you also can:
 
   Data analysis & visualization with Power BI
 
  Further career opportunity:
 
   Chance to earn Fast track to join our SeedZ Management Trainee Program base on your performance.
 
 
  -
 
  About Singapore Office: an Regional Office of 5 entities.
  Malaysia-Singapore
  L'Oréal Malaysia-Singapore joined forces to provide beauty for 38 million consumer with diverse beauty needs in both Malaysia & Singapore. With a strong dedicated team of beauty creators, sharing the same passion, L'Oréal MY-SG is ready to create the beauty that moves the world.
  SAPMENA Zone
  South Asia Pacific, Middle East & North Africa (SAPMENA) is home to 40% of the world's population & some of the fastest-growing economies. Headquartered in Singapore, we have over 6,800 diverse talents in 15 subsidiaries with 34 International Brands, 4 factories & 2 research centres. As the leading beauty tech company, we offer endless exciting career opportunities.
  TR APAC
  Known as the “6th continent”, L’Oréal Travel Retail is the pioneer and long-established leader in this borderless and dynamic territory with a mission of providing beauty products to “Global Shoppers” around the world.
  Travel Retail sells across multiple channels, including the world’s largest airport, duty-free shops in cities, and now more than ever via e-commerce. TR APAC has a strong presence in the largest operating duty-free shop in Hainan, China. As a result, Chinese international travelers are the mainstream global shoppers in our business.
 
  Travel Retail Marketing roles requires conversational Mandarin
 
  LID
  L'Oréal International Distribution (LID) is a new Go-To-Market, multi-brand structure, which will mainly work regional or national distributors and, in specific cases, directly with certain regional retailers or directly via e-commerce (multi – country sites).

 


 You can apply to up to three jobs within a rolling 30-day window. 
 You cannot withdraw your application once you applied, so please make sure to choose a job that matches your dreams. 
 Please visit "Your Application Space" to see the jobs you have already applied to. 
 Please don’t create another account with a different email. If you do so, your account might be merged and your application record will be deleted.

Headquartered in Singapore, we have over 6,800 diverse talents in 15 subsidiaries with 34 International Brands, 4 factories & 2 research centres. As the leading beauty tech company, we offer endless exciting career opportunities.

TR APAC

Known as the “6th continent”, L’Oréal Travel Retail is the pioneer and long-established leader in this borderless and dynamic territory with a mission of providing beauty products to “Global Shoppers” around the world.

Travel Retail sells across multiple channels, including the world’s largest airport, duty-free shops in cities, and now more than ever via e-commerce. TR APAC has a strong presence in the largest operating duty-free shop in Hainan, China. As a result, Chinese international travelers are the mainstream global shoppers in our business.

  • Travel Retail Marketing roles requires conversational Mandarin

LID

L'Oréal International Distribution (LID) is a new Go-To-Market, multi-brand structure, which will mainly work regional or national distributors and, in specific cases, directly with certain regional retailers or directly via e-commerce (multi – country sites).

description:
Anytime Fitness Tampines Invites You to Join Our Professional Team
At Anytime Fitness Tampines, a thrilling career opportunity awaits.
We are actively seeking a dedicated Sales Representative to enhance our dynamic team and contribute to our mission immediately.
This opportunity is especially appealing to recent graduates eager to demonstrate their potential in a vibrant environment.
Your Qualifications:
- Proficiency in English.
- Fresh graduates are welcome; prior experience is not a prerequisite.
- Competent in Microsoft Office and telephony.
- Ideally, possess basic skills in clerical/administrative support or a related field.
- Radiate a friendly and approachable demeanor.
- Exhibit a strong commitment to time management and punctuality.
Your Role and Responsibilities:
- Provide a courteous welcome to all guests, both in person and over the phone, while adeptly managing inquiries.
- Conduct thorough and engaging tours of our club facilities.
- Offer efficient support to the management in daily tasks, acting as a dependable assistant.
- Effectively present membership packages to prospective clients.
- Drive the sales of our retail products through strategic approaches.
- Engage enthusiastically in both digital and community marketing efforts.
- Respond to inquiries with the skill of a social media specialist.
- Maintain the facility in immaculate and orderly condition.
Benefits of Joining Our Team
- Benefit from a lucrative commission structure.
- Avail yourself of Annual Wage Supplement
- Earn bonuses based on performance.
- Advance your career with our growth opportunities.

description:
About Excel Hardware
A Singapore Brand - EXCEL envisions creating productive and customized experiences for our users at cost competitive prices.
We endeavour to consistently develop durable, reliable, space optimized and robust hardware products and services for the convenience of our users.
Safety & Sustainability - Excel prides itself in excellence by not only producing high-quality products but also in its values. As a brand that strives to always deliver their best, they understand that sustainability is the key to longer-term success.
Job Description
1. Develop and implement a communication strategy that includes social media outreach and social media content creation.
2. Research and write content for the company website, infographics, blogs, and newsletters
3. Plan events for networking sessions with clients
4. Internal communication: To strengthen the existing standard operation procedure of the company and make recommendations etc.
5. External communication: To improve brand awareness of the company in social media e.g. Tik Tok
6. Arrange Zoom or face to face appointment and follow up enquiry for existing or new customers
7. Assist with administrative tasks when needed

description:
Description
  We're growing our sales team and we're looking to bring on an Account Executive in Singapore, with a focus on commercial sales in India & Philippines. You will be at the forefront of our efforts to expand our growing business. Challenge yourself by selling the intrinsic value of software solutions to our customers. The primary responsibility will be to manage and close a pipeline of software license opportunities, while working closely with other Apryse resources and presales teams. Account Executives at our company learn about the opportunities and challenges facing Product Managers – both at software companies and those building products for internal use by traditional bricks and mortar companies.
  Responsibilities
 
   Qualify and manage new sales leads through the full sales cycle.
   Identify opportunities that would benefit from our technology suite using a consultative sales approach.
   Work closely with Solution Engineers in gathering requirements and proposing high value solutions.
   Proactively maintain relationships with your accounts and identify future opportunities.
   Gain a deep understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of competing products, and effectively illustrate the value of our high-quality/market-leading solutions to prospects.
   Recognize high value sales opportunities.
   Effectively gather intelligence on markets, prospects, and the competition using various resources.
 
  Requirements
 
   2+ years’ experience selling complex B2B software product(s).
   Good negotiation skills.
   Excellent communication and presentation skills, particularly via e-mail and by phone.
   A college or university degree. Technical disciplines or backgrounds are preferred.
   Full professional fluency in English.
   Prior experience in selling to the Indian and Philippines markets considered an asset.
   Demonstrated success using a consultative approach with key business and technical executives, especially CTOs, VPs of Product Management, and Development/Engineering.
   Consistent history of overachievement, with demonstrated success of multi-year quota achievement.
   An accountable team player with a tenacious drive to win.
   Experienced in using Salesforce CRM to manage sales cycle.
 
  Benefits
 
   Competitive salary commensurate with experience & qualifications.
   A comprehensive extended benefits package including health, dental and vision for you and your family that starts from day one.
   A great team environment and resources, supporting you to do the best work of your life and providing unlimited career growth potential.
   Highly autonomous and entrepreneurial environment.
   Annual recurring WFH allowance for you to purchase items you need for your home office.
   On going support for learning development so you can master your craft.
   Diverse and inclusive workplace where we all learn from each other.
   Excellent work-life balance with a flexible remote work environment!
   Company Description
 
  Apryse is the industry-leading provider of document software development (SDK) technology powering everything from traditional desktop software to innovative web and mobile applications. With a broad international portfolio of combined companies, products, and leading technologies, we are actively changing the way the world works with documents to make work better and life simpler. We are also a fast-growing company, chosen as one of Canada's Top Small & Medium Employers of 2022 by Mediacorp Canada Inc and selected among Canada’s best employers for recent graduates with its addition to the 2022 Career Directory.
  Since having secured a $95M strategic growth investment in 2019, we have grown from approximately 50 employees to over 370, made eleven acquisitions, and in 2021, Thoma Bravo, the top private investment firm in the world for software, came on board with another strategic growth investment.
  Customers like IBM, Autodesk, DocuSign, Boeing, Microsoft (and many more!) come to us to realize their web and mobile strategies for document management, editing, and collaboration as the #1-ranked commercial document SDK of choice for companies worldwide. As a result, you can find our document technology in thousands of solutions, including those of household names, used by millions across virtually every industry. Our XODO app alone has 25M unique installs - and counting - and the highest ratings among PDF productivity apps on the largest online app marketplaces.
  Internally, we foster an atmosphere of opportunity, growth, and success for every individual amidst an exciting and challenging entrepreneurial culture. Career progression is based on merit, not tenure. Every member of our vibrant team is empowered to be a contributor, innovator, and successful leader.
  Ready to join our team?
  If you are interested in helping Apryse deliver on its commitments and taking your career to the next level, we invite you to apply online now.
  Please note that due to the high volume of applications received, only short-listed candidates will be contacted.
  We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.
  Thank you for your interest in Apryse!
descriptionHTML:
Description

We're growing our sales team and we're looking to bring on an Account Executive in Singapore, with a focus on commercial sales in India & Philippines. You will be at the forefront of our efforts to expand our growing business. Challenge yourself by selling the intrinsic value of software solutions to our customers. The primary responsibility will be to manage and close a pipeline of software license opportunities, while working closely with other Apryse resources and presales teams. Account Executives at our company learn about the opportunities and challenges facing Product Managers – both at software companies and those building products for internal use by traditional bricks and mortar companies.

Responsibilities

  • Qualify and manage new sales leads through the full sales cycle.
  • Identify opportunities that would benefit from our technology suite using a consultative sales approach.
  • Work closely with Solution Engineers in gathering requirements and proposing high value solutions.
  • Proactively maintain relationships with your accounts and identify future opportunities.
  • Gain a deep understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of competing products, and effectively illustrate the value of our high-quality/market-leading solutions to prospects.
  • Recognize high value sales opportunities.
  • Effectively gather intelligence on markets, prospects, and the competition using various resources.

Requirements

  • 2+ years’ experience selling complex B2B software product(s).
  • Good negotiation skills.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, particularly via e-mail and by phone.
  • A college or university degree. Technical disciplines or backgrounds are preferred.
  • Full professional fluency in English.
  • Prior experience in selling to the Indian and Philippines markets considered an asset.
  • Demonstrated success using a consultative approach with key business and technical executives, especially CTOs, VPs of Product Management, and Development/Engineering.
  • Consistent history of overachievement, with demonstrated success of multi-year quota achievement.
  • An accountable team player with a tenacious drive to win.
  • Experienced in using Salesforce CRM to manage sales cycle.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary commensurate with experience & qualifications.
  • A comprehensive extended benefits package including health, dental and vision for you and your family that starts from day one.
  • A great team environment and resources, supporting you to do the best work of your life and providing unlimited career growth potential.
  • Highly autonomous and entrepreneurial environment.
  • Annual recurring WFH allowance for you to purchase items you need for your home office.
  • On going support for learning development so you can master your craft.
  • Diverse and inclusive workplace where we all learn from each other.
  • Excellent work-life balance with a flexible remote work environment!
  • Company Description

Apryse is the industry-leading provider of document software development (SDK) technology powering everything from traditional desktop software to innovative web and mobile applications. With a broad international portfolio of combined companies, products, and leading technologies, we are actively changing the way the world works with documents to make work better and life simpler. We are also a fast-growing company, chosen as one of Canada's Top Small & Medium Employers of 2022 by Mediacorp Canada Inc and selected among Canada’s best employers for recent graduates with its addition to the 2022 Career Directory.

Since having secured a $95M strategic growth investment in 2019, we have grown from approximately 50 employees to over 370, made eleven acquisitions, and in 2021, Thoma Bravo, the top private investment firm in the world for software, came on board with another strategic growth investment.

Customers like IBM, Autodesk, DocuSign, Boeing, Microsoft (and many more!) come to us to realize their web and mobile strategies for document management, editing, and collaboration as the #1-ranked commercial document SDK of choice for companies worldwide. As a result, you can find our document technology in thousands of solutions, including those of household names, used by millions across virtually every industry. Our XODO app alone has 25M unique installs - and counting - and the highest ratings among PDF productivity apps on the largest online app marketplaces.

Internally, we foster an atmosphere of opportunity, growth, and success for every individual amidst an exciting and challenging entrepreneurial culture. Career progression is based on merit, not tenure. Every member of our vibrant team is empowered to be a contributor, innovator, and successful leader.

Ready to join our team?

If you are interested in helping Apryse deliver on its commitments and taking your career to the next level, we invite you to apply online now.

Please note that due to the high volume of applications received, only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.

Thank you for your interest in Apryse!

Our team is expanding and we want someone who aspire for more and have a do whatever it takes mentality.

We are a leading Sales and Marketing agency that specialise in face-to-face marketing with proven track records. We work with renown local clients in the Telco and Banking industry, becoming one of the leading sales force over the years.

Try new things. Think outside the box. We celebrate your achievements and your birthday too!

We have travel opportunities too!

     Singapore

     Management Trainee Programme

     3 months
   
  
 
 
  
    Job Description
  
  
   
     We are seeking an enthusiastic and driven individual to join our dynamic team as Maritime Management Trainee. This is a remarkable opportunity for fresh graduates to kick-start their career in the shipping industry. As a Maritime Management Trainee with AAL, you will receive comprehensive training in various areas, empowering you to excel in this exciting field.
   
   
   
     Key Responsibilities: Over the 18-month traineeship, the objective is for the trainee to develop a comprehensive understanding of AAL's services and clients. Focusing on building comprehensive, interdisciplinary knowledge of each department's responsibility, including Chartering, Operations, Finance, QHSE, and Engineering. 
   
   
    
     Participate in on-the-job training and rotational assignments in different departments. 
    
    
     Collaborate with team members to support day-to-day operations.
    
    
      Assist in the development and implementation of strategic initiatives.
    
    
      Engage in continuous learning and development opportunities.
    
   
   
   
     What We Offer:
   
   
    
      Extensive training in all aspects of MPP shipping services to equip you with essential skills.
    
    
      Mentorship from experienced professionals who will guide you throughout your learning journey.
    
    
      Opportunities to work in an international team, fostering cultural diversity and global collaboration.
    
    
      Exposure to a globally operating company, providing insights into the shipping industry's vital role in international trade.
    
    
      Working from an overseas office.
    
    
      Continuous learning and development opportunities to support your professional growth.
    
   
  
 
 
  
    Job Requirement
  
  
   
     Qualifications:
   
   
    
      Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Maritime Studies, Logistics, International trade, Shipping related engineering fields etc.).
    
    
      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
    
    
      Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.
    
    
      Eagerness to learn and grow within the shipping industry.
    
    
      Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. Join our team and embark on a rewarding career in the shipping industry as a Trainee.
      
    
   
   
    
   
    Make a significant impact in the global trade landscape, working with a diverse and dedicated team. Apply now and take the first step towards an exciting future!
   
  
 
 
  
    About Austral Asia Line Pte Ltd
  
  
    Shipowning / Operating
  
   Established in 1995, Austral Asia Line (AAL) is a leading breakbulk, project cargo and heavy-lift shipping company. Our customers represent industries like energy, oil & gas, mining, forestry, leisure, agriculture and construction – and our vision is to be the best at what we do and create sustainable growth and an unparalleled reputation, built on trust and service.

description:
Peak Ocean is looking for candidate's in the oil and gas sector, preferably in FPSO or Offshore processing facilities. 
 12th March, 2024 
  Purpose: To independently handle the piping activities, prepare, manage, and produce the critical engineering deliverables for the assigned project (that may include short-term assignment to Construction, Commissioning, and Offshore) effectively and efficiently according to the specified technical requirements, timelines and within budget, and deal independently with and resolve all the issues of the project, and provide guidance to the assigned members.  Responsibilities: 
 
  Works independently to perform the assigned task and develops solutions to technical/engineering and related problems by analyzing the issue or data, interpreting the analysis, and evaluating various options/measures using experience, precedents, and professional references with minimal or no supervision or guidance. 
  Understand technical requirements of project specifications and standards, local statutory and regulatory requirements, Classification society requirements, and applicable codes and standard industry practices to carry out the piping activities and prepare piping deliverables for assigned projects. 
  Prepares the piping design specification, and criteria for pipe supporting and pipe support specification by using and modifying the COMPANY corporate specifications suitably to match the project-specific requirements. 
  Prepares piping stress analysis specification by using the COMPANY corporate specifications and modifying them suitably to meet the project-specific requirements. 
  Prepares piping standard detail drawings using the COMPANY corporate piping standard detail drawings and modifies them where required to meet the project requirement. 
  Prepares piping fabrication specification, piping insulation specification, and flange management specification (bolt torquing and tensioning) by using the COMPANY corporate specifications and modifying these to meet the project requirements. 
  Prepares bill of materials for piping bulk items (like pipe, flanges, and fittings), valves, piping specialty items, gaskets, stud bolts and nuts, and pipe support materials. Provides piping weight inputs for weight control reports. 
  Prepares data sheets for process-critical and non-critical piping specialty items, obtaining the process parameters required for the design and manufacturing of process-critical items. 
  Enable to review supplier drawings/documents and share the relevant data with the engineering contractor to get it incorporated in piping layout design. And works closely with engineering contractors to resolve technical issues. 
  Prepares equipment layout, piping routing layout, skid package interfaces, and tie-ins for topsides, reviews piping isometrics, and participates in 3D Model reviews. 
  As part of hull marine activities, provides inputs for Conversion and repair specification, prepares to rip out plans, machinery arrangement layout, and piping arrangement guidance drawings for hull marine contractor to perform the work accordingly 
  Carries out the piping stress analysis of all critical lines using the project-specific data and environmental conditions at the fabrication yard, during transport, and at the operating location of the facility to satisfy the project and applicable code requirements. 
  Coordinates with engineering contractor to implement flexibility analysis findings in selecting piping support regarding support type, loads on restraints, and special support requirements. 
  Prepares data sheets and details for spring supports taking inputs from stress analysis reports. 
  Carries out surge analysis for cargo offloading system, sea water lift pump system, and fire water system and reviews the contractor-prepared documents and piping arrangement layout drawings.
   Reviews the isometric of all critical lines to verify that the support locations and support type align with the flexibility analysis report and are adequate to withstand the expected loading conditions. 
  Provides technical support and advice to construction yard and commissioning work at the site. Where necessary, provides off-site support and guidance. 
  When assigned to the construction site, checks and verifies the piping supports are constructed and installed as per isometrics and support drawing details ensuring support functionality in operating condition and providing resolutions to piping material queries originating from the construction site. 
  Supports the Lead Piping Engineer and assists in preparing lessons learned during the course of execution of the project for further processing through MIMS. 
  Shares the knowledge and experience with team members and guides the engineers in carrying out the assigned task in right and efficiently. 
 
  Responsibilties: 
  
 
  Bachelor in Mechanical Engineering or Master of Engineering. Alternatively Diploma in Mechanical Engineering with relevant years of experience. 
  Minimum 15 years of relevant working experience in piping engineering in the oil and gas sector, preferably in FPSO or Offshore processing facilities for graduates or a minimum of 12 years of relevant working experience for diploma holders. For a Masters’s degree holder, at least 10 years of relevant working experience. 
  Knowledge in MS Office, AutoCAD, E3D, Navisworks, CAESAR-II. 
  Mainly in the office environment. Occasional visits may be required to supplier/manufacturing facilities. Visits or short-term posting to fabrication yard, project site, or offshore facility.

For a Masters’s degree holder, at least 10 years of relevant working experience.
  • Knowledge in MS Office, AutoCAD, E3D, Navisworks, CAESAR-II.

positionName: Senior Piping Marine Engineer (Layout and Stress Support)

description:
Hey! Hey!
Everything that you have always WANTED is on the other side of fear!
Being one of the leaders in the Marketing Agencies in S.E.A., Our mission is to assist local clients to improve Brand recognition, continuously grow their customer base, and provide the best marketing solutions. We work differently, we focus our resources on the people, on our team. Our people are our greatest asset. Development on personal growth, to soft skills, we never fail to see happy teammates walking in and out of the office smiling.
What is in it for YOU:
- Overseas traveling exposure trips
- Positive vibes and enjoyable team atmosphere with frequent team-building activities
- Soft skills upgrade
- Leadership skills development
- Attractive income
What your day to day looks like:
- Managing sales and operations through on-site assistance
- Be involved in client’s marketing through business development

description:
We are looking for passionate developers and designers to join our team. If you are excited about building amazing Mixed Reality experiences, please send your resume to hello@serl.io. We would love to talk with you. 
    
  
 
 
 
  This is a hybrid internship – based in Singapore, for a 3D Digital Animator. The intern will work with the lead 3D Designer to produce 3D assets for Mixed Reality simulations. The intern will also support customer meetings, testing and interface with the Mixed Reality Developers to ensure quality and accuracy of assets.
   
   
   Requirements: Final year student or recent graduate (Diploma or NITEC) in Digital Arts, Digital Animation or equivalent. This internship will be from July – November 2024 
   
   
    At least 2 years experience with 3D Modeling, Texturing and Animating in Blender or Maya.
    
   
    At least 1 year experience with 3D rigging especially for human models.
    
   
    At least 1 year experience with 3D human animation (using armature and blend shapes).
    
   
    Experience with Unity
    
   
    Basic understanding of AR/VR and 3D Photogrammetry.
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     
      
        Serl.io is an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate and will take affirmative action measures to ensure against discrimination in employment, recruitment, advertisements for employment, compensation, termination, upgrading, promotions, and other conditions of employment against any employee or job applicant on the bases of race, color, gender, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability, veteran’s status, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.

Here at PAG, we believe in the spirit of perseverance and integrity where we push our advisers to deliver high-quality work to our clients. Not to mention, providing essential training to help these individuals achieve a successful career with us.
description:
✅ Want to have a career with work-life integration with working remotely?✅ Want to be recognized and rewarded for your work performance?✅ Want to be nurtured with Leadership capabilities?
As part of PAG Advisors exciting growth plans in the financial services industry, we are looking for ambitious individuals to join us as our Junior Financial Consultant.
You’ll develop your skills for connecting and building relationships with prospective clients as well as marketing the professional services we offer to the right audience through a comprehensive 3-month training program.
What you’ll do:

 Develop engaging and compelling content for various marketing channels, including social media, blogs, emails, and website.
 Participate in professional development training provided so as to uphold the delivery of the highest standard of advisory services.
 Understand and identify our clients' financial shortfall and recommend solutions.
 Maintain client relationships by providing support and information.
 Upon the end of the internship, we will provide you with the opportunity to continue working with us full-time.

Who are we looking for:

 Strong management and communication skills
 Ability to work independently and manage time effectively
 Keen to learn and highly motivated

Sales & Marketing Associate
About Us:Join our innovative team and be part of a company that values creativity, growth, and collaboration. We're looking for passionate individuals who are ready to take on the challenge of driving sales and creating impactful marketing strategies.
What You'll Do:As a Sales & Marketing Associate, you will be involved in exciting projects that include:

 Developing and executing creative marketing campaigns.
 Identifying and pursuing new business opportunities.
 Building and maintaining strong relationships with clients.
