companyInfo/companyDescription: AIA Group Limited known as AIA is the largest independent public listed pan-Asian life insurance group.
description:
Are you looking for a career that’s #NotJustAnotherJob?
At AIA, we recognise that true progress requires individuals to believe in their own potential to grow and positively impact their own lives and the lives of others. Here, we nurture your leadership potential and empower you to gobeyond your limits to excel.In this role, you will experience holistic growth spanning across your personal, professional, and financial development, all tailored to your journey while making a positive difference to the lives of the people and communities we serve.
Grow personally by achieving work and life ambitionsWe offer comprehensive training and mentorship to chart your pathway to success. Our accredited training programmes are designed to help you acquire the best knowledge and skills to succeed in this career. From sales excellence to leadership essentials for leading your own team, we are committed to developing the best version of you, all via AIA’s unique approach of encouraging courage, clarity and humanity.
Grow professionally to expand your career prospectsWith 1 in 4 of our consultants qualifying for Million Dollar Round Table (MDRT) status, you will be surrounded by a community of successful individuals who will encourage your financial success. Learn on the job from experienced agency leaders who offer valuable knowledge, insightful advice, coaching and mentorship to help you accomplishyour career goals while helping people plan for a better future.
Grow financially for a secure futureEmbark on a rewarding career under career schemes designed to meet varied needs. Depending on the schemes, you may receive monthly allowances during your first two years as a new consultant, or attractive compensation packages including first year commissions and bonuses, or benefit from renewal income generated from renewal year commissions and long-term compensations.
We invite you to join us at AIA as a Financial Services Consultant, where we believe in your limitless potential for growth.
Benefits

 Performance-based incentives such as allowance, commission and overseas trips²
 Industry and company recognition, e.g., Million Dollar Round Table and Top Financial Services Consultants Award
 Continuous professional development through a comprehensive training and development programme
 Opportunity to develop your leadership and management skills by building your very own agency and leading a team of professional Financial Services Consultants
 Incentives to be earned. Trips to enjoy. Friends to be made. Time for work and time for play. Sounds like a dream job? Then you’ll fit right in at AIA. We believe that a successful career goes beyond monetary rewards.

Job Responsibilities

 Providing financial advice based on clients’ financial and protection needs
 Providing recommendation to clients on wealth accumulation and legacy planning

Job Requirements

 Minimum full certificate in GCE 'A' Level, International Baccalaureate Diploma qualification, diploma awarded by a polytechnic in Singapore or equivalent.
 At least 21 years old (Due to regulatory requirements)

At the AIA, every day is a chance to make a real difference. Whether it’s medical or financial protection, you are empowered to help your clients prepare for life’s unexpected emergencies and help them reach their goals so that they can be life confident.
To join us and Believe in Better, send in your application!
SP-MGZEST-CTSAuthorised representative of AIA Singapore Private Limited (Reg. No. 201106386R)About AIA SingaporeHaving served generations of Singaporeans for more than 90 years since 1931, we understand what matters to them most – good health and being financially prepared for every stage in life.
Placing our customers at the heart of everything we do, we want to make a positive impact in their lives as a trusted partner. As their needs and demands evolve, we continuously transform ourselves to adapt to meet these needs. We care about our customers, and to support them throughout their lives, we help them plan ahead to ensure that they are protected financially, while empowering them to lead an active and healthy life so that they can celebrate more moments of joy with their family.
It is this commitment that led to our brand promise of enabling Healthier, Longer, Better Lives, propelling us to launch innovative solutions that truly supports their physical and financial wellbeing.
This promise also drives our team of staff and financial services consultants / insurance representatives to deliver our best every day in our attempt to put our customers first, so that we can be Singapore’s pre-eminent life insurer, recognised for our personalised service and best practices.
As we continue to innovate to meet our customers’ long-term needs, we look forward to being an integral part of their life journey, enabling them to live healthier, live longer, live better!
'Services, #Financial Consultant, #Financial Advisor, #Wealth Manager, #Wealth Planner, #Investment Advisor'
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $6,000.00 - $10,000.00 per month
Supplemental pay types:

 Attendance bonus
 Commission pay
 Performance bonus
 Retention bonus
 Signing bonus

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Singapore 048616
descriptionHTML:
Are you looking for a career that’s #NotJustAnotherJob?

At AIA, we recognise that true progress requires individuals to believe in their own potential to grow and positively impact their own lives and the lives of others. Here, we nurture your leadership potential and empower you to go
beyond your limits to excel.
In this role, you will experience holistic growth spanning across your personal, professional, and financial development, all tailored to your journey while making a positive difference to the lives of the people and communities we serve.

Grow personally by achieving work and life ambitions
We offer comprehensive training and mentorship to chart your pathway to success. Our accredited training programmes are designed to help you acquire the best knowledge and skills to succeed in this career. From sales excellence to leadership essentials for leading your own team, we are committed to developing the best version of you, all via AIA’s unique approach of encouraging courage, clarity and humanity.

Grow professionally to expand your career prospects
With 1 in 4 of our consultants qualifying for Million Dollar Round Table (MDRT) status, you will be surrounded by a community of successful individuals who will encourage your financial success. Learn on the job from experienced agency leaders who offer valuable knowledge, insightful advice, coaching and mentorship to help you accomplish
your career goals while helping people plan for a better future.

Grow financially for a secure future
Embark on a rewarding career under career schemes designed to meet varied needs. Depending on the schemes, you may receive monthly allowances during your first two years as a new consultant, or attractive compensation packages including first year commissions and bonuses, or benefit from renewal income generated from renewal year commissions and long-term compensations.

We invite you to join us at AIA as a Financial Services Consultant, where we believe in your limitless potential for growth.

Benefits

  • Performance-based incentives such as allowance, commission and overseas trips²
  • Industry and company recognition, e.g., Million Dollar Round Table and Top Financial Services Consultants Award
  • Continuous professional development through a comprehensive training and development programme
  • Opportunity to develop your leadership and management skills by building your very own agency and leading a team of professional Financial Services Consultants
  • Incentives to be earned. Trips to enjoy. Friends to be made. Time for work and time for play. Sounds like a dream job? Then you’ll fit right in at AIA. We believe that a successful career goes beyond monetary rewards.

Job Responsibilities

  • Providing financial advice based on clients’ financial and protection needs
  • Providing recommendation to clients on wealth accumulation and legacy planning

Job Requirements

  • Minimum full certificate in GCE 'A' Level, International Baccalaureate Diploma qualification, diploma awarded by a polytechnic in Singapore or equivalent.
  • At least 21 years old (Due to regulatory requirements)

At the AIA, every day is a chance to make a real difference. Whether it’s medical or financial protection, you are empowered to help your clients prepare for life’s unexpected emergencies and help them reach their goals so that they can be life confident.

To join us and Believe in Better, send in your application!

SP-MGZEST-CTS
Authorised representative of AIA Singapore Private Limited (Reg. No. 201106386R)
About AIA Singapore
Having served generations of Singaporeans for more than 90 years since 1931, we understand what matters to them most – good health and being financially prepared for every stage in life.

Placing our customers at the heart of everything we do, we want to make a positive impact in their lives as a trusted partner. As their needs and demands evolve, we continuously transform ourselves to adapt to meet these needs. We care about our customers, and to support them throughout their lives, we help them plan ahead to ensure that they are protected financially, while empowering them to lead an active and healthy life so that they can celebrate more moments of joy with their family.

It is this commitment that led to our brand promise of enabling Healthier, Longer, Better Lives, propelling us to launch innovative solutions that truly supports their physical and financial wellbeing.

This promise also drives our team of staff and financial services consultants / insurance representatives to deliver our best every day in our attempt to put our customers first, so that we can be Singapore’s pre-eminent life insurer, recognised for our personalised service and best practices.

As we continue to innovate to meet our customers’ long-term needs, we look forward to being an integral part of their life journey, enabling them to live healthier, live longer, live better!

'Services, #Financial Consultant, #Financial Advisor, #Wealth Manager, #Wealth Planner, #Investment Advisor'

description:
We are out looking for the most outstanding candidate to represent the clients we work partner with, providing fitting solutions to meet specific requirements and drive results.
We are looking for people who will “walk the talk”. There is no such thing as a mundane routine here! Be prepared for an unparalleled environment!
Why choose us?
1. Career Development

 We are determined to provide you with the necessary resources, mentorship, and growth opportunities to fuel your professional advancement

2. Travel Opportunities

 We encourage collaboration among our offices and teams worldwide. As a result, team members may have opportunities to work on projects that involve travel to other cities or countries, fostering a deeper understanding of diverse cultures and business practices

3. Personal Growth

 We offer a wide range of learning and development opportunities, including workshops, training sessions, and mentorship programs. We believe that growth happens when we push our boundaries

Who are we looking for?

 A growth mindset - the belief that abilities and intelligence can be developed through dedication and hard work
 Team members with the attitude that is more likely to share knowledge, seek guidance from others, and contribute to a supportive and knowledge-sharing culture within the organization

companyInfo/companyDescription:
We are agents of change. We start by turning convention on its head. Family owned, beholden to no one, so we can forge our own path - different and authentic. Never satisfied, we constantly strive to find a better way. We solve problems that others choose to ignore with ingenious new technologies that defy convention and simply work better. 

In 2012 we were 3120 people. Today we're over 14,000. Our future is bright and the next few years are set to be our busiest yet as we continue to innovate and disrupt with new categories, new machines, and launching more demo stores all over the world. This gives us the opportunity to bring all our technologies together into a single product. 

We never have and never will stand still.

#InsideDyson

    Dyson is a global technology enterprise. We solve the problems others choose to ignore, with surprising new inventions that defy convention and simply work better. We’re driven by progress and thrive on the challenge of relentless improvement. We’re growing fast and our ambition is huge – more categories, more locations and more people.
    Our scale and rapid growth make Dyson rich in new opportunities. We value new ideas and diverse perspectives, so our people are trusted with real work and responsibility from the outset. You’ll develop fast and have the chance to move into different business areas and regions. And you’ll be part of a global network of like-minded people – a community that supports and learns from each other.
    Power Systems is a global function that designs and develops Dyson’s internal technologies that enable most of our products. The team has experts in wide range of areas (mechanical, electrical, software, project management) and is responsible of the development from early stages through to production.
    Engineering Analysis team within Power Systems is responsible for the performance, simulation, analysis, and experimental verification of the technology project. The team consists of experts in fields of turbomachinery, thermodynamics, acoustics, vibrations, rotor dynamics, fluid dynamics, structural analysis, and data analysis. Utilizing the state-of-the-art advanced analysis methods to ensure the design is optimised and robust for maximum performance.
    About the role
    We are looking for a Graduate Engineering Analysis Engineer to work within our Engineering Analysis function inside Power Systems, to apply her/his skills and experience in Fluid Dynamics/Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) and/or Structural Dynamics/Finite Element Analysis (FEA) to deliver our next generation Dyson internally developed technologies and their product integration. He/she will also use analytical techniques to add insight into experimental results, driving early development concepts, supporting projects with appropriate technology readiness and advancement. In addition, the candidate will be expected to continually improve and develop new techniques and methodologies, to build the capability of Power Systems group and Dyson as a whole. Some of your tasks could include:
   
     Generate innovative concepts for new technologies using analytical techniques including CFD/FEA and experiments.
     Responsible for activities such as thermal management, aerodynamic/acoustic performance, structural robustness, rotor dynamics of the technology through design, development, and delivery.
     Responsible to develop air paths and cooling options for mechanical, electrical and electronic components of the technology system to achieve robustness and high performance.
     Responsible for supporting implementation of design concepts from component design through to finished assembly. This would include analysis, product concepts, dimensional verification, and general demonstration of the use of core engineering disciplines.
     Responsible for leading the development of design concepts through prototype hardware procurement, assembly, testing, data analysis, fault analysis, problem solving, and design refinement. This may require some direction of technical support personnel.
     Considers and seeks out the impact of his/her actions within the team. Actively seeks collaboration with internal and external team members
     Ability and engagement in transferring experience and training to design engineers and junior specialists – best-practices establishing and sharing.
     Performs other duties as requested, directed, or assigned. Deliver product focused technology projects to the Dyson range plan.
   
    Our Graduate Programme
    Our graduate programme is designed to help you drive your career at Dyson with a two-year journey to help you grow both personally and professionally. We’ll help you to improve your knowledge and support your future career progression with workshops to give you baseline soft skills in addition to technical training. Our unique experiential journey provides a framework so you can reach your full potential with leadership talks, lunch-and-learns and more. You may have the opportunity to rotate into a variety of teams to support your professional development.
    About you
    Our graduate roles are competitive and delivering the next generation of Dyson technology is tough, so you will need to be:
   
     Graduating by August 2024
     Working towards or have achieved a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Mechanical or Aeronautical Engineering or equivalent (other relevant engineering disciplines will be considered)
     Fundamental knowledge in one or more of the areas: structural dynamics, thermodynamics, fluid dynamics, strength of materials, vibro- or aero- acoustics
     Demonstrated ability to investigate, model and provide critical insights into complex physical phenomena such as aerodynamic performance, noise, vibration, vibro-acoustics, aero-acoustics, or thermal management.
     Ability to perform thermodynamic heat transfer calculations and proficient in the theory of thermodynamics, aerodynamics, and fluid dynamics.
     Experience in using simulation analysis software such as ANSYS, Nastran, Abaqus would be advantageous
     Good understanding of experimental techniques, particularly about pressure, temperature, strain, and flow measurement.
     Interest in understanding of rotating machinery design.
     The proven ability to work as part of a team or un-supervised to an agreed goal or set
     of deliverables is imperative.
     A clear logical thinker with exceptional attention to detail.
     A proven structured approach to creative problem solving.
     Ability to communicate appropriate, concise, and accurate information in written and verbal format.
     To be eligible you will need to have no more than two years of relevant work experience post-graduation (Phd students are not eligible for our graduate programmes).
   
    For your application to be considered, please upload 1) your detailed resume and 2) transcript (all semesters inclusive) in a single file together with your online application.
    Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.

Summary

Salary:
Competitive
Team:
Graduates, Interns and Apprentices
Location:
Singapore - Technology Centre

About us

Dyson is a global technology enterprise. We solve the problems others choose to ignore, with surprising new inventions that defy convention and simply work better. We’re driven by progress and thrive on the challenge of relentless improvement. We’re growing fast and our ambition is huge – more categories, more locations and more people.

Our scale and rapid growth make Dyson rich in new opportunities. We value new ideas and diverse perspectives, so our people are trusted with real work and responsibility from the outset. You’ll develop fast and have the chance to move into different business areas and regions. And you’ll be part of a global network of like-minded people – a community that supports and learns from each other.

Power Systems is a global function that designs and develops Dyson’s internal technologies that enable most of our products. The team has experts in wide range of areas (mechanical, electrical, software, project management) and is responsible of the development from early stages through to production.

Engineering Analysis team within Power Systems is responsible for the performance, simulation, analysis, and experimental verification of the technology project. The team consists of experts in fields of turbomachinery, thermodynamics, acoustics, vibrations, rotor dynamics, fluid dynamics, structural analysis, and data analysis. Utilizing the state-of-the-art advanced analysis methods to ensure the design is optimised and robust for maximum performance.

About the role

We are looking for a Graduate Engineering Analysis Engineer to work within our Engineering Analysis function inside Power Systems, to apply her/his skills and experience in Fluid Dynamics/Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) and/or Structural Dynamics/Finite Element Analysis (FEA) to deliver our next generation Dyson internally developed technologies and their product integration. He/she will also use analytical techniques to add insight into experimental results, driving early development concepts, supporting projects with appropriate technology readiness and advancement. In addition, the candidate will be expected to continually improve and develop new techniques and methodologies, to build the capability of Power Systems group and Dyson as a whole. Some of your tasks could include:

  • Generate innovative concepts for new technologies using analytical techniques including CFD/FEA and experiments.
  • Responsible for activities such as thermal management, aerodynamic/acoustic performance, structural robustness, rotor dynamics of the technology through design, development, and delivery.
  • Responsible to develop air paths and cooling options for mechanical, electrical and electronic components of the technology system to achieve robustness and high performance.
  • Responsible for supporting implementation of design concepts from component design through to finished assembly. This would include analysis, product concepts, dimensional verification, and general demonstration of the use of core engineering disciplines.
  • Responsible for leading the development of design concepts through prototype hardware procurement, assembly, testing, data analysis, fault analysis, problem solving, and design refinement. This may require some direction of technical support personnel.
  • Considers and seeks out the impact of his/her actions within the team. Actively seeks collaboration with internal and external team members
  • Ability and engagement in transferring experience and training to design engineers and junior specialists – best-practices establishing and sharing.
  • Performs other duties as requested, directed, or assigned. Deliver product focused technology projects to the Dyson range plan.

Our Graduate Programme

Our graduate programme is designed to help you drive your career at Dyson with a two-year journey to help you grow both personally and professionally. We’ll help you to improve your knowledge and support your future career progression with workshops to give you baseline soft skills in addition to technical training. Our unique experiential journey provides a framework so you can reach your full potential with leadership talks, lunch-and-learns and more. You may have the opportunity to rotate into a variety of teams to support your professional development.

About you

Our graduate roles are competitive and delivering the next generation of Dyson technology is tough, so you will need to be:

  • Graduating by August 2024
  • Working towards or have achieved a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Mechanical or Aeronautical Engineering or equivalent (other relevant engineering disciplines will be considered)
  • Fundamental knowledge in one or more of the areas: structural dynamics, thermodynamics, fluid dynamics, strength of materials, vibro- or aero- acoustics
  • Demonstrated ability to investigate, model and provide critical insights into complex physical phenomena such as aerodynamic performance, noise, vibration, vibro-acoustics, aero-acoustics, or thermal management.
  • Ability to perform thermodynamic heat transfer calculations and proficient in the theory of thermodynamics, aerodynamics, and fluid dynamics.
  • Experience in using simulation analysis software such as ANSYS, Nastran, Abaqus would be advantageous
  • Good understanding of experimental techniques, particularly about pressure, temperature, strain, and flow measurement.
  • Interest in understanding of rotating machinery design.
  • The proven ability to work as part of a team or un-supervised to an agreed goal or set
  • of deliverables is imperative.
  • A clear logical thinker with exceptional attention to detail.
  • A proven structured approach to creative problem solving.
  • Ability to communicate appropriate, concise, and accurate information in written and verbal format.
  • To be eligible you will need to have no more than two years of relevant work experience post-graduation (Phd students are not eligible for our graduate programmes).

For your application to be considered, please upload 1) your detailed resume and 2) transcript (all semesters inclusive) in a single file together with your online application.


Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.

About Excel Hardware
A Singapore Brand - EXCEL envisions creating productive and customized experiences for our users at cost competitive prices.
We endeavour to consistently develop durable, reliable, space optimized and robust hardware products and services for the convenience of our users.
Safety & Sustainability - Excel prides itself in excellence by not only producing high-quality products but also in its values. As a brand that strives to always deliver their best, they understand that sustainability is the key to longer-term success.
Job Description
1. Arrange appointments with existing and new clients
2. Assist with client’s requests and enquiries
3. Perform order processing via website
4. Prepare business documents using Shopify system
5. Handle payment and collection
6. Provide ad-hoc administrative support
7. Creating and publishing marketing collaterals
Basic Pay + Incentives
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Contract, Temporary, Internship, Fresh graduate, Student jobContract length: 3-6 months
Salary: $1,000.00 per month
Benefits:

 Flexible schedule
 Promotion to permanent employee

Schedule:

 Early shift

Supplemental pay types:

 Performance bonus

Education:

 Local Polytechnic Diploma (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

Company
   
  
   IPTL Pte Ltd
   
     iptl.sg
   
   
 
 
  
   Designation
   
  
   Intern Scientific / Medical Affairs
   
 
 
  
   Date Listed
   
  
   11 Mar 2024
   
 
 
  
   Job Type
   
  
   Entry Level / Junior Executive
   
     Intern/TS
   
   
 
 
  
   Job Period
   
  
   Flexible Start - Flexible End
   
 
 
  
   Profession
   
  
   Healthcare / Pharmaceutical / Sports
   
 
 
  
   Industry
   
  
   Consultancy
   
 
 
  
   Location Name
   
  
   Singapore
   
     Work from Home
   
   
 
 
  
   Allowance / Remuneration
   
  
   $10 hourly 
  
 
 
 
  
   Company Profile
   
  
   Welcome to IPTL, a healthcare and pharma consultancy provider based in Singapore. Committed to enhancing patients' lives worldwide, we partner with pharmaceutical leaders and entrepreneurs to drive innovation and deliver impactful solutions. Our services encompass leadership, specialized consulting, and networking events.
    More about IPTL:
    Training & Development:
    At IPTL, we prioritize your growth and development. As a part of the IPTL family, you will enhance your leadership, analytical, and project management skills through real-life projects and cross-functional teamwork.
    Life-Work Balance:
    We understand that life comes first. Your day might begin with a virtual celebration with your team or a collaborative brainstorming session in our workspace. Whether you're working remotely or in our space, you'll have opportunities for professional development tailored to your career aspirations.
    Culture & Vibe:
    IPTL values diversity as a cornerstone of improving health for all. We foster a culture that resonates with the spirit of the new generation, embracing innovation, creativity, and collaboration. 
  
 
 
  
   Job Description
   
  
   Internship Description:
    Join our 2024 internship at IPTL, focusing on 1.Medical Affairs and 2.Market Development within the Healthcare Industry. This opportunity offers a unique platform for passionate individuals to gain valuable hands-on experience while contributing to projects that shape the future of healthcare.
    Role Description:
    During your time with us, you will explore strategies and initiatives aimed at enhancing medical affairs practices and driving the advancement of healthcare solutions. Our founder will provide guidance and mentorship throughout your internship journey, ensuring a supportive and enriching experience.
    You’ll succeed because…
    You possess a natural curiosity and innovative thinking. Your solid academic background serves as a strong foundation. Ambitious and motivated, you're eager to shoulder responsibilities in an entrepreneurial and dynamic environment. Action-oriented and pragmatic, you excel at problem-solving and share our unwavering drive to succeed.
    You’ll love it because…
    You'll have the opportunity to make an impact like never before. We are contributing to the evolution of the healthcare ecosystem, providing an exceptional platform for you to showcase your talents.
   
    Qualifications:
   
     Enrolled or recently graduated in Life Sciences, Biology, Biostatistics, Health Policy, Public Health, or Health Services Research.
     Passionate about the healthcare industry and its impact on healthcare delivery.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.
     Detail-oriented and organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously.
   
    Job Type: Student job, Part-time, Temporary
    Benefits: Promotion to permanent employee based on performance
    Ability to Commute: Central Singapore 
  
 
 
  
   Application Instructions
   
  
   If you're passionate about medical affairs and eager to make a difference in the healthcare industry, we'd love to hear from you! Please submit your resume to

Welcome to IPTL, a healthcare and pharma consultancy provider based in Singapore. At IPTL, we prioritize your growth and development. As a part of the IPTL family, you will enhance your leadership, analytical, and project management skills through real-life projects and cross-functional teamwork.

Life-Work Balance:

We understand that life comes first. Your day might begin with a virtual celebration with your team or a collaborative brainstorming session in our workspace. Whether you're working remotely or in our space, you'll have opportunities for professional development tailored to your career aspirations.

Culture & Vibe:

IPTL values diversity as a cornerstone of improving health for all. We foster a culture that resonates with the spirit of the new generation, embracing innovation, creativity, and collaboration.

Job Description

Internship Description:

Join our 2024 internship at IPTL, focusing on 1.Medical Affairs and 2.Market Development within the Healthcare Industry. This opportunity offers a unique platform for passionate individuals to gain valuable hands-on experience while contributing to projects that shape the future of healthcare.

Role Description:

During your time with us, you will explore strategies and initiatives aimed at enhancing medical affairs practices and driving the advancement of healthcare solutions. Our founder will provide guidance and mentorship throughout your internship journey, ensuring a supportive and enriching experience.

You’ll succeed because…

You possess a natural curiosity and innovative thinking. Your solid academic background serves as a strong foundation. Ambitious and motivated, you're eager to shoulder responsibilities in an entrepreneurial and dynamic environment. Action-oriented and pragmatic, you excel at problem-solving and share our unwavering drive to succeed.

You’ll love it because…

You'll have the opportunity to make an impact like never before. We are contributing to the evolution of the healthcare ecosystem, providing an exceptional platform for you to showcase your talents.

  • Enrolled or recently graduated in Life Sciences, Biology, Biostatistics, Health Policy, Public Health, or Health Services Research.
  • Passionate about the healthcare industry and its impact on healthcare delivery.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.
  • Detail-oriented and organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously.

Job Type: Student job, Part-time, Temporary

Benefits: Promotion to permanent employee based on performance

Ability to Commute: Central Singapore

Application Instructions
If you're passionate about medical affairs and eager to make a difference in the healthcare industry, we'd love to hear from you! Please submit your resume to

companyInfo/companyDescription: Emerson is a diversified global manufacturing and technology company. It offers a wide range of products and services in the areas of network power, process management, industrial automation, and tools and storage businesses. Recognized widely for its engineering capabilities and management excellence, Emerson has over 66,000 employees and 130 manufacturing locations worldwide.
description:
Job Summary 
 Are you looking for a career in Production? Emerson has just the opportunity for you! We are seeking for an Instrument Builder who will handle the products assembly and products built in compliance with the detailed requests and requirements as assigned to the Business Unit 
 In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be: 
 
  Responsible for performing tasks at workstation in accordance to documented processes/procedures/Work Instructions/Training/Advanced Deviation Request. 
  Perform TQC as required. 
  Ensure good housekeeping, maintain 5S of production line and observe Safety Rules and Regulations 
  Observe and ensure quality criteria of product and raise Redlight if needed Accountable for inventory integrity by involving in cycle count 
  Perform any other task as and when needed by superior 
 
 Who You Are: 
 You build partnerships and collaborative work with others to meet the target objectives set by the team. You take action quickly and critically in fast paced and unexpected situations. You consistently achieve results and completes responsibilities even under tough circumstances. 
 For This Role, You Will Need: 
 
  Good communication skills 
  Must be willing to work on 8 hours shift (7.00 AM to 3.30 PM or 3.30 PM to 12.00 AM) 
  Must be able to work as a team with other production staff 
 
 Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart: 
 
  Candidate must possess at least a Secondary School/O-Level 
  Manufacturing work experience is an advantage 
  Knowledge of Computer Skills (Internet, Emails, Microsoft Office) is an advantage 
 
 
  Our Offer To You: 
  By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do. 
  Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets . We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees. 
  We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion . We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship . 
  We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential . We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company. 
  We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office. 
  Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities. 
  Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent. 
  Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion 
  At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers. 
  This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson . 
  If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .
 
 


 WHY EMERSON 
 Our Commitment to Our People 
 At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration. 
 We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor. 
 
 At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together. 
 Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation 
 If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com . 
 
 ABOUT EMERSON 
 Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability. 
 With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety. 
 
 We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go! 
 No calls or agencies please.

Job Summary

Are you looking for a career in Production? Emerson has just the opportunity for you! We are seeking for an Instrument Builder who will handle the products assembly and products built in compliance with the detailed requests and requirements as assigned to the Business Unit

In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:

  • Responsible for performing tasks at workstation in accordance to documented processes/procedures/Work Instructions/Training/Advanced Deviation Request.
  • Perform TQC as required.
  • Ensure good housekeeping, maintain 5S of production line and observe Safety Rules and Regulations
  • Observe and ensure quality criteria of product and raise Redlight if needed Accountable for inventory integrity by involving in cycle count
  • Perform any other task as and when needed by superior

Who You Are:

You build partnerships and collaborative work with others to meet the target objectives set by the team. You take action quickly and critically in fast paced and unexpected situations. You consistently achieve results and completes responsibilities even under tough circumstances.

For This Role, You Will Need:

  • Good communication skills
  • Must be willing to work on 8 hours shift (7.00 AM to 3.30 PM or 3.30 PM to 12.00 AM)
  • Must be able to work as a team with other production staff

Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:

  • Candidate must possess at least a Secondary School/O-Level
  • Manufacturing work experience is an advantage
  • Knowledge of Computer Skills (Internet, Emails, Microsoft Office) is an advantage

Our Offer To You:

By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do.

Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets . We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees.

We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion . We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship .

We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential . We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company.

We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office.

Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities.

Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson .

If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .


WHY EMERSON

Our Commitment to Our People

At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration.

We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor.

At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together.

Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation

If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .

ABOUT EMERSON

Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.

With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.

We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go!

No calls or agencies please.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Circles.Life is Asia’s first and most successful digital telco, founded on the belief that telcos can - and should - be better.

Our vision is to be the go-to consumer brand: delighting and engaging customers with personalized digital services across the world. Through our world-class technology and market-winning brand power, we’ve revolutionised the global telco industry, and captured >5% market share in Singapore while keeping our Net Promoter Scores 3x of the industry’s average. 

Pledging to give Power to the People, the same sentiment is echoed through our internal operations. Circles.Lifers are drawn to work at a company that enables them to achieve their aspirations just as it enables its customers to fulfil their digital needs.
description:
About Us  Founded in 2014, Circles is a global technology company reimagining the telco industry with its SaaS platform - Circles X, helping telco operators launch and operate successful digital brands through its offerings. 
  Having pioneered a successful blueprint for disrupting the telco space in Singapore, Circles has since launched its own digital telco, Circles.Life, in Singapore, Taiwan and Australia. Circles has also partnered with other telco operators to launch digital services, enabling our partners to accelerate growth and capture market share within a short period of time. 
  Today, Circles is partnering with operators in 14 countries to deliver delightful digital experiences to millions of people through our businesses. 
  We are backed by global investors such as Sequoia, Warburg Pincus, EDBI and Founders Fund – renowned backers of industry-shaking innovators
   ABOUT THIS ROLE We are looking for a motivated individual who is hungry to learn and thrives in a fast-paced environment. The person should have an eye for detail with strong analytical skills to conduct research to contribute towards strategy, whilst having a creative spark to prepare effective communication materials. As part of the Strategy & Innovation team, the intern will help to support the development of strategy, alongside the execution of strategic initiatives. 
 
   The intern will have the opportunity to (but not limited to):
   
  
   Conduct research and analyse findings to contribute towards strategy (e.g. future of Telcos, topic areas of interest)
   Support the preparations of meetings, workshops or offsites to provide strategic alignment with a focus
   Facilitate effective communication internally and externally via preparation of presentations and communication materials
   Support the execution of strategic initiatives
   This role will work closely with other teams (business, engineering, product etc)
   The intern will have an opportunity to have a purview of strategic thinking
   This is a full time (5 days) internship with the preference of minimal 5 months commitment within time period of April 2024 to December 2024 in Singapore office.
  
 
  This is a group level role based in Singapore
   WHY THIS ROLE IS UNIQUE Build a legacy - Have the opportunity to work directly with Engineering and company leader(s) on strategic thinking and implementation to leave an impact 
  Create your own path - autonomy and freedom to define and be the one responsible to make it happen, whilst having the support and guidance from Head of Strategic Implementation 
  Be at the position to witness and understand how leaders think 
  10X - Be part of a fast-growing organisation with ambitious plans to expand into multiple more markets and verticals, and help be the one to make it happen.  WHAT YOU'LL DO Strategy and research: Conduct research, market scan, analysis of information and produce insights to support ongoing strategic initiatives and strategy. S/he will be expected to conduct research independently, present findings in actionable format, synthesize and summarise key takeaways. 
  Strategic Implementation: Trusted supporter who aids the Head of Strategy to focus on larger strategic initiatives; contribute to ideation, planning, and execution of strategic projects across several areas to deliver ambitious outcomes 
  Communication management: Prepare and manage the execution of communication materials (e.g. presentations, videos) to effectively communicate internally (rest of the company) and externally (e.g. client-ready materials) 
  Others: Support any adhoc tasks to meet the needs of the team
   WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH Head of Strategy & Innovation and team 
  Other leaders / teams in the organisation, where relevant
 
    WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
   
  
   Current students currently pursuing their Masters degree/Bachelors, or recently graduated / waiting to pursue further studies
   Min. 5-months (longer duration preferred) within the time period of April 2024 to December 2024. Please indicate your availability for the internship.
   Motivated with a strong sense of ownership, willingness to learn and great sense of initiative.
   Highly adaptable, creative problem solver with a positive can-do attitude who likes fast paced environment!
   Proficient in Microsoft Powerpoint and Excel and/or Google Slide and Google Sheet
   Strong eye for detail and willingness to roll up the sleeves to perform indepth research
   Ability to digest different information and synthesize to informative insights
   Ability to find creative ways to overcome difficulties when finding information
  
  
 
   Good to have
   
  
   Ability to read financial statements
   Ability to generate video for external facing

About Us

Founded in 2014, Circles is a global technology company reimagining the telco industry with its SaaS platform - Circles X, helping telco operators launch and operate successful digital brands through its offerings.

Having pioneered a successful blueprint for disrupting the telco space in Singapore, Circles has since launched its own digital telco, Circles.Life, in Singapore, Taiwan and Australia. Circles has also partnered with other telco operators to launch digital services, enabling our partners to accelerate growth and capture market share within a short period of time.

Today, Circles is partnering with operators in 14 countries to deliver delightful digital experiences to millions of people through our businesses.

We are backed by global investors such as Sequoia, Warburg Pincus, EDBI and Founders Fund – renowned backers of industry-shaking innovators


ABOUT THIS ROLE
We are looking for a motivated individual who is hungry to learn and thrives in a fast-paced environment. The person should have an eye for detail with strong analytical skills to conduct research to contribute towards strategy, whilst having a creative spark to prepare effective communication materials. As part of the Strategy & Innovation team, the intern will help to support the development of strategy, alongside the execution of strategic initiatives.

The intern will have the opportunity to (but not limited to):
  • Conduct research and analyse findings to contribute towards strategy (e.g. future of Telcos, topic areas of interest)
  • Support the preparations of meetings, workshops or offsites to provide strategic alignment with a focus
  • Facilitate effective communication internally and externally via preparation of presentations and communication materials
  • Support the execution of strategic initiatives
  • This role will work closely with other teams (business, engineering, product etc)
  • The intern will have an opportunity to have a purview of strategic thinking
  • This is a full time (5 days) internship with the preference of minimal 5 months commitment within time period of April 2024 to December 2024 in Singapore office.


This is a group level role based in Singapore


WHY THIS ROLE IS UNIQUE
Build a legacy - Have the opportunity to work directly with Engineering and company leader(s) on strategic thinking and implementation to leave an impact

Create your own path - autonomy and freedom to define and be the one responsible to make it happen, whilst having the support and guidance from Head of Strategic Implementation

Be at the position to witness and understand how leaders think

10X - Be part of a fast-growing organisation with ambitious plans to expand into multiple more markets and verticals, and help be the one to make it happen.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Strategy and research: Conduct research, market scan, analysis of information and produce insights to support ongoing strategic initiatives and strategy. S/he will be expected to conduct research independently, present findings in actionable format, synthesize and summarise key takeaways.

Strategic Implementation: Trusted supporter who aids the Head of Strategy to focus on larger strategic initiatives; contribute to ideation, planning, and execution of strategic projects across several areas to deliver ambitious outcomes

Communication management: Prepare and manage the execution of communication materials (e.g. presentations, videos) to effectively communicate internally (rest of the company) and externally (e.g. client-ready materials)

Others: Support any adhoc tasks to meet the needs of the team


WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH
Head of Strategy & Innovation and team

Other leaders / teams in the organisation, where relevant


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
  • Current students currently pursuing their Masters degree/Bachelors, or recently graduated / waiting to pursue further studies
  • Min. 5-months (longer duration preferred) within the time period of April 2024 to December 2024. Please indicate your availability for the internship.
  • Motivated with a strong sense of ownership, willingness to learn and great sense of initiative.
  • Highly adaptable, creative problem solver with a positive can-do attitude who likes fast paced environment!
  • Proficient in Microsoft Powerpoint and Excel and/or Google Slide and Google Sheet
  • Strong eye for detail and willingness to roll up the sleeves to perform indepth research
  • Ability to digest different information and synthesize to informative insights
  • Ability to find creative ways to overcome difficulties when finding information
Good to have
  • Ability to read financial statements
  • Ability to generate video for external facing

description:
Purpose of the Role: 
 Due to K2 expansion, APAC technical and delivery team looking to hire Engineering Trainee to support our internal design team management and design review work. This person will be working closely with SG HQ based Project Management team to handle the daily design related issues for existing and future projects in APAC region.
  
  Responsibilities: 
  
 
 
  Assist Assistant Project Manager or Site Delivery Manager in data centre design and construction phases for site management and construction quality control.
   Help to monitor construction activities closely on a regular basis and ensure the data centre facility is built to group's standard. 
  Help to review design consultant’s work to ensure design documents are sufficiently developed with all necessary engineering calculations in place.
   Help to maintain K2 internal engineering standard with particular focus on HVAC and plumbing systems.
   Help Assistant Project Manager in works related to project commissioning and final handover activities.
   Help Assistant Project Manager in K2 internal engineering design and development activities.
   Help to uphold the engineering and operation procedures following K2 standard.
 
  
  Working environment entails: 
 
  Walking job sites which have areas of uneven terrain.
   Work at heights.
   Work in a noisy environment.
   Work in confined spaces.
   Work environment applicable to operation team 
   
    Regularly lift and/or move items and participate in group lifts. 
    Work shifts longer than eight hours in duration. 
    Co-ordinate body movements when using tools or equipment. 
    May require bending or twisting the body to access equipment while working.
     Involves performing physical tasks all day. 
    Use hands to manipulate small wires and objects. 
    Push or pull objects into position.
   
 
  Skills Set and Qualifications Requirements:
  
 
   Fresh Graduate with Bachelor’s in Mechanical or Building Services Engineering
   Working experience in building services design and construction project delivery (data centre projects preferred).
   Good knowledge in Electrical HV/LV distribution Engineering with interest in understanding on data centre project and protection study preferred
   Proficiency in MS Office (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc) with experience in Electrical or Mechanical calculation software, such as Etap, IES, E20
   Good command of written and spoken English is required. Additional language skills such as Chinese and/or Bahasa Indonesia/Malaysia will be preferred.
   Candidates who are active, initiative, conscientious, sociable, flexible and optimistic.
  
  Interpersonal Requirements: 
  
 
  Committed to the delivery of excellent customer service.
   Calm Manner, able to work under pressure.
   Self-motivated, ability to work on own initiative.
   Punctual and reliable.
   Good attention to detail.

    • Work shifts longer than eight hours in duration.

  • Working experience in building services design and construction project delivery (data centre projects preferred).
  • Good knowledge in Electrical HV/LV distribution Engineering with interest in understanding on data centre project and protection study preferred

  • Good attention to detail.

description:
Job purpose: 
 An exciting opportunity for a Graduate Trainee to gain broad experience across Trade Finance and Cash Management (TFCM) to develop a complete skill set as a foundation for a Transaction Banking management career. 
 This 18-month Graduate Trainee program is designed for recent Graduates and applicants must have graduated within the past 12 months. Strong performance can lead to final placement in areas of Sales or Strategy/Business Management – subject to business requirements, and candidate performance during rotations / projects in these areas: 
 (i) Strategy and Business Management 
 Support the Regional Head and Local Head of Trade Finance and Cash Management in the development and implementation of the business Strategy for Asia and Singapore. Specific tasks will be involved in Strategy and target setting, initiative tracking and working with Sales/Operations teams across the region in implementation. 
 Develop a multi-country and comprehensive view of the business, and an understanding of market, client and regulatory trends. 
 (ii) Sales 
 Support of Sales Specialists in the overall communication with the customer and stakeholders within the organisation. 
 Assistance to Sales Specialists in preparation of client meetings by compiling internet research on customer and information from internal systems e.g., prepare Terms & Conditions, presentations / pitch decks. 
 Support in customer meetings, producing minutes and helping with any follow-up. 
 Independent organization and support in preparation of internal and external events and meetings. 
 Support the Head in planning, strategizing, implementation, execution, and reporting tasks. 
 Compliance with the local laws and provisions (amongst other things, regulatory requirements, labour law, tax and commercial law), as well as the relevant internal regulations of Commerzbank. 
 
  
 Key activities: 
 Strategy and Business Management 
 
  Supporting the Regional Head in executing the business development strategy, mining data to enable controlling and make meaningful adjustments. 
  Supporting regional projects, internal and external audits, and assist in various governance functions. 
 
 Sales 
 
  Supporting the sales team within the sales process, e.g., research and compilation of market, competitor, and potential analysis as well as product information (in complex cases). 
  Independently solving of customer requests in taking the bank’s economical requirements, rules and regulations as well as compliance related tasks into consideration. 
  Coordination of customer appointments with existing and potential corporate customers upon request of the sales team. 
  Supporting marketing initiatives and customer events together with the sales team. 
  Assisting the sales team in processing trade finance and cash management transactions for customers. 
  Monitor clients’ business and operations at all levels on a timely and ongoing basis to ensure business opportunities are followed up and for thorough credit and financial crime risk monitoring. Uploading, maintaining and finalizing pipeline inputs and acknowledging market trends. 
 
 
  
 Formal education/Specialist knowledge (work experience, further qualification) 
 
  Recent graduate with not more than 1 year of professional work experience (excluding internships) Bachelor’s Degree in Business Finance/Social Science with GPA 3.5/5 & 3.2/4. 
 
 
  
 Description of specifications with regards to work profiles: 
 
  Willingness to learn, be part of a dynamic team and make an impact and achieve results 
  Proactive & self-initiated quick learner, able to adapt quickly 
  Team player & good interpersonal skills 
  Strong sense of responsibility & integrity 
  Client centric & service oriented 
  Ability to work under pressure & deliver high quality output 
  Meticulous & Strong communicator

positionName: Graduate Trainee – Institutional Clients & Transaction Banking Sales

companyInfo/companyDescription: Emerson is a diversified global manufacturing and technology company. It offers a wide range of products and services in the areas of network power, process management, industrial automation, and tools and storage businesses. Recognized widely for its engineering capabilities and management excellence, Emerson has over 66,000 employees and 130 manufacturing locations worldwide.
description:
Job Summary: 
 If you are looking for a new opportunity in the field of Order Administration and Project Management, Emerson has an opening for you! We are seeking for Customer Support Representative who will handle accurate and timely administration of customer orders. The role will ensure orders are met and in compliance with customer requirements, product specifications and all Emerson policies. 
 In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be: 
 
  Coordinate with all relevant internal and external partners to manage all aspects of orders to meet customer’s expectations and internal important metrics. 
  Provide timely updates and accurate status reports throughout the entire order process to both internal and external partners. 
  Coordinate with vendors, factories, purchasing department, other functional teams, and review BI reports to get order status and support prioritization. 
  Support resolution of customer’s inquiries and adherence to customer request date. 
  Manage customer’s change orders, update ERP systems appropriately. 
  Ensure customer’s orders booked timely and accurately in ERP systems, coordinate with relevant partners to release all the necessary holds. 
  Being a gate keeper to ensure customer’s orders are align with Emerson booking, Trade Compliance, Due Diligence, and other necessary policies set forth. 
  Support all necessary month end closing activities. 
  Coordinate with internal partners and customers to support the resolution of finance, quality, billing, and other order related issues. 
  Submit customers' required documents timely through ERP system. 
  Coordinate with relevant partners to arrange and release the shipment timely from customer and internal systems, ensure invoice customer accordingly and accurately. 
  Archive all necessary documents and support for both internal and external audits. 
  Manage, maintain, and update various Emerson business software and ERP systems timely, accurately, and appropriately. 
  Any other necessary activities need to be done to meet the business’s needs and objectives. 
 
 Customer and Sales Office Communication: 
 
  Work with subject matter expert to respond to customer inquiries within 24 hours. 
 
 Managing Orders: 
 
  Proactively manage customer’s order, provide updates timely and accurately to both internal & external partners. 
  Ensure all orders are managed and have been entered timely and accurately to ERP systems, ensure correct product specification, agreed delivery date, certification, and documentation requirements and other necessary information. 
  Ensure all the holds placed on orders to be released appropriately and timely. 
  Ensure all Emerson policies and procedures to be complied. 
  Resolve all issues relate to the orders timely and appropriately to meet customer’s expectations and internal important metrics. 
  Conduct, manage and attend all necessary business meetings, visits, and travels. 
 
 Communication of shipping, resolve invoicing issues: 
 
  Coordinate inspection if required. 
  Prepare shipping documents, coordinate with internal and external partners to arrange and release the shipment timely. 
  Coordinate with internal partners and customers to ensure the shipment ship timely and invoice customer on time. 
 
 Status Updates: 
 
  Assist in sales shipment forecasting and update the ERP systems timely and accurately. 
  Provide status reports as required on order status. 
  Follow up on commitments and delivery achievements with the plant. 
  Provide the orders’ execution progress throughout the entire order process. 
 
 Change Order Management: 
 
  Provide technical and application support for customer inquiries. 
  Manage change order process. 
 
 Who You Are: 
 You adjust communication content and style to meet the needs of diverse partners. You always keep the end in sight; puts in extra effort to meet deadlines. You facilitate an open dialogue with a wide variety of contributors and partners. 
 For This Role, You Will Need: 
 
  Degree or equivalent in Business Management, Supply Chain or any related field 
  Minimum 2 years of work experience in customer facing role. 
  Strong customer support skills; strong communication (written and verbal) skills. 
  Ability to multi-task and manage competing priorities. 
 
 Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart: 
 
  Proficient in a variety of software programs including customer relationship management and ERP software. 
  Proficient in both SAP and Oracle will be an advantage. 
  Ability to comprehend technical specifications. 
  Ability to adapt in changes and fast-paced working environment, can work under the pressure and patient and resilient 
 
 Our Offer to You: 
 By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do. 
 Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets . We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees. 
 We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion . We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship . 
 We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential . We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company. 
 We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office. 
 Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities. 
 Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent. 
 Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion 
 At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers. 
 This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson . 
 If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .

 At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration. 
 We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs.
