companyInfo/companyDescription:
Since we opened our doors in 2005, we have grown to become the leading homegrown financial advisory firm in Singapore.



At finexis, we are not funded or backed by any particular insurance provider, private equity or listed company. We are under no pressure by any international insurer's shareholders or board of directors to enhance shareholder profits or stock prices at the expense of our clients.



We are therefore free to hold to the highest standard of care and act in the best interests of our clients at all times, and to relentlessly focus on constantly growing our people, to ensure that our consultants on our platform provide clients with unbiased advice that truly impact your wealth and beyond.
description:
What to expect: 
 We are looking to nurture and grow young, energetic individuals to join our talent pool. For this season, we are looking to bring in 2 Management Trainees. 
 
  
 Successful candidates will take on challenging projects and portfolios to develop strengths and capabilities, and be exposed through rotations across core business/enabling functions within the corporate function of finexis. The objective is to provide candidates with personal and professional development opportunities, and groom candidates to be our company’s future leaders. 
 
  
 As agency distribution is a key business area of the company, key rotations could be made to recruitment, agency management and related areas. 
 
  
 There will be ongoing mentorship opportunities with experienced managers and senior leadership. 
 
  
 Responsibilities: 
 
  Acquire experience from ground level and gain experience in key business areas 
  Join the planning, and subsequently execute strategies to bring about key results and revenue 
  Assist the management in various corporate roles and matters, e.g. organising events, and take over key roles in due time 
  Contribute and lead in cross-functional projects 
 
 Qualifications: 
 
  Self-starter, resourceful, willing and able to learn fast 
  Degree/Diploma graduates (within 6 years of graduation) with good CCA/work track records are welcome to apply 
  Strong ability to communicate and work with various stakeholders – whether senior management, colleagues or team members 
  Strong familiarity with the financial advisory industry 
  Working experience and exposure to financial advisory sales / recruitment are advantageous

The objective is to provide candidates with personal and professional development opportunities, and groom candidates to be our company’s future leaders.


As agency distribution is a key business area of the company, key rotations could be made to recruitment, agency management and related areas.


There will be ongoing mentorship opportunities with experienced managers and senior leadership.


Responsibilities:

  • Acquire experience from ground level and gain experience in key business areas
  • Join the planning, and subsequently execute strategies to bring about key results and revenue
  • Assist the management in various corporate roles and matters, e.g. organising events, and take over key roles in due time
  • Contribute and lead in cross-functional projects

Qualifications:

  • Self-starter, resourceful, willing and able to learn fast
  • Degree/Diploma graduates (within 6 years of graduation) with good CCA/work track records are welcome to apply
  • Strong ability to communicate and work with various stakeholders – whether senior management, colleagues or team members
  • Strong familiarity with the financial advisory industry
  • Working experience and exposure to financial advisory sales / recruitment are advantageous

companyInfo/companyDescription: Emerson is a diversified global manufacturing and technology company. It offers a wide range of products and services in the areas of network power, process management, industrial automation, and tools and storage businesses. Recognized widely for its engineering capabilities and management excellence, Emerson has over 66,000 employees and 130 manufacturing locations worldwide.
description:
Job Summary 
 If you are a Supply Chain professional, looking to expand your career in the Manufacturing space, Emerson has an exciting opportunity for you! The Material Planner will be responsible for the material flow planning to meet the daily production requirements of the business. The role will also handle inventory records maintenance, stock discrepancies resolution, stock movement monitoring, purchase orders, and issues coordination with finance and suppliers.  
 
  In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be: 
  
   Inventory Control 
   
    Plan material flow to meet daily production requirements. 
    Implement and complete inventory reduction programs 
    Monitor & expedite orders based on material requirement & inventory levels. 
    Achieve Inventory important metric set by management. (5 points ITO, Average Inventory and Raw velocity) 
    Process and maintain inventory adjustment records. 
    Resolve stocks discrepancies. 
   
   Purchasing & Supplier Control 
   
    Supervise stock movement and initiate purchase orders. 
    Follow-up on delivery shortages, rejects & reworks with suppliers. 
    Provide rolling forecast to supplier for capacity booking. 
    Resolve discrepancies in purchasing contracts with finance and suppliers. 
    Implement measures with suppliers to reduce lead-time and achieve timely delivery. 
    Co-ordinate drawing/specification revisions to suppliers. 
    Co-ordinate phase-in of new material – Risk Mitigation 
    Attend to new supplier approval and co-ordinate phase-in process. 
    Maintain supplier information in Vendor Master File. 
    Maintain retention of purchasing records. 
   
   Product Champion 
   
    Compute actual material cost and spare parts selling price for assigned product. 
    Attend to MRB disposition for assigned product 
    Attend to ECRN implementation for assigned product 
    Maintain Bill of Materials (BPM) and Item Master in MRP system for assigned product 
   
   Others 
   
    Maintain and upkeep ISO 9001:2015 system. 
    Prepare monthly report on ITO, OTS, and materials update. 
    Knowledge on Automation Intelligence system to help on Material Planning.  
   
  
  
   Who You Are: 
  
  
    You build partnerships and collaborative work with others to meet the target objectives set by the team. You are an active learner who uses both success and failure as learning opportunities. You take action quickly and critically in fast paced and unexpected situations. You maintain a positive attitude despite adversity.
    
  
  
   
  
   For This Role, You Will Need: 
  
  
   
    Diploma / Degree in Purchasing, Engineering or Business is required. 
    Minimum 2 years of planning or purchasing experience in a manufacturing environment.  
   
  
  
   Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart: 
  
  
   
    Solid understanding in purchasing, inventory control and MRP system. 
   
  
  Our Offer To You: 
  By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do. 
  Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets . We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees. 
  We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion . We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship . 
  We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential . We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company. 
  We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office. 
  Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities. 
  Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent. 
  Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion 
  At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers. 
  This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson . 
  If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .
 
 


 WHY EMERSON 
 Our Commitment to Our People 
 At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration. 
 We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor. 
 
 At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together. 
 Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation 
 If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com . 
 
 ABOUT EMERSON 
 Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability. 
 With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety. 
 
 We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go! 
 No calls or agencies please.

description:
Job Summary 
  Job Type
  Permanent 
  
  Seniority
  
  
 
  Years of Experience
  Information not provided 
  
  Tech Stacks
  TDD AWS Jenkins play MVP CI MVVM SonarQube Git Java Android Kotlin JSON Node.js
 


 Job Description 
 
 
  
   
    The Singapore Airlines Mobile application (available under “Singapore Airlines” on the Google Play Store) vision is to be the trusted travel companion for SIA passengers, offering features covering the customer journey from booking, pre-flight, day of travel, in flight and post flight.
     
     The SIA Mobile team is currently hiring Android developers. This is a full-time role with a hybrid WFH / Work from office arrangement, and includes travel benefits, access to ongoing learning, and an attractive work-life balance.
     
     Key Responsibilities
     
   
   
     Work with our team of Product Managers, Product Owners, UX Designers, QA, and Developers to build, optimise and release features within the SIA Mobile application.
     Ensure the application features operate smoothly in production and deliver world class customer experience to our large base of monthly users.
     Learn and apply principles of Test Driven Development, Agile Methodologies, Extreme Programming and MVP/MVVM architecture to deliver highly usable, stable and maintainable code.
     Learn and work with a tech stack comprising best-of-breed tools such as Kotlin, Git, Jenkins CI/CD, Sonarqube, automated test tools, a Java/Node.js back end, and AWS to deliver a monthly release of the mobile application.
     Integrate with a range of SIA’s backend systems using integration tech such as REST and JSON.
     Contribute to building a culture of openness, belonging, mutual support, ongoing learning, continuous improvement, enablement, and engineering excellence.
     Operations and L2 support work after hours may be needed from time to time. This will be kept to a minimum and shared across the team to ensure a sustainable work/life balance. Any relevant ad-hoc duties. 
   
   
     Requirements
     
   
   
     Possess a degree in Information Technology or related fields
     Hands on experience with Android development is preferred. Recent graduates with no industry experience, or developers experienced in other tech stacks are welcome to apply if they wish to grow a career in mobile development.
     A willingness to learn and apply best practices in Android (Kotlin) development, Extreme Programming principles, Pair Programming, Test Driven Development, DevOps, and defensive programming. Ability to communicate fluently in English. The team is a diverse team, and strong written and verbal English communication is essential to daily work. 
   
   
     We thank all candidates for your interest in Singapore Airlines, and regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description:
Company Overview 
 Clarksons is the world’s leading provider of integrated shipping and offshore services, bringing our connections and experience to an international client base. Our intelligence adds value by enabling clients to make more efficient and informed decisions. Our global reach, local knowledge and expertise is what makes us unique. 
 To understand more about day-to-day life at Clarksons, and what you can expect from us as an employer, visit us at www.clarksons.com . 
 
  
 Division 
 The Offshore group has vast expertise in brokerage, serves the shipping and offshore industry worldwide by providing shipbrokering services within chartering, sale and purchase and contracting of ships and offshore units. We maintain a strong relationship and extensive communication with the majority of the world’s leading shipowners and oil companies which represents a considerable source of business opportunities. 
 
  
 Role Summary 
 The main purpose of a Ship Broker is to act as a specialist intermediary/ negotiator between shipowners and charterers to arrange ocean transport of goods and commodities by sea, the employment of a vessel or to buy/ sell ships on behalf of a client. A career in Ship Broking is exciting, interesting, challenging and highly competitive, not to mention rewarding. 
 We have a great opportunity for a talented Trainee Broker to join our Offshore team in our Singapore office. You will work alongside our experienced Brokers to help strengthen relationships with existing clients for sales and help develop new business. 
 Ideally, you will have some broking experience and will be keen to develop your experience. You must also be driven and self-motivated and be a strong relationship builder. 
 Fresh university graduates are also welcome to apply for this position. 
 
  
 What you will be doing 
 
  Support the day-to-day activities of the Senior Brokers on the Offshore desk 
  Maintain databases and market information and reports for clients 
  Maintain accurate records and documentation 
  Develop knowledge and expertise relevant to the shipping market, in particular Offshore broking 
  Establish and maintain effective relationships internally and externally 
  Prepare reports and analysis for clients 
  Help to identify ways to drive and develop new business and identify and introduce new clients 
  Be aware of the positions and desired strategic directions for each shipyard 
  Help to manage internal data flow of key market information 
  Attend meetings and events with clients where required 
  Help to conduct post fixture support in a prompt and efficient manner 
  Continue to build knowledge in the Offshore arena and market space 
  Help perform market analysis and provide insight and trade ideas to clients 
  Assist with producing internal and external reporting Maintain a database of sales activity 
 
 
  
 What we are looking for 
 Key Attributes 
 
  A good university degree majoring in Maritime Studies or a related discipline 
  Previous experience or exposure within broking is desirable but is not mandatory 
  Knowledge of the Offshore market will be an advantage 
  Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written) 
  Fluency in Mandarin and English is essential 
  Personable and engaging 
  Assertive and outgoing personality 
  Able to build strong working relationships with clients 
  Good commercial judgement with good negotiation skills 
  Driven, self-motivated and client focused 
  Strong numeracy skills and excellent presentation skills 
  Confident and able to work well under pressure 
  Strong attention to detail and focus on accuracy 
  Team player with a flexible approach Strong MS office skills in Excel, PowerPoint, Word 
 
 
  
 Special Job Requirements Travel as required.
  
 
 
  
 How to Apply 
 If you would like to apply for this position, please send your resume and cover letter to HR.Singapore@clarksons.com .

description:
Job Summary 
 If you are Storekeeping professional seeking a career in the Warehouse space, then Emerson has a great opportunity for you! Based in Singapore, the Storekeeper will be in-charge of general store / warehousing duties. 
 In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be: 
 
  Receiving parcel from delivery, movement of material, packing / unpacking, participating in routine cycle count, documents filing, etc. 
  Selecting or picking products in conjunction with the specific customer order accurately. 
  Work with shipping to ensure orders are pack according the shipment cut-off timing. 
  General housekeeping ensuring the work areas are free from all unwanted materials or foreign objects. 
  Co-ordinating between Purchasing and Service team on spare parts receiving and handover. 
  Supports any tasks as assigned by supervisor. 
  Performs tasks safely with high quality. 
  Adhere to Environmental, Health and Safety policy, 5S, and other requirements relating to care of equipment and PPE. 
 
 Who You Are: 
 You quickly and decisively take action in fast-changing, unpredictable situations. You anticipate customer needs and provide services that are beyond customer expectations. You deliver messages in a clear, compelling, and concise manner. 
 For This Role, You Will Need: 
 
  Be fluent in simple English. 
  Having valid Forklift License 
  Capable of efficiently organizing work/tasks 
 
 Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart: 
 
  Experience in using MS Office software, experience in using Oracle System will be an advantage. 
  Experiences in a distribution Centre is an advantage.

We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers. 
 This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson . 
 If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .
 


 WHY EMERSON 
 Our Commitment to Our People 
 At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration. 
 We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor. 
 
 At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together. 
 Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation 
 If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com . 
 
 ABOUT EMERSON 
 Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability. 
 With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety. 
 
 We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go! 
 No calls or agencies please.
descriptionHTML:
Job Summary

If you are Storekeeping professional seeking a career in the Warehouse space, then Emerson has a great opportunity for you! Based in Singapore, the Storekeeper will be in-charge of general store / warehousing duties.

In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:

  • Receiving parcel from delivery, movement of material, packing / unpacking, participating in routine cycle count, documents filing, etc.
  • Selecting or picking products in conjunction with the specific customer order accurately.
  • Work with shipping to ensure orders are pack according the shipment cut-off timing.
  • General housekeeping ensuring the work areas are free from all unwanted materials or foreign objects.
  • Co-ordinating between Purchasing and Service team on spare parts receiving and handover.
  • Supports any tasks as assigned by supervisor.
  • Performs tasks safely with high quality.
  • Adhere to Environmental, Health and Safety policy, 5S, and other requirements relating to care of equipment and PPE.

Who You Are:

You quickly and decisively take action in fast-changing, unpredictable situations. You anticipate customer needs and provide services that are beyond customer expectations. You deliver messages in a clear, compelling, and concise manner.

For This Role, You Will Need:

  • Be fluent in simple English.
  • Having valid Forklift License
  • Capable of efficiently organizing work/tasks

Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:

  • Experience in using MS Office software, experience in using Oracle System will be an advantage.
  • Experiences in a distribution Centre is an advantage.

Our Offer to You:

By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do.

Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets . We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees.

We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion . We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship .

We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential . We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company.

We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office.

Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities.

Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson .

companyInfo/companyDescription:
We are agents of change. We start by turning convention on its head. Family owned, beholden to no one, so we can forge our own path - different and authentic. Never satisfied, we constantly strive to find a better way. We solve problems that others choose to ignore with ingenious new technologies that defy convention and simply work better. 

In 2012 we were 3120 people. Today we're over 14,000. Our future is bright and the next few years are set to be our busiest yet as we continue to innovate and disrupt with new categories, new machines, and launching more demo stores all over the world. This gives us the opportunity to bring all our technologies together into a single product. 

We never have and never will stand still.

#InsideDyson
description:
Summary 
 
  
   Salary:
   
  
   Competitive
   
  
   Team:
   
  
   Graduates, Interns and Apprentices
   
  
   Location:
   
  
   Singapore - Technology Centre
  
 
 


 
  
   
    About us
     Dyson is a global technology enterprise. We solve the problems others choose to ignore, with surprising new inventions that defy convention and simply work better. We’re driven by progress and thrive on the challenge of relentless improvement. We’re growing fast and our ambition is huge – more categories, more locations, and more people.
     Our scale and rapid growth make Dyson rich in new opportunities. We value new ideas and diverse perspectives, so our people are trusted with real work and responsibility from the outset. You’ll develop fast and have the chance to move into different business areas and regions. And you’ll be part of a global network of like-minded people – a community that supports and learns from each other.
     At Dyson we do things differently. We look for the brightest new graduates with the right attitude to thrive in our unique culture. We offer real jobs with real salaries and real prospects. We need self-starters, people who are motivated and drive themselves forward. You can’t sit back and wait to be told what to do. You will have autonomy and freedom to excel and will be pushed forward to become our future leaders.
     Within the Energy Storage Development team, we are developing our first Li-ion battery cell with unique techniques and approaches. The scope of Material and Characterisation team spans across the project, from ensuring high quality and control on materials selection to understanding the behaviour of materials from processes to electrochemical performances in the final product.
   
   
     About the role
    
      This project will start with familiarisation of the ESD teams and activities of lithium-ion cell development
      Understand the fundamentals of cells, qualitative and quantitative material properties characterization, and manufacturing processes related to cell engineering materials.
      You will be involved in anode development from raw materials to small cell prototyping to demonstrate technology improvement
      You will contribute to overall selection, characterisation and validation activities of anode raw materials for energy storage application
      You will be designing, performing and optimising processes involved in electrode fabrication and its integration within cells, evaluating electrochemical performance
      You will diligently ensure proper documentation and upkeep of technical data, laboratory procedures, and materials
      You will be working closely with internal multifunctional teams, engaging with materials and equipment suppliers
    
     Working alongside your team/engineers, scientists, and technical experts across a broad range of disciplines, you’ll be comfortable learning from others but also sharing your own knowledge, ideas and opinions.
     Our graduate programme is designed to help you drive your career at Dyson with a two-year journey to help you grow both personally and professionally. We’ll help you to improve your knowledge and support your future career progression with workshops to give you baseline soft skills in addition to technical training. Our unique experiential journey provides a framework so you can reach your full potential with leadership talks, lunch-and-learns and more. You may have the opportunity to rotate into a variety of teams to support your professional development.
   
   
     About you
    
      Degree in material science, chemical engineering or related disciplines
      Comfortable with hands-on wet laboratory work, following good practices for safe experiment execution
      Strong interest and knowledge of electrochemistry with data analysis (e.g. voltammetry, EIS, battery cell cycling) and problem-solving skills
      Experience with hands-on material characterisation techniques (e.g. SEM, XRD, rheometry) would be a plus
      Intellectual curiosity, desire to learn from challenges with ‘’can-do’’ attitude
      Team player with excellent communication skills to work in multicultural environment with highly interactive teams
    
     Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.

About us

Dyson is a global technology enterprise. We solve the problems others choose to ignore, with surprising new inventions that defy convention and simply work better. We’re driven by progress and thrive on the challenge of relentless improvement. We’re growing fast and our ambition is huge – more categories, more locations, and more people.

Our scale and rapid growth make Dyson rich in new opportunities. We value new ideas and diverse perspectives, so our people are trusted with real work and responsibility from the outset. You’ll develop fast and have the chance to move into different business areas and regions. And you’ll be part of a global network of like-minded people – a community that supports and learns from each other.

At Dyson we do things differently. We look for the brightest new graduates with the right attitude to thrive in our unique culture. We offer real jobs with real salaries and real prospects. We need self-starters, people who are motivated and drive themselves forward. You can’t sit back and wait to be told what to do. You will have autonomy and freedom to excel and will be pushed forward to become our future leaders.

Within the Energy Storage Development team, we are developing our first Li-ion battery cell with unique techniques and approaches. The scope of Material and Characterisation team spans across the project, from ensuring high quality and control on materials selection to understanding the behaviour of materials from processes to electrochemical performances in the final product.

About the role

  • This project will start with familiarisation of the ESD teams and activities of lithium-ion cell development

  • Understand the fundamentals of cells, qualitative and quantitative material properties characterization, and manufacturing processes related to cell engineering materials.

  • You will be involved in anode development from raw materials to small cell prototyping to demonstrate technology improvement

  • You will contribute to overall selection, characterisation and validation activities of anode raw materials for energy storage application

  • You will be designing, performing and optimising processes involved in electrode fabrication and its integration within cells, evaluating electrochemical performance

  • You will diligently ensure proper documentation and upkeep of technical data, laboratory procedures, and materials

  • You will be working closely with internal multifunctional teams, engaging with materials and equipment suppliers

Working alongside your team/engineers, scientists, and technical experts across a broad range of disciplines, you’ll be comfortable learning from others but also sharing your own knowledge, ideas and opinions.

Our graduate programme is designed to help you drive your career at Dyson with a two-year journey to help you grow both personally and professionally. We’ll help you to improve your knowledge and support your future career progression with workshops to give you baseline soft skills in addition to technical training. Our unique experiential journey provides a framework so you can reach your full potential with leadership talks, lunch-and-learns and more. You may have the opportunity to rotate into a variety of teams to support your professional development.

About you

  • Degree in material science, chemical engineering or related disciplines

  • Comfortable with hands-on wet laboratory work, following good practices for safe experiment execution

  • Strong interest and knowledge of electrochemistry with data analysis (e.g. voltammetry, EIS, battery cell cycling) and problem-solving skills

  • Experience with hands-on material characterisation techniques (e.g. SEM, XRD, rheometry) would be a plus

  • Intellectual curiosity, desire to learn from challenges with ‘’can-do’’ attitude

  • Team player with excellent communication skills to work in multicultural environment with highly interactive teams


Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.

description:
WHO WE ARE? 
   Well known Bubble Tea company 
   We are currently expanding our operations and are looking for Management Trainees with the potential to be promoted to Support store manager. 
   
   WHAT WE OFFER? 
   Attractive Income 
   Valuable Paid Training Provided 
   Good career progression 
   
   WHAT CAN YOU LEARN? 
   As a Management Trainee, you will be undergoing a training of 12 months (6months+2months+2months+2months) to develop you as key person in our company's key business functions. We are proud of our management trainees and have great respect for the work you do. Therefore, we value your training and development program and your personal learning journey throughout the program. 
   
   You will be assigned a mentor/coach throughout the training to facilitate learning process. 
   
   The below course is designed to allowed selected trainees the best hands-on training experience, this is the perfect opportunity to build a successful management career. 
   
   First 6 months (Basic and Work shift development) 
   
  
   You will be trained to handle full outlet operations in the first 6 months which includes backend kitchen duties, front end customer services, tea making procedure, product quality assurance, manpower planning and cost controlling. 
  
 
 
  Second 2 months (Training store) 
   
  
   You will be assigned to other training outlets to apply what you have been learn in the past 6 months; you will guide the new join as a mentor/coach’s anger. 
  
 
 
  Third 2 months (Leadership development) 
   
  
   You will learn how to manage a store to understand the fundamentals of business structure and develop your strengths to build your leadership qualities. 
  
 
 
  Fourth 2 months (QC/Training course) 
   
  
   You will also have the chance to attend QC and Training course that will equip with essential expertise to perform future assigned positions. 
  
   RESPONSIBILITIES: 
   
  
   Assist the manager in the daily management of the day-to-day operations of the restaurant 
   Attend to customers' request efficiently and effectively 
   Maintain restaurant cleanliness 
  
   Fresh graduates ,no experience and career switcher are welcomed to apply. 
   Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted 
   
   BENEFITS: 
   
  
   Attractive remuneration. Salary commensurate with experience. 
   Transport Allowances 
   Meal Allowances 
   Staff drink 
   Annual Leave 
   Health and Dental Benefits 
   Training and Career Progression 
   Training provided 
   Terms and Conditions apply

description:
Company Description 
 
  IMPACT! Brand Communications is a full-service marketing agency, focused on the B2B, technology, financial services and healthcare sectors. Through our specialisations in integrated marketing and communications, we build programmes and campaigns that deliver revenue growth. Connect with us on LinkedIn as we share the latest updates and insights from the digital marketing world. 
 
 
  
 Job Description 
 
  We are looking for a talented and motivated driven and experienced Public Relations Executive for our marketing agency. Working in the role, you will have the opportunity to work on integrated marketing and communications campaigns for leading B2B, technology and financial services clients in the APAC market. You will play a role in the success of our digital marketing, content and public relations business units. 
 
 
  
 What You’ll Do 
 
  Content development: Create compelling content for various formats, such as press releases, bylines, and email interviews. 
  Media relations: Pitch media opportunities, coordinate interviews, and build relationships with journalists to secure coverage for clients. 
  Client relations: Manage day-to-day client communication, answer queries, and provide reports. 
  Account management: Monitor media mentions, generate reports, and support account activities. 
  New business development: Assist with research and brainstorming for new business initiatives. 
 
 
  
 Qualifications 
 
  1-3 years of experience in PR, or relevant internship experience for recent graduates. 
  Strong writing and communication skills. 
  Experience with media relations and social media platforms. 
  Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and a positive attitude. 
  Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. Interest in current trends, technology, and storytelling. 
 
 
  
 Additional Information 
 
  Why our employees choose to work here? 
  We work with some of the most leading B2B, technology and financial services brands around. 
  There’s plenty of growth opportunities for the right candidates, being on the ground floor of a fast-growing marketing agency and startup. 
  We invest in your learning and growth, making sure you develop as a business professional. 
  We believe in work-life balance, with a remote work environment and colleagues across the APAC region. 
 
 - 
 
  
 Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be approached. Thank you! 
 
  
 Send in your application with your CV and portfolio (if any).

    Job Description
  
  
   
     This is a supportive role to the Broking department to assist in the servicing of our customers’ accounts of vessels Hartland Singapore fixes, and to make sure all brokers’ requests are adhered to
     and implemented. The role will also take on a commercial element under the guidance of the shipbrokers.
     
     Responsibilities
     
    
     Daily communication with the Owners and Charterers for fixtures which have been confirmed by the
     brokerage team including adherence to time-bars
     
    
     Recording and maintaining fixtures on the post-fixture software.
     Issue brokerage commission invoices
     Monitor payment status for broker commission.
     Provide any additional support and information as brokers’ request.
     Office administrative duties
    
   
  
 
 
  
    Job Requirement
  
  
   
     Candidate Requirements
     
    
     Self-driven
     Attentive to detail
     Good interpersonal and networking skills
     Contribute to a positive and cooperative working environment by fulfilling own responsibilities and providing support to co-workers
     Proficiency in a second or third language is preferred but not required
     At least 1 year working experience is preferred but Fresh graduates are welcome to apply
     Knowledge in shipping is preferred but not essential
     Start date: To Be Discussed
    
   
  
 
 
  
    About Hartland Shipping Services (singapore) Pte Ltd
  
  
    Ship Broking
  
   Hartland Shipping Services (Formerly HSBC Shipping Services) is an experienced, specialised shipbroking and consulting team with offices in London, Shanghai and Singapore. The company provides a full range of shipbroking and chartering services, industry research and highly specialised advisory and consultancy work for the shipping industry. Hartland is also one of the panellists of The Baltic Exchange. For more information, please visit our website at: www.hartlandshipping.com

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Applied Materials (Nasdaq: AMAT) is the leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality. At Applied Materials, our innovations Make Possible a Better Future.

Mission: To lead the world with materials engineering solutions that enable customers to transform possibilities into reality.
description:
Overview
  
   Applied Materials New College Graduates (NCG) Program is a 16-month inter-department training program with the aim to nurture future leader for Applied’s Global Supply Chain organization. The NCG program consists of structured training modules providing learning opportunities through classroom trainings and interactions with experienced colleagues. The participants will rotate through positions in Purchasing, Sourcing, and Commodity Management, all while developing the technical and business skills required to be successful in the Supply Chain organization.
  
   General Profile
  
   Performs routine assignments in the entry level to a professional job progression. Typically has knowledge of and exposure to fundamental theories, principles and concepts. Develops competence by performing structured work assignments. Uses existing procedures to solve routine or standard problems. Receives instruction, guidance and direction from other team members.
  
   Key Responsibilities
  
    Engages new supplier introduction and/or disengagement requirements to/from the Applied Materials supply base.
    Supports the maintenance of agreements with suppliers that provide the structure for all business relationships between Applied Materials and the supply base.
    Develops strategies to procure components at the lowest cost consistent with consideration of quality, reliability of source and urgency of need.
    Assists in creation of commodity road maps and implements commodity strategies.
    Supports new product development program and PLC process to ensure alignment with Applied’s commodity strategies.
    Drives material cost reduction projects. Activities include but not limited to supplier negotiations, collaboration with engineering on design optimization and should costing.
    Assists in supplier price and delivery negotiations; under direct supervision may negotiate contracts as necessary.
    Utilizes the preferred supplier selection and assessment process when selecting suppliers; Completes supplier risk assessment on critical and unique parts; Monitors supplier performance (delivery, quality, cost).
    Drives resolution to systematic supply chain issues affecting quality, cost, delivery or lead-time.
    Drives initiatives on process improvement, optimization and digitalization of work processes within GSC community.
    Under direct supervision, forecasts and communicates engineering, materials, and manufacturing requirements to suppliers. Coordinates demand signals through MRP to minimize inventory exposure.
    Review and resolve material shortages to ensure continuity of production activities.
    Provides input to outsourcing decisions by performing make versus buy analysis.
  
  
   Requirements
  
    Graduating with a Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Engineering, Business Management, Data Analytics or related field
    Proficiency in developing effective executive reports and presentations
    Proficiency in Microsoft office tools
    Excellent listening, writing, quantitative, qualitative and oral communication skills
    Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact cross-organizationally
    Ability to problem-solve creatively and analytically
    Detail-oriented; ability to multi-task; deadline-oriented
    Flexible and adaptable mindset
    Thrive in a results-driven culture
  
  
   Qualifications
  
   Education: Bachelor's Degree

descriptionHTML:
Overview

Applied Materials New College Graduates (NCG) Program is a 16-month inter-department training program with the aim to nurture future leader for Applied’s Global Supply Chain organization. The NCG program consists of structured training modules providing learning opportunities through classroom trainings and interactions with experienced colleagues. The participants will rotate through positions in Purchasing, Sourcing, and Commodity Management, all while developing the technical and business skills required to be successful in the Supply Chain organization.

General Profile

Performs routine assignments in the entry level to a professional job progression. Typically has knowledge of and exposure to fundamental theories, principles and concepts. Develops competence by performing structured work assignments. Uses existing procedures to solve routine or standard problems. Receives instruction, guidance and direction from other team members.

Key Responsibilities

  • Engages new supplier introduction and/or disengagement requirements to/from the Applied Materials supply base.

  • Supports the maintenance of agreements with suppliers that provide the structure for all business relationships between Applied Materials and the supply base.

  • Develops strategies to procure components at the lowest cost consistent with consideration of quality, reliability of source and urgency of need.

  • Assists in creation of commodity road maps and implements commodity strategies.

  • Supports new product development program and PLC process to ensure alignment with Applied’s commodity strategies.

  • Drives material cost reduction projects. Activities include but not limited to supplier negotiations, collaboration with engineering on design optimization and should costing.

  • Assists in supplier price and delivery negotiations; under direct supervision may negotiate contracts as necessary.

  • Utilizes the preferred supplier selection and assessment process when selecting suppliers; Completes supplier risk assessment on critical and unique parts; Monitors supplier performance (delivery, quality, cost).

  • Drives resolution to systematic supply chain issues affecting quality, cost, delivery or lead-time.

  • Drives initiatives on process improvement, optimization and digitalization of work processes within GSC community.

  • Under direct supervision, forecasts and communicates engineering, materials, and manufacturing requirements to suppliers. Coordinates demand signals through MRP to minimize inventory exposure.

  • Review and resolve material shortages to ensure continuity of production activities.

  • Provides input to outsourcing decisions by performing make versus buy analysis.

Requirements

  • Graduating with a Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Engineering, Business Management, Data Analytics or related field

  • Proficiency in developing effective executive reports and presentations

  • Proficiency in Microsoft office tools

  • Excellent listening, writing, quantitative, qualitative and oral communication skills

  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact cross-organizationally

  • Ability to problem-solve creatively and analytically

  • Detail-oriented; ability to multi-task; deadline-oriented

  • Flexible and adaptable mindset

  • Thrive in a results-driven culture

Qualifications

Education:

Bachelor's Degree

companyInfo/companyDescription:
At MSD, we are unified around our purpose: We use the power of leading-edge science to save and improve lives around the world. For more than 130 years, we have brought hope to humanity through the development of important medicines and vaccines. We aspire to be the premier research-intensive biopharmaceutical company in the world – and today, we are at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions that advance the prevention and treatment of diseases in people and animals. We foster a diverse and inclusive global workforce and operate responsibly every day to enable a safe, sustainable and healthy future for all people and communities.

You'll find rewarding opportunities, diverse experiences, and an unwavering commitment to ethics and integrity. You'll collaborate with talented colleagues who share your sense of purpose. Our company will empower you to innovate, explore, and develop your full potential in our possibility-rich environment. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.
description:
Artificial intelligence is transforming the way we save and improve lives. The rising use of machine learning and advanced analytics brings great potential as well as risks of unintended consequences. Effectively scaling AI from bench to production rests on doing the right thing, with ethical policies, responsible development, and implementations that respect people, fairness, inclusion, and prevent harm.
 
  As an AI Ethics and Governance Analyst, you will be part of our diverse and dynamic AI Ethics and Governance team based in our Singapore Technology Center working on AI risk assessment and governance processes in the organization.
 
  You will be part of a key global project, working alongside subject matter experts and honing your skills and expertise in responsible AI. We are a highly collaborative team and our work is inherently cross-functional. You will have the chance to meet and work with stakeholders across the organization including senior leaders and have exposure to projects in human and animal health, business operations, supply chain management, clinical research, and IT.
 
  You will have the opportunity to be a pioneer in the rapidly growing and ever recognized field of Responsible AI. In this role, you will:
 
   Find and Mitigate Risks in AI Projects. Play a vital role during the design and planning phase of AI systems. Work with business and technical stakeholders and the AI Ethics and Governance team to identify and assess potential risks and impacts, recommend appropriate mitigations, and prevent harm.
   Co-ordinate efforts between AI Ethics and Governance team and technical and business stakeholders. Ensure assessments are completed smoothly by assisting stakeholders with inquiries and providing advice on completed assessments.
   Support development and implementation of policy processes and further the field of AI ethics. Be involved with building a safe, responsible, and ethical AI ecosystem in the organization and external industry. Stay on top of technological developments, best practices, and regulatory changes, and support the roll out of policy processes to improve compliance.
   Support implementation of explainable AI (XAI), develop tests, and audit AI models and data sets for bias and fairness. Design and conduct tests and experiments using open-source and enterprise tools to evaluate in-house and commercial AI solutions for bias, fairness, and explainability.
 
  If you are (or have):
 
   Self-motivated and driven to learn new topics and develop your domain expertise. You find excitement in being at the bleeding edge of an emerging field.
   Passionate about building a fairer and more inclusive AI ecosystem with respect for all. You have a keen interest in AI ethics, explainable AI, data privacy and governance frameworks.
   Enjoy working in a diverse and cross-functional team with good communication and interpersonal skills.
   Experience in risk management, assessment and/or analysis.
   Experience in data analytics, statistics, experimental design and machine learning tools and techniques (e.g. Python or R, scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy, Dataiku, Databricks, Amazon SageMaker, generative models, synthetic data) is a plus.
   Experience in XAI tools and techniques (e.g. SHAP, LIME, etc.) is a plus.
   0-2 years relevant working experience (e.g. data science, AI or ML engineering, software development, cybersecurity, and more)
   Recent graduates are welcome to apply.
 
  Then, we invite you to apply now to be a part of our awesome and growing AI Ethics and Governance team!
 
  Current Employees apply HERE
 
  Current Contingent Workers apply HERE
 
  Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme LLC, Rahway, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.
 
  Employee Status: Temporary (Fixed Term)
 
  Relocation:
 
  VISA Sponsorship:
 
  Travel Requirements:
 
  Flexible Work Arrangements: Hybrid
 
  Shift:
 
  Valid Driving License:
 
  Hazardous Material(s):
 
  Required Skills: Information Security, Machine Learning, Perform Testing, Software Development, System Designs, Systems Integration
 
  Preferred Skills:
  Requisition ID:R284966
descriptionHTML:
Artificial intelligence is transforming the way we save and improve lives. The rising use of machine learning and advanced analytics brings great potential as well as risks of unintended consequences. Effectively scaling AI from bench to production rests on doing the right thing, with ethical policies, responsible development, and implementations that respect people, fairness, inclusion, and prevent harm.

As an AI Ethics and Governance Analyst, you will be part of our diverse and dynamic AI Ethics and Governance team based in our Singapore Technology Center working on AI risk assessment and governance processes in the organization.

You will be part of a key global project, working alongside subject matter experts and honing your skills and expertise in responsible AI. We are a highly collaborative team and our work is inherently cross-functional. You will have the chance to meet and work with stakeholders across the organization including senior leaders and have exposure to projects in human and animal health, business operations, supply chain management, clinical research, and IT.

You will have the opportunity to be a pioneer in the rapidly growing and ever recognized field of Responsible AI. In this role, you will:

  • Find and Mitigate Risks in AI Projects. Play a vital role during the design and planning phase of AI systems. Work with business and technical stakeholders and the AI Ethics and Governance team to identify and assess potential risks and impacts, recommend appropriate mitigations, and prevent harm.

  • Co-ordinate efforts between AI Ethics and Governance team and technical and business stakeholders. Ensure assessments are completed smoothly by assisting stakeholders with inquiries and providing advice on completed assessments.

  • Support development and implementation of policy processes and further the field of AI ethics. Be involved with building a safe, responsible, and ethical AI ecosystem in the organization and external industry. Stay on top of technological developments, best practices, and regulatory changes, and support the roll out of policy processes to improve compliance.

  • Support implementation of explainable AI (XAI), develop tests, and audit AI models and data sets for bias and fairness. Design and conduct tests and experiments using open-source and enterprise tools to evaluate in-house and commercial AI solutions for bias, fairness, and explainability.

If you are (or have):

  • Self-motivated and driven to learn new topics and develop your domain expertise. You find excitement in being at the bleeding edge of an emerging field.

  • Passionate about building a fairer and more inclusive AI ecosystem with respect for all. You have a keen interest in AI ethics, explainable AI, data privacy and governance frameworks.

  • Enjoy working in a diverse and cross-functional team with good communication and interpersonal skills.

  • Experience in risk management, assessment and/or analysis.

  • Experience in data analytics, statistics, experimental design and machine learning tools and techniques (e.g. Python or R, scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy, Dataiku, Databricks, Amazon SageMaker, generative models, synthetic data) is a plus.

  • Experience in XAI tools and techniques (e.g. SHAP, LIME, etc.) is a plus.

  • 0-2 years relevant working experience (e.g. data science, AI or ML engineering, software development, cybersecurity, and more)

  • Recent graduates are welcome to apply.

Then, we invite you to apply now to be a part of our awesome and growing AI Ethics and Governance team!

companyInfo/companyDescription: Emerson is a diversified global manufacturing and technology company. It offers a wide range of products and services in the areas of network power, process management, industrial automation, and tools and storage businesses. Recognized widely for its engineering capabilities and management excellence, Emerson has over 66,000 employees and 130 manufacturing locations worldwide.
description:
Job Summary: 
 If you are looking for an Inspection technician job, Emerson has a great opportunity for you! Based in our Singapore location, this role will handle inspections and testing of received parts. 
 In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be: 
 
  Perform inspection on physical, mechanical and/or electrical properties of received parts of subassemblies according to the defined criteria and collection plan. 
  Accurately update and document the results of the inspections and testing. 
  Manage and maintain all controlled documents and inspection records. 
  Monitors the MRB area and processes rejected material, utilizing the Oracle Quality Module, in accordance with established procedures. 
  Perform first article inspection with coordinated measurement machine programming. 
  Develops and conducts training as required. 
  Coordinates efforts with other work groups in understanding inspection methods/issues. 
  Assist in the construction and/or revision inspection procedures, work instructions and checklists. 
  Takes initiative to identify and resolve root causes of problems relating to inspection procedures, disposition of defective material or problems with parts received. 
  Monitor and coordinate calibration of all measuring equipment, fixtures and critical operation equipment and instrumentation. 
  Assist in control of documents and records; conduct periodical document process audits. 
  Assist in other tasks as assigned by the superior. 
 
 Who You Are: 
 You stay aligned with your goals and stay productive. You display a can-do attitude in good and bad times. You understand the importance and interdependence of internal customer relationships. You understand the importance and interdependence of internal customer relationships. You persist in accomplishing objectives despite obstacles and setbacks. 
 For This Role, You Will Need: 
 
  NITEC/Higher NITEC/Diploma in Engineering with at least 3 to 5 years of work experience in inspection environment. 
  Able to read & understand engineering drawings and knowledge on Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerance (GD&T). 
  Proficient in regular dimensional measuring instruments and able to use Co-ordinated Measuring Machine (CMM) & Smartscope. 
  Demonstrate knowledge in material certification, sampling plan, non-conformance handling process. 
 
 Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart: 
 
  Possess good interpersonal and strong communication skills. 
 
 Our Offer to You: 
 By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do. 
 Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets . We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees. 
 We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion . We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship . 
 We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential . We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company. 
 We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office. 
 Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities. 
 Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent. 
 Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion 
 At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers. 
 This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson . 
 If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .
 


 WHY EMERSON 
 Our Commitment to Our People 
 At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration. 
 We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor. 
 
 At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together. 
 Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation 
 If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com . 
 
 ABOUT EMERSON 
 Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability. 
 With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety. 
 
 We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go! 
 No calls or agencies please.

description:
Scratch is a design and build consultancy that is focused on developing holistic spaces in the built environment for residential and commercial applications. 
 
  
 We are looking for design oriented self-starters, with high level of attention to detail and curiosity for innovation. 
 
  
 Individual to be Involved in: 
 
  
 1. Project coordination and site planning, handling of schedule and timelines. 
 
  
 2. Purchasing with suppliers, and delivery coordination with quality assurance. 
 
  
 3. Communication with team and stakeholders with 3D and 2D CAD visualisation and drawings. 
 
  
 4. Client coverage and to develop a close relationship with all stakeholders throughout duration of project. 
 
  
 This position reports to the project leader and interfaces with design and projects team, contractors, suppliers and clients. 
 
  
 Technical Skills and Competencies: 
 
  Active participation in strategic planning process, including developing goals and objectives. 
 
 
  Active learning in project management software, while forecasting effective management of stakeholders. 
 
 
  Active familarisation in 2d and 3d visualisation software. 
 
 
  Active coordination of various subs, elements, sourcing and fabrication within the project. 
 
 
  Self motivated and willingness to learn. 
 
 
  
 Scratch is committed to an employee-orientated, high performance culture that emphasises empowerment, quality, continuous improvement, and the recruitment and on-going development of a superior workplace. 
 
  
 This position is open for both recent graduates and mid-career individuals (mature and non mature). 
 
  
 Graduates interested in this position should possess a Degree and above qualification. 
 
  
 Mid-career individuals from any qualification level can apply. 
 
  
 Interns can apply for traineeship positions.

description:
Job Position: Assistant, Corporate Secretarial 
 
  
 **Job Description:** 
 We are seeking a Company Secretary/admin assistant to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of one year of relevant work experience. Proficiency in both Chinese and English languages is required. 
 
  
 **Responsibilities:** 
 
  Ensuring compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements as per Singapore company Act. 
 
 
  Managing and maintaining company records and registers. 
 
 
  Facilitating procedures of attending board meetings, including preparing agendas and minutes. 
 
 
  Liaising with ACRA and other regulatory bodies as necessary. 
 
 
  Providing guidance and advice to the board of directors of client on corporate governance matters. 
 
 
  
 **Requirements:** 
 
  Bachelor's degree in Law, Business, or related field. 
 
 
  Minimum of one year of experience working as a Company Secretary. 
 
 
  Strong knowledge of Singapore company Act and ACRA requirements. 
 
 
  Proficiency in both Chinese and English languages, with excellent communication skills. 
 
 
  Detail-oriented with strong organizational and multitasking abilities. 
 
 
  
 Fresh Graduates Welcome! 
 
  
 We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. 
 
  
 We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

description:
Join Our Dynamic Sales Team! 
 Are you a recent graduate looking to kickstart your career in sales and marketing? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment where your hard work directly translates into success? Look no further! 
 We are seeking ambitious individuals to join our expanding sales team as Events Brand Ambassador. No prior experience is necessary – we provide comprehensive coaching and guidance to help you excel in this role. 
 Why Join Us? 
 
  
   Career Progression: At our company, we believe in recognizing and rewarding talent. Your dedication and performance will pave the way for exciting opportunities for career advancement. 
  
  
   Uncapped Earning Potential: Your earnings are directly linked to your performance. With our generous commission structure, the sky's the limit! 
  
  
   Comprehensive Mentorship: We understand that starting a new career can be daunting. That's why we provide thorough guidance and ongoing support to ensure your success. 
  
  
   Dynamic Work Environment: Join a team of passionate professionals who are dedicated to achieving excellence. You'll work in a collaborative atmosphere where innovation and creativity are encouraged. 
  
 
 Responsibilities: 
 
  Building and maintaining relationships with customers to understand their needs and preferences. 
  Presenting our products and services to prospects in a compelling manner. 
  Negotiating and closing deals to meet and exceed sales targets. 
 
 Requirements: 
 
  Strong communication and interpersonal skills. 
  Self-motivated with a drive to succeed. 
  Ability to work independently and as part of a team. 
 
 Ready to Take the Next Step? 
 If you're ready to embark on an exciting career journey with limitless potential, we want to hear from you! Send us your resume and cover letter and let's explore how you can thrive as a part of our dynamic sales team. 
 Join us and unlock your full potential!
