Why Join Us?

  • Career Progression: At our company, we believe in recognizing and rewarding talent. Your dedication and performance will pave the way for exciting opportunities for career advancement.
  • Uncapped Earning Potential: Your earnings are directly linked to your performance. With our generous commission structure, the sky's the limit!
  • Comprehensive Mentorship: We understand that starting a new career can be daunting. That's why we provide thorough guidance and ongoing support to ensure your success.
  • Dynamic Work Environment: Join a team of passionate professionals who are dedicated to achieving excellence. You'll work in a collaborative atmosphere where innovation and creativity are encouraged.

Responsibilities:

  • Building and maintaining relationships with customers to understand their needs and preferences.
  • Presenting our products and services to prospects in a compelling manner.
  • Negotiating and closing deals to meet and exceed sales targets.

Requirements:

  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Self-motivated with a drive to succeed.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Ready to Take the Next Step?

If you're ready to embark on an exciting career journey with limitless potential, we want to hear from you! Send us your resume and cover letter and let's explore how you can thrive as a part of our dynamic sales team.

Join us and unlock your full potential!

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Every day, in everything we do, our purpose is to protect, heal and nurture in the relentless pursuit of a cleaner, healthier world. And we have a fight on our hands. A fight to make access to the highest quality hygiene, wellness and nourishment a right and not a privilege.

Each of our products is designed to do exactly this. Our well-loved brands have been making a difference to people’s daily lives around the world for more than 200 years. Brands including: Durex, Dettol, Enfamil, Nurofen, Strepsils, Gaviscon, Mucinex, Nutramigen, Lysol, Harpic, Cillit Bang, Finish and Vanish.

By 2030, our ambition is to reach half of the world, every year. We’re a growing global community of over 43,000 people on a journey of transformation and sustainable growth. Together, our success will continue to positively impact communities everywhere, for a healthier planet and a fairer society.

Want to learn more about us? Visit reckitt.com
description:
Home to the world's best loved and trusted hygiene, health, and nutrition brands. Our purpose defines why we exist: to protect, heal and nurture in the relentless pursuit of a cleaner, healthier world. We are a global team united by this purpose. 
    Join us in our fight to make access to the highest quality hygiene, wellness, and nourishment a right and not a privilege.
   
  
  
   
     Sales 
   
   
    Our Sales teams help to deliver Reckitt's purpose by building shared success with our customers, making access to the highest quality hygiene, wellness, and nourishment possible in-stores and online.  Within Sales, we're focused on achieving outperformance across all of our channels, operating in highly competitive categories. This focus results in a dynamic, fast paced environment where cross functional teams are encouraged to collaborate to achieve success.  We have around 10,000 sales people across the world, within market roles and ranging in areas like Field Sales, Key Accounts, Trade Marketing and Category Development. 
   
  
  
   
     About the role 
   
   
    
      Launch your career in sales with a dynamic internship at Reckitt! This is not your average sales role; it's a springboard into understanding the fast-paced world of sales from the inside out. As an intern in our slaes organisation, you'll learning about analysis, 4P strategy and customer engagement. You'll gain hands-on experience across diverse brands and play a supportive role in driving our business objectives.
     
   
  
  
   
     Your responsibilities 
   
   
    
      In summary, you'll:
      
     
      Gain a thorough understanding of Reckitt's expansive brand portfolio and sales techniques.
      Assist with crafting and executing impactful sales strategies.
      Collaborative with various teams to bolster sales efforts and achieve targets.
      Engage in analysis to spot sales opportunities and understand market trends.
      Contribute to providing great customer service and responding to client inquiries.
     
     
   
  
  
   
     The experience we're looking for 
   
   
    
     Recent graduate in Business, Marketing, or related field, eager to forge a path in sales.
     Strong verbal and written communication skills to interact effectively with the team and clients.
     An analytical approach with a talent for interpreting data and market insights.
     Resilience and adaptability within a vibrant sales environment.
     Organised, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple tasks under pressure.
     
   
  
  
   
     The skills for success 
   
   
     Work under pressure, Excellent writing skills, interpersonal skills, communication skills stakeholder management, organised. 
   
  
  
   
     What we offer 
   
   
     With inclusion at the heart of everything we do, working alongside our four global Employee Resource Groups, we support our people at every step of their career journey, helping them to succeed in their own individual way. 
    We invest in the wellbeing of our people through parental benefits, an Employee Assistance Program to promote mental health, and life insurance for all employees globally. We have a range of other benefits in line with the local market. Through our global share plans we offer the opportunity to save and share in Reckitt's potential future successes. For eligible roles, we also offer short-term incentives to recognise, appreciate and reward your work for delivering outstanding results. You will be rewarded in line with Reckitt's pay for performance philosophy.
   
  
  
   
     Equality 
   
   
     We recognise that in real life, great people don't always 'tick all the boxes'. That's why we hire for potential as well as experience. Even if you don't meet every point on the job description, if this role and our company feels like a good fit for you, we still want to hear from you. 
     All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, disability or medical condition; colour, ethnicity, race, citizenship, and national origin; religion, faith; pregnancy, family status and caring responsibilities; sexual orientation; sex, gender identity, gender expression, and transgender identity; protected veteran status; size or any other basis protected by appropriate law.

description:
Our esteemed client, a luxury hotel located at the heart of Singapore, is seeking passionate Fresh Graduates to join their Guest Experts team. This team is renowned for its expertise in providing a wide range of functions and delivering world-class service to guests throughout their stay. If you have a passion for hospitality and customer service, we invite you to apply now, and we will arrange a session to share more about the role with you! 
 
  
 1. Front Office & Desk 
 
  Initiate guest connections via email prior to arrival to personalize the guest stay experience. 
  Extend a warm and professional welcome to each guest, addressing them by name for a personalized touch. 
  Coordinate with Concierge for transportation arrangements as required. 
  Escort guests to their rooms and facilitate in-room check-ins for a seamless arrival experience. 
  Provide welcome refreshments and maintain awareness of room status changes. 
  Process guest check-ins and check-outs efficiently using the computer system. Oversee the Club Lounge, ensuring guest comfort and safety, and perform opening and closing duties as needed. 
 
 
  
 2. Housekeeping & Laundry 
 
  Extend a warm greeting to every guest and ensure their comfort throughout their stay. 
  Verify the functionality of room appliances and conduct thorough cleaning of bathrooms including bathtub/hot tub/shower and furnishings. 
  Manage uniform issuance and collection procedures efficiently. 
  Collect laundry from guest rooms and deliver it promptly to ensure guest satisfaction. 
  Maintain adequate supplies on cleaning carts 
  Accurately report room statuses. 
 
 Requirements: 
 
  Hold at least a Professional Certificate/NiTEC, Diploma, or equivalent qualification. 
  Willingness to work on a rotating shift basis, including overnight and weekends. 
  Passionate about the hospitality industry and dedicated to providing exceptional service. 
  Possess excellent customer service and interpersonal skills. 
 
 Interested candidates kindly click the APPLY NOW button. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. 
 By sending us your personal data and/or resume, you are deemed to consent to AM Recruitment Pte Ltd or its agents to collect, use and disclose your personal data and/or resume for the purpose of processing and administrating this job application. 
 Registration No: R23117478 (Mandy Lim Teng Hong) 
 EA Licence No: 23C1821 (AM Recruitment Pte Ltd)

description:
We are currently seeking a passionate and driven Junior Interior Designer to join our dynamic team. This position offers an excellent opportunity for growth and mentorship under experienced designers. The Junior Interior Designer will assist in various stages of the design process, from concept development to project completion, gaining valuable experience and contributing to our innovative projects. 
 
  
 Responsibilities: 
 
  Support senior designers in developing design concepts and presentations 
  Assist with space planning, furniture layout, and material selection 
  Create detailed drawings, renderings, and mood boards 
  Research design trends, materials, and finishes 
  Collaborate with team members and clients to execute design visions 
  Attend client meetings and site visits as needed 
  Help maintain project documentation and files 
 
 Qualifications: 
 
  Bachelor's degree in Interior Design or related field (recent graduates are welcome to apply) 
  Proficiency in design software such as AutoCAD, SketchUp, 3D Max etc. 
  Strong design sensibility and creativity 
  Excellent communication and teamwork skills 
  Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple task
descriptionHTML:
We are currently seeking a passionate and driven Junior Interior Designer to join our dynamic team. This position offers an excellent opportunity for growth and mentorship under experienced designers. The Junior Interior Designer will assist in various stages of the design process, from concept development to project completion, gaining valuable experience and contributing to our innovative projects.


Responsibilities:

  • Support senior designers in developing design concepts and presentations
  • Assist with space planning, furniture layout, and material selection
  • Create detailed drawings, renderings, and mood boards
  • Research design trends, materials, and finishes
  • Collaborate with team members and clients to execute design visions
  • Attend client meetings and site visits as needed
  • Help maintain project documentation and files

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Interior Design or related field (recent graduates are welcome to apply)
  • Proficiency in design software such as AutoCAD, SketchUp, 3D Max etc.
  • Strong design sensibility and creativity
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills
  • Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple task

JOB DESCRIPTIONS:

  • Assist in preparing project tender submission including bills of quantities, check tender drawing, material specifications, prepare and submit the P&S plan, shop drawing, & other required documents;
  • Assisst in preparing and submit monthly progress claims, VO, finalization of accounts;
  • Assist in taking measurement of quantities and cost estimation;
  • Assist in liaising with Managers, Team Members, Customers, Sub-Contractors and Suppliers;
  • Purchasing and inventory management;
  • Administrative tasks and ensure the office runs smoothly and work towards a good place to work for the team;
    • Perform other duties as assigned.


REQUIREMENTS:

  • Minimum Diploma and above in Quantity Surveyor or equivalent.
  • Fresh graduates and intern is welcome.
  • Able to work independently with minimum guidance and under pressure to meet tight schedules.
  • Good team player with strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Proficiency in AutoCAD
    • Immediate starter or short notice is an advantage



SHOULD YOU KEEN TO THE POSITION , PLEASE APPLY ONLINE ONLY .

OR EMAIL TO MAIN@WSG.COM.SG .

ONLY SHORTLISTED APPLICANTS WILL BE NOTIFIED .

description:
Job Description & Requirements 
 Roles & Responsibilities 
 Company with a chain of restaurants looking to hire individuals with enthusiasm for customer service. There will be opportunities to climb the ladder and be promoted to Supervisor and Manager position. 
 Customer Relations 
 
  Interact with guests for entertainment and rapport while garnering feedback for the growth of company. 
 
 
  Handle guests complaints and feedback with tact, to ensure all guests leave the restaurant with a smile. 
 
 Maintenance of Restaurant 
 
  Maintain high levels of hygiene and cleanliness of restaurant to ensure pleasant during experience for every guest. 
 
 
  Daily housekeeping to ensure highest quality of cleanliness. 
 
 Front of House 
 
  As front of house crew, to maintain a friendly and positive vibe for both guests and colleagues by smiling and greeting. 
 
 
  If on POS duty, candidate will be the last point of contact before guests leave, thus must ensure to solve any complaints. 
 
 Requirements 
 Language 
 
  Fluent in spoken and written English 
 
 
  Will be a bonus if candidate able to speak Mandarin/Korean 
 
 Experience 
 
  Fresh graduates may apply with relevant education 
 
 
  Preferably at least 1 year experience in customer service or F&B industry

description:
Job Description 
 Responsibilities : 
 
  to design and develop project brief in accordance with client’s requirements and authority regulations 
  to prepare design proposal including plans, drawings, details and specifications 
  to liaise with clients and contractors on project matters 
  to facilitate in contract administration and project certification 
  to coordinate in project management and to liaise with all relevant authority clearances to ensure timely completion of project 
  to make site visit to check on progress and condition 
  to solve problem that might occur throughout the project 
  to attend and chair the project meeting 
 
 Job Requirement 
 Requirements : 
 
  a recognised Degree in Architecture 
  minimum 3 years of related working experience 
  good knowledge of computer 3D presentation, highly proficient in Photoshop, Sketchup, AutoCad and Revit 
  good knowledge of architectural details, working drawings and construction practices 
  good analytical and design skill 
  knowledgeable in local authority requirements and regulations 
  good oral & interpersonal skills in dealing with individuals and groups at all levels
descriptionHTML:
Job Description

Responsibilities :

  • to design and develop project brief in accordance with client’s requirements and authority regulations
  • to prepare design proposal including plans, drawings, details and specifications
  • to liaise with clients and contractors on project matters
  • to facilitate in contract administration and project certification
  • to coordinate in project management and to liaise with all relevant authority clearances to ensure timely completion of project
  • to make site visit to check on progress and condition

  • good knowledge of computer 3D presentation, highly proficient in Photoshop, Sketchup, AutoCad and Revit
  • good knowledge of architectural details, working drawings and construction practices

companyInfo/companyDescription:
SAP is one of the world’s leading producers of software for business process management. Today, SAP has over 250 million cloud users and more than 100 solutions covering all industries and business functions.

Every day, we help companies and organizations of all sizes and industries to run their businesses profitably, to adapt continuously, and grow sustainably.
description:
We help the world run better
  Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!
 
  Purpose & Objective of Position
  As HR Directors in Asia we aim to provide with first class people experiences in our region, enable and strive our employees and leaders to run at their best, cultivate an inclusive and innovate culture and ensure compliance aligned to labor law regulations. 
 We are looking to develop new HR talent, who are well versed and comfortable using, analyzing and presenting Data and that are excited to help us bring our People Strategy to live.
  
 Expectations & Tasks
  We're looking for an individual who is self-starter, someone who aims to go above expectations, is curios to learn something new every day, is passionate of supporting building big things and likes to createe positive impact with every deliverable and wants to engage with the community at SAP.
  
 
 
   Serves as an analyst for assigned HRDs including analyzing, interpreting, and preparing a visual representation for customer delivery.
   Designs, plans, monitors, and deliver on initiatives focused on improving Culture, Engagement
   Supports on multiple projects or initiatives in parallel to ensure we comply to our local labor law regulations.
   Supports on creating engaging communication assets, managing SharePoint to have a solid narrative in HR to position our strategy and initiatives.
   Serve as a thought leader on the team by consistently contributing ideas and by developing new ways to bring value to your designated team of HRDs; help with special projects and showcase your creativity.
   Provide day to day support to Regional HRDs which includes analyzing the HR system data, auditing organizational hierarchies, resolving system inaccuracies, and coaching leaders on tools and processes.
   Be curious and find creative ways to help the HR community run simpler.
 
  Skills / Competencies
 
   Strong orientation to Data and Analytics is a must
   Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite with an emphasis on MS Excel and MS PowerPoint
   Ability to follow through and respond to requests with high degree of accuracy, urgency, timeliness, and professionalism
   Ability to lead moderate size programs of minimal to moderate complexity
   Strong team orientation
   Loves ideating, designing and delivering People Initiatives
   Attention to detail
   Ability to accept feedback to continuously improve
   Ability to utilize creativity and innovation
   Avid learner
   Proactive and independent approach to critical thinking
   Problem solving skills
   Ability to succeed in a fast-paced environment, sometimes with limited direction; and multiple competing priorities.
   Ability to work autonomously
 
  Educational Requirements
 
   Requires candidates to be currently enrolled or recent graduate of a degree seeking program.
   Prefer Bachelors, Masters or PhD in Management, or Business Administration, with concentration in Human Resources, Industrial/Organizational Psychology, or Organizational Dynamics.
   Previous internship experience helpful.
 
  
 
 We build breakthroughs together
  SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.
  We win with inclusion
  SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world. SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
  EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability. Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
  Requisition ID: 386327 | Work Area: Human Resources | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Student | Employment Type: Intern | Additional Locations: #LI-Hybrid.

If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com
For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

description:
We are looking for someone who: 
 
  Teaches primary school students Lego Robotics (EV3 and WeDo) and Scratch Coding 
  Engages well with children and explains instructions clearly 
  Ensures discipline and safety of children under your care 
 
 Job requirements: 
 
  Able to discipline students firmly 
  Committed positive individuals 
  Enjoys working with children 
  Deliver lessons to children in an energetic and fun way 
 
 Education: 
 
  Diploma/Degree, fresh graduate are welcome 
 
 Job Type: Permanent 
 Experience:

description:
Analyst - Cloud Engineering - SG 
         
        
       
      
      
       
        
         
          Date: 8 Mar 2024 
         
        
       
      
      
       
        
         
          Service Line / Portfolios: Enterprise Technology & Performance 
         
        
       
      
      
       
        
         
          Location: Singapore, Singapore, SG 
         
        
       
      
      
      
       
        
         
          
           Are you ready to unleash your potential?
          
           
           
          
           At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve.
          
           
           
          
           We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good, and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on society’s biggest challenges and creating a better future. We strive to advise clients on how to deliver purpose-led growth and embed more equitable, inclusive as well as sustainable business practices.
          
           
           
          
           Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals.
          
           
           
          
           We are committed to creating positive work experiences that foster a culture of respect and inclusion, where diverse perspectives are celebrated, and everyone is recognised for their contributions.
          
           
           
          
           Ready to unleash your potential with us? Join the winning team now!
          
           
           
          
           Cloud is transforming the way technology enables the business. It represents a radical shift in how IT services are obtained, used, and managed. Companies are navigating through the various cloud options and deciding between private, public, or a combination across different and dynamic provider ecosystems.
          
           
           
          
           Our cloud specialists guide our clients through multi-year journeys from the case for change through implementation across all dimensions of cloud – business alignment, technology architecture and design, cloud application on-boarding, and transforming their operating model – to help solve our client’s most complex issues with the focus on value creation.
          
           
           
          
           Work you will do
          
           
           
          
           This role sits within the industry-leading cloud professionals will enable our client’s end-to-end journey from on premise legacy systems to the cloud, from design through deployment, and leading to a transformed organisation primed for growth.
          
           
           
          
           As an Analyst, your role would include but not limited to:
           
          
           
            
             Support project teams in creating a strategy for how their organisations can leverage the Cloud, create a business case, design a Cloud architecture and put in place governance and policies to manage the new world
             
           
            
             Assist consultants to architect the migration approach which includes thinking through on the best approach towards which applications to migrate, re-built using Cloud native technologies, or bought from Cloud SaaS providers
             
           
            
             Being innovative in delivery by embracing new agile ways of working, enabled by new Cloud tools, to deliver the Cloud solutions to our clients
             
           
            
             Work with project teams in considering how to integrate the Cloud into clients' enterprise through infrastructure and networking solutions to connect, optimise, and manage Cloud solutions across a wide choice of platforms
             
           
            
             Provide support in managed services by ensuring client's use of the Cloud is secure, resilient, compliant, cost effective, and properly service managed, consider the use of a Cloud Managed Service Provider
             
          
          
          
           Enough about us, let’s talk about you
           
          
           You are someone who is:
           
          
           
            
             In your final year of study or recent graduate between 0-2 years of work experience
             
           
            
             Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering, Information Systems, or related disciplines
             
          
          
           
            
             Demonstrates keen interest in Cloud technologies
             
           
            
             Certification in Cloud e.g. AWS, Microsoft Azure will be advantageous
             
           
            
             Some understanding of Agile, SCRUM and Continuous Delivery
             
           
            
             Appreciation of digital enterprise and emerging technologies
             
           
            
             Strong analytical skills, excellent oral and written communication skills in English, self-motivated, and able to work in stressful situations with changing priorities
             
           
            
             Drive, tenacity, entrepreneurship, client focused and results oriented. You enjoy working methodically and with a great attention to detail
             
           
            
             Proven demonstration of sound business acumen & teamwork, confidence in public speaking and presentation preparation is appreciated
             
          
          
          
           Due to volume of applications, we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
          
           
           
          
           Please note that Deloitte will never reach out to you directly via messaging platforms to offer you employment opportunities or request for money or your personal information. Kindly apply for roles that you are interested in via this official Deloitte website.
          
           
           
         
        
       
      
      
      
       
        
         
          Requisition ID: 102923 
         
        
       
      
      
       
        In Singapore, the services are provided by Deloitte and other related entities in Singapore("Deloitte in Singapore"), which are affiliates of Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd. Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd is a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited. Deloitte in Singapore, which is within the Deloitte Network, is the entity that is providing this Website.
descriptionHTML:
Analyst - Cloud Engineering - SG

Date: 8 Mar 2024
Service Line / Portfolios: Enterprise Technology & Performance
Location: Singapore, Singapore, SG
Are you ready to unleash your potential?

At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve.

We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good, and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on society’s biggest challenges and creating a better future. We strive to advise clients on how to deliver purpose-led growth and embed more equitable, inclusive as well as sustainable business practices.

Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals.

We are committed to creating positive work experiences that foster a culture of respect and inclusion, where diverse perspectives are celebrated, and everyone is recognised for their contributions.

Ready to unleash your potential with us? Join the winning team now!

Cloud is transforming the way technology enables the business. It represents a radical shift in how IT services are obtained, used, and managed. Companies are navigating through the various cloud options and deciding between private, public, or a combination across different and dynamic provider ecosystems.

Our cloud specialists guide our clients through multi-year journeys from the case for change through implementation across all dimensions of cloud – business alignment, technology architecture and design, cloud application on-boarding, and transforming their operating model – to help solve our client’s most complex issues with the focus on value creation.

Work you will do

This role sits within the industry-leading cloud professionals will enable our client’s end-to-end journey from on premise legacy systems to the cloud, from design through deployment, and leading to a transformed organisation primed for growth.

As an Analyst, your role would include but not limited to:
  • Support project teams in creating a strategy for how their organisations can leverage the Cloud, create a business case, design a Cloud architecture and put in place governance and policies to manage the new world
  • Assist consultants to architect the migration approach which includes thinking through on the best approach towards which applications to migrate, re-built using Cloud native technologies, or bought from Cloud SaaS providers
  • Being innovative in delivery by embracing new agile ways of working, enabled by new Cloud tools, to deliver the Cloud solutions to our clients
  • Work with project teams in considering how to integrate the Cloud into clients' enterprise through infrastructure and networking solutions to connect, optimise, and manage Cloud solutions across a wide choice of platforms
  • Provide support in managed services by ensuring client's use of the Cloud is secure, resilient, compliant, cost effective, and properly service managed, consider the use of a Cloud Managed Service Provider

Enough about us, let’s talk about you
You are someone who is:
  • In your final year of study or recent graduate between 0-2 years of work experience
  • Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering, Information Systems, or related disciplines
  • Demonstrates keen interest in Cloud technologies
  • Certification in Cloud e.g. AWS, Microsoft Azure will be advantageous
  • Some understanding of Agile, SCRUM and Continuous Delivery
  • Appreciation of digital enterprise and emerging technologies
  • Strong analytical skills, excellent oral and written communication skills in English, self-motivated, and able to work in stressful situations with changing priorities
  • Drive, tenacity, entrepreneurship, client focused and results oriented. You enjoy working methodically and with a great attention to detail
  • Proven demonstration of sound business acumen & teamwork, confidence in public speaking and presentation preparation is appreciated

Due to volume of applications, we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Please note that Deloitte will never reach out to you directly via messaging platforms to offer you employment opportunities or request for money or your personal information. Kindly apply for roles that you are interested in via this official Deloitte website.

Requisition ID: 102923

In Singapore, the services are provided by Deloitte and other related entities in Singapore("Deloitte in Singapore"), which are affiliates of Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd. Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd is a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited. Deloitte in Singapore, which is within the Deloitte Network, is the entity that is providing this Website.

The P&G community includes operations in approximately 75 countries worldwide. Please visit Us.experiencePG.com for the latest news and in-depth information about a career at P&G!
description:
Job Location Singapore
 
  Job Description
  Overview of the Job:
  Do you enjoy answering tough business questions using insights and analytical skills or have a passion in the media and digital marketing space? If this sounds like fun, we would love to hire someone with your skills!
  The Media Science Manager will lead how to win in media platforms, sustain and build digital marketing capabilities and lead innovation in the media and digital marketing space to grow our brands awareness and sales for the region of Asia Pacific, Middle East and Africa.
 
  The individual’s work scope will include a mix of data analytics and insights working closely with Market Media Operations and Marketing teams to drive incremental media reach, effectiveness and bringing down media costs through efficiency ideas.
 
  Once the individual grows as our trusted internal expert on Digital Media, the individual will also lead the upskilling our organizations’ capability on their areas of expertise and continue to build their own expertise through connecting externally in the industry to bring new ideas in and through the company’s internal network.
 
  This role will be based in Singapore.
  Your Team: 
 
 You will report to the Analytics & Insights Director for Media Science. You will work extensively with colleagues from Marketing, Communications, and Media Operations across P&G offices in Asia Pacific, Middle East, and Africa.
  How success looks like:
 
   Improve brand sales and awareness through media reach, effectiveness and cost improvement.
   Upskill the organization on core Digital Media capabilities
   Step up our digital campaigns across media platforms such as Youtube, Tiktok, Instagram, OTT etc.. including KOL/influencer-led content.
   Propose Digital Creative/Content guidelines hinged on strong consumer understanding of their Media behavior and needs and preferences related to P&G’s product categories.
 
  Responsibilities of the Role:
 
   Propose strategic interventions on the media space
   Identify and build solutions and/or algorithms to step up the performance of media campaigns leveraging data analysis, performance of existing campaigns and leading experiments
   Deliver strong data-based and insight-based recommendations on how to win with our P&G target consumers through winning digital media content by platform (eg. Social Media and YouTube Content and Media Plans)
   Be a trusted internal Digital Media expert consultant for Brand Managers and Media Operations Teams
   Define and map out an innovative plan to stay ahead in this space
   Bring Media Led-amplification opportunities for Brands, derive learning, share and re-apply across categories and across the region.
 
 
  Job Qualifications
 
   Undergraduate or Masters’ Degree.
   Deep understanding of the media landscape and Strong analytical ability to develop data-driven and insight-based media strategies.
   Have worked in Media, Agency or FMCG client side, especially International Companies. Experience in working on Social Media & YouTube Advertising campaigns. Experience working with KOLs/Influencers is an advantage.
   Experience in Consumer Insights/Market Research is a plus.
   Able to handle and analyze complex and large amounts of data leveraging excellent MS Excel skills and/or Python and various modeling approaches
   Curiosity and passion to learn and explore new media/advertising formats (ie. Social Commerce) and new tools to analyze data (eg. Gen AI)
   High collaboration skills with internal multi-functional teams and external partners and work across geographies and cultures
   Strong leadership skills and Ability to lead change and drive innovation
   Comfortable in operating in a complex, fast paced and agile structure with an ability to handle multiple priorities
 
  About us
  We produce globally recognized brands and we grow the best business leaders in the industry. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours, it is paramount our leaders are able to lead with courage the vast array of brands, categories and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always®, Ariel®, Gillette®, Head & Shoulders®, Herbal Essences®, Oral-B®, Pampers®, Pantene®, Tampax® and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide.
 
  Visit http://www.pg.com to know more.
 
  Our consumers are diverse and our talents - internally - mirror this diversity to best serve it. That is why we’re committed to building a winning culture based on Inclusion and our ideal candidate is passionate about the same principle: you will join our daily effort of being “in touch” so we craft brands and products to improve the lives of the world’s consumers now and in the future. We want you to inspire us with your unrivaled ideas.
 
  We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, veteran status, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.
 
  Job Schedule Full time
 
  Job Number R000100961
 
  Job Segmentation Recent Grads/Entry Level (Job Segmentation)
descriptionHTML:
Job Location

Singapore

Job Description

Overview of the Job:

Do you enjoy answering tough business questions using insights and analytical skills or have a passion in the media and digital marketing space? If this sounds like fun, we would love to hire someone with your skills!

The Media Science Manager will lead how to win in media platforms, sustain and build digital marketing capabilities and lead innovation in the media and digital marketing space to grow our brands awareness and sales for the region of Asia Pacific, Middle East and Africa.

The individual’s work scope will include a mix of data analytics and insights working closely with Market Media Operations and Marketing teams to drive incremental media reach, effectiveness and bringing down media costs through efficiency ideas.

Once the individual grows as our trusted internal expert on Digital Media, the individual will also lead the upskilling our organizations’ capability on their areas of expertise and continue to build their own expertise through connecting externally in the industry to bring new ideas in and through the company’s internal network.

This role will be based in Singapore.

Your Team:

You will report to the Analytics & Insights Director for Media Science. You will work extensively with colleagues from Marketing, Communications, and Media Operations across P&G offices in Asia Pacific, Middle East, and Africa.

How success looks like:

  • Improve brand sales and awareness through media reach, effectiveness and cost improvement.
  • Upskill the organization on core Digital Media capabilities
  • Step up our digital campaigns across media platforms such as Youtube, Tiktok, Instagram, OTT etc.. including KOL/influencer-led content.
  • Propose Digital Creative/Content guidelines hinged on strong consumer understanding of their Media behavior and needs and preferences related to P&G’s product categories.

Responsibilities of the Role:

  • Propose strategic interventions on the media space
  • Identify and build solutions and/or algorithms to step up the performance of media campaigns leveraging data analysis, performance of existing campaigns and leading experiments
  • Deliver strong data-based and insight-based recommendations on how to win with our P&G target consumers through winning digital media content by platform (eg. Social Media and YouTube Content and Media Plans)
  • Be a trusted internal Digital Media expert consultant for Brand Managers and Media Operations Teams
  • Define and map out an innovative plan to stay ahead in this space
  • Bring Media Led-amplification opportunities for Brands, derive learning, share and re-apply across categories and across the region.

Job Qualifications

  • Undergraduate or Masters’ Degree.
  • Deep understanding of the media landscape and Strong analytical ability to develop data-driven and insight-based media strategies.
  • Have worked in Media, Agency or FMCG client side, especially International Companies. Experience in working on Social Media & YouTube Advertising campaigns. Experience working with KOLs/Influencers is an advantage.
  • Experience in Consumer Insights/Market Research is a plus.
  • Able to handle and analyze complex and large amounts of data leveraging excellent MS Excel skills and/or Python and various modeling approaches
  • Curiosity and passion to learn and explore new media/advertising formats (ie. Social Commerce) and new tools to analyze data (eg. Gen AI)
  • High collaboration skills with internal multi-functional teams and external partners and work across geographies and cultures
  • Strong leadership skills and Ability to lead change and drive innovation
  • Comfortable in operating in a complex, fast paced and agile structure with an ability to handle multiple priorities

About us

We produce globally recognized brands and we grow the best business leaders in the industry. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours, it is paramount our leaders are able to lead with courage the vast array of brands, categories and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always®, Ariel®, Gillette®, Head & Shoulders®, Herbal Essences®, Oral-B®, Pampers®, Pantene®, Tampax® and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide.

Visit http://www.pg.com to know more.

Our consumers are diverse and our talents - internally - mirror this diversity to best serve it. That is why we’re committed to building a winning culture based on Inclusion and our ideal candidate is passionate about the same principle: you will join our daily effort of being “in touch” so we craft brands and products to improve the lives of the world’s consumers now and in the future. We want you to inspire us with your unrivaled ideas.

We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, veteran status, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000100961

Job Segmentation

Recent Grads/Entry Level (Job Segmentation)

description:
Job Summary 
  Job Type
  Permanent 
  
  Seniority
  
  
 
  Years of Experience
  Information not provided
 


 Job Description 
 
 
  
   
    CSA’s Cybersecurity Development Programme (CSDP) is a 12-month programme to develop cybersecurity talents in the public sector, with the aim of building up cybersecurity capabilities to secure Singapore’s digital economy and infrastructure.
   
   
   
     CSDP is open to both recent graduates and working professionals, and consists of two phases: a rigorous 3-month classroom training phase, followed by a 9-month job posting.
   
   
   
     During the 3-month training phase, CSDP officers will acquire cybersecurity certifications* such as:
   
   
     EC-Council’s Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) (including CEH Masters) conducted by Ngee Ann Polytechnic;
     Cisco’s CyberOps Associate conducted by CSA Academy;
     Singapore University of Technology and Design’s (SUTD) ModularMaster Certificate in Cybersecurity (four modules)
   
   
   
     Thereafter, CSDP officers will take on a 9-month posting in one of CSA’s divisions, with the opportunity** to gain experience in one of these areas in cybersecurity (non-exhaustive):
   
   
     Malware Analysis
     Digital Forensics & Incident Response
     Emerging Technologies
     Penetration Testing
     Cybersecurity Solutions and Consultancy
     Cybersecurity Operations Centre
     Threat Intelligence
     Governance, Risk and Compliance
   
   
   
     During the 9-month posting, CSDP officers will also gain valuable experience working on cybersecurity projects at the national level, undergo technical and non-technical courses, and receive exposure to front-facing engagements with recognised industry players, the general public and students.
   
   
   
     At the end of the 12-month programme, CSDP officers can look forward to additional development opportunities either in CSA or other government agencies (upon successful deployment at the of programme). CSDP officers will also be awarded the:
   
   
     CSDP Certificate of Completion
     SUTD ModularMaster Certificate in Cybersecurity
   
   
   
     Training may be subject to change.
   
   
   
     **Further assessment(s) may be required in order to determine the officer’s suitability for the first job posting, factoring in each officer’s interest and the cybersecurity needs across the Whole-Of-Government (WOG). Due consideration will be taken on a case-by-case basis and the final decision on the first job posting will be at CSA’s discretion .
   
   
   
     To find out more, visit https://www.csa.gov.sg/faq/cybersecurity-development-programme.

CSA’s Cybersecurity Development Programme (CSDP) is a 12-month programme to develop cybersecurity talents in the public sector, with the aim of building up cybersecurity capabilities to secure Singapore’s digital economy and infrastructure.

CSDP is open to both recent graduates and working professionals, and consists of two phases: a rigorous 3-month classroom training phase, followed by a 9-month job posting.

During the 3-month training phase, CSDP officers will acquire cybersecurity certifications* such as:
  • EC-Council’s Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) (including CEH Masters) conducted by Ngee Ann Polytechnic;
  • Cisco’s CyberOps Associate conducted by CSA Academy;
  • Singapore University of Technology and Design’s (SUTD) ModularMaster Certificate in Cybersecurity (four modules)

Thereafter, CSDP officers will take on a 9-month posting in one of CSA’s divisions, with the opportunity** to gain experience in one of these areas in cybersecurity (non-exhaustive):
  • Malware Analysis
  • Digital Forensics & Incident Response
  • Emerging Technologies
  • Penetration Testing
  • Cybersecurity Solutions and Consultancy
  • Cybersecurity Operations Centre
  • Threat Intelligence
  • Governance, Risk and Compliance

During the 9-month posting, CSDP officers will also gain valuable experience working on cybersecurity projects at the national level, undergo technical and non-technical courses, and receive exposure to front-facing engagements with recognised industry players, the general public and students.

At the end of the 12-month programme, CSDP officers can look forward to additional development opportunities either in CSA or other government agencies (upon successful deployment at the of programme). CSDP officers will also be awarded the:
  • CSDP Certificate of Completion
  • SUTD ModularMaster Certificate in Cybersecurity

  • Training may be subject to change.

**Further assessment(s) may be required in order to determine the officer’s suitability for the first job posting, factoring in each officer’s interest and the cybersecurity needs across the Whole-Of-Government (WOG). Due consideration will be taken on a case-by-case basis and the final decision on the first job posting will be at CSA’s discretion .

To find out more, visit https://www.csa.gov.sg/faq/cybersecurity-development-programme.

description:
Business Relationship Consultant [Fresh Graduates. Singaporeans only]
Attention recent grads! Want to jumpstart or explore a career in finance? We’re currently hiring for a BRC who is keen on learning how to build and maintain long-lasting relationships with clients.
In this role, you’ll work closely with clients to understand their needs and provide them with customized financial advice and portfolio management guidance.
What you’ll be up to:

 In the 1st month, you’ll be provided training on all the sales skills, product knowledge, and planning models required for you to start understanding how to provide quality service for your clients
 You will collaborate with the internal teams to support the analysis of your clients’ needs
 Develop and maintain a deep knowledge of the ever-changing financial landscape to educate clients
 That’s it really!

What we are looking for:

 No experience required – We are looking for fresh open minds to train in this industry
 Having said that, we are looking for self-driven individuals who can work well in an unsupervised and unstructured environment
 Bachelor’s Degree in any discipline
 Sound business acumen and a competitive spirit

What’s in it for you:

 We offer a competitive commission-based salary, monthly and quarterly bonuses, and a monthly incentive scheme
 Work from home or work in office – totally up to you!
 Flexible schedule – fix your own schedule

If this sounds like you’ll be a fit, hit that apply button and let’s see where this takes us!
*All shortlisted candidates will be given a 5-10 mins screening call within 7 days

description:
WE ARE OPEN! JOIN OUR GROWING TEAM!
We're not just another outsourced events and sales company; we're innovators who tackle everyday challenges with creativity. As we expand globally, we're on the lookout for talented individuals like you to join us on our journey and become industry leaders.
Why choose us?
1. Career Development

 We are determined to provide you with the necessary resources, mentorship, and growth opportunities to fuel your professional advancement

2. Travel Opportunities

 We encourage collaboration among our offices and teams worldwide. As a result, team members may have opportunities to work on projects that involve travel to other cities or countries, fostering a deeper understanding of diverse cultures and business practices

3. Personal Growth

 We offer a wide range of learning and development opportunities, including workshops, training sessions, and mentorship programs. We believe that growth happens when we push our boundaries

Why you'll love it here:

 Dynamic Team Environment: We value teamwork, fun, and a cohesive working environment that sparks creativity.
 Progression Opportunities: We're committed to helping individuals grow both personally and professionally, providing a platform for advancing your career.
 International Exposure: Connect with teams worldwide and broaden your horizons through cross-border learning.

Who are we looking for?

 A growth mindset – the belief that abilities and intelligence can be developed through dedication and hard work
 Team members with the attitude that is more likely to share knowledge, seek guidance from others, and contribute to a supportive and knowledge-sharing culture within the organization

Interested in being a part of our dynamic team? Apply today and be ready to elevate your career to new heights!

description:
Job Summary 
  Job Type
  Permanent 
  
  Seniority
  
  
 
  Years of Experience
  Information not provided 
  
  Tech Stacks
  Java Android Kotlin
 


 Job Description 
 
 
  
   
    TikTok Live client team focus has been focusing on delivery engaging and the best live streaming experience to global users. Our team develop creative and interesting features for streamers and viewers to express themselves and interact with others instantly. We are looking for passionate mobile software engineers to join us in this fast growing industry.
     
     Responsibilities:
     1. Design, implement the new-user features of our mobile application.
     2. Collaborate with the design and product teams to create a world-class mobile experience.
     3. Optimize mobile applications and user experience on the Android platforms.
     4. Promote robust and maintainable code, clear documentation, and deliver high quality work on a tight schedule. 
     
     Qualifications
     
     1. BS/MS degree in Computer Science or equivalent majors with experience in native Android development. Final year or recent graduate in Software Development and Computer Science are also welcome to apply.
     2. Proficiency in Java or Kotlin.
     3. Ability to understand and debug large and complex codebases.
     4. Good team communication and collaboration skills.
     5. Promote robust and maintainable code, clear documentation, and deliver high quality work on a tight schedule.
     6. Livestream knowledge is a plus but not mandatory.
     
     TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Job Summary 
  Job Type
  Permanent 
  
  Seniority
  
  
 
  Years of Experience
  Information not provided 
  
  Tech Stacks
  C++ Go play Java kafka MySQL Redis Python
 


 Job Description 
 
 
  
   
    We are looking for talented individuals to join us in 2024. As a graduate, you will get unparalleled opportunities for you to kickstart your career, pursue bold ideas and explore limitless growth opportunities. Co-create a future driven by your inspiration with TikTok.
   
   
   
     Global Live Service Arch's Major Objectives are,
   
   
     1. Ensure Global Live to meet compliance requirements, and promote cross-team architecture governance.
   
   
     2. Build Global Live architecture with stability, low-latency and resilience to support long-term business development
   
   
     3. Optimize end-to-end stability and engineering efficiency
   
   
   
     Our Key Problems To Solve,
   
   
     Under the strict Compliance requirements, how to construct Global Live platform with Stability, better Performance (Low-Latency and High-Concurrency), Resilience and Efficiency.
   
   
   
     You will:
   
   
    Play a critical role in planning and leading large-scale technical projects to lay the foundation for the iterative development and scale of early products
    Participate in developing robust, efficient technology products that serve 1 billion users
    Be a key member in improving architecture to ensure high stability and performance
    Be Involved in researching and applying cutting-edge domain and technical knowledge into products which could benefit world wide TikTok users.
   
   
   
     Qualifications
   
   
    Final year or recent graduate with a background in Software Development, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical discipline
    Plenty experience in high scalable, highly available, distributed and mission-critical systems.
    Large scale client-facing industry project development experience.
    Proficient in at least one of the following languages: Go, Python, Java, C++.
    Deep understanding of computer architecture, data structures and algorithms in depth knowledge of common databases and messaging frameworks like MySQL/Redis/Kafka
    Able to work closely with diverse stakeholders and have good communication skills
    Self-driven, positive, cooperative and willing to keep learning enthusiasm at all times
   
   
   
     TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
   
   
   
     By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy.
   
   
   
     If you have any questions, please reach out to us at [email protected].

companyInfo/companyDescription: At ADM, we unlock the power of nature to provide access to nutrition worldwide. With industry-advancing innovations, a complete portfolio of ingredients and solutions to meet any taste, and a commitment to sustainability, we give customers an edge in solving the nutritional challenges of today and tomorrow. We’re a global leader in human and animal nutrition and the world’s premier agricultural origination and processing company. Our breadth, depth, insights, facilities and logistical expertise give us unparalleled capabilities to meet needs for food, beverages, health and wellness, and more. From the seed of the idea to the outcome of the solution, we enrich the quality of life the world over. Learn more at www.adm.com.
description:
Singapore
   
 
 
  
   Singapore
   
 
 
  
   Finance, Accounting, Audit 
  
 
 
  Job Description 
  
   
    ADM unlocks the power of nature to enrich the quality of life. We’re a premier global human and animal nutrition company, delivering solutions today with an eye to the future. We’re blazing new trails in health and well-being as our scientists develop groundbreaking products to support healthier living. We’re a cutting-edge innovator leading the way to a new future of plant-based consumer and industrial solutions to replace petroleum-based products. We’re an unmatched agricultural supply chain manager and processor, providing food security by connecting local needs with global capabilities. And we’re a leader in sustainability, scaling across entire value chains to help decarbonize our industry and safeguard our planet. From the seed of the idea to the outcome of the solution, we give customers an edge in solving the nutritional and sustainability challenges of today and tomorrow. Learn more at www.adm.com.
     
     Your Responsibilities
     The ADM Finance team plays a key role in the success of the business, providing management and stakeholders with high-quality, accurate, and timely financial information and analysis for both business support and development and external reporting requirements. To successfully deliver a world class service to the business, ADM seeks high caliber team players able to gain the depth and breadth of skills across different cultures in a progressive training program designed to equip you with the skills and experience required to become a first-class finance professional.
     
     Talented graduates are our finance professionals and ultimately our finance leaders of tomorrow. Therefore, the development of young talent is critical for the success of our organization. As program participant, you will gain experience in an international environment within our Business Unit Finance, Global Business Services and Centers of Excellence functions. As Finance Trainee, you will have exposure to senior finance leaders in ADM.
     
     Our program is designed for two years (plus optional 6 months) rotation in different finance functions. You will work closely with our highly skilled and experienced finance management professionals during your rotations. Our finance functions include the following: Global Business Services, Business Unit Controlling, Business Unit Financial Planning and Analysis, Statutory Accounting, Treasury, Credit and Tax. You will rotate to most of these functions for 3-6 months. The program offers you prospects for an international career and the chance to play an important role in the ADM finance organization.
     
     After successfully completing our APAC Finance Trainee program, you are ready to take on a challenging role in the ADM finance function you will be assigned to.
     
     Your Profile
   
   
     Bachelor’s degree, ideally in finance, business or related discipline with a genuine interest for agribusiness, human nutrition and animal nutrition industry.
     Fluent in English (spoken and written), an additional Asian language is an advantage
     Internationally mobile – willing to accept assignments in different countries
     Strong Team Player with excellent collaboration skills across different stakeholders
     Strong interest to learn all aspects of finance and highly motivated to develop a finance career in a regional and global environment.
     Proven ability to communicate confidently and effectively
     Entrepreneurial, hands-on and self-motivated with a strong drive for success and continuous improvement
     Attention to details and possess an aptitude for finanical data analysis and reporting
     Advance proficiency in Microsoft Office skills such as complex formulas with Excel, pivots, lookups. Experience with Power BI, VBA, Access, Power Query or even Python is an added advantage.
   
  
   
   
 
 
 
  
   
    Your Future Perspective
   
   
     Challenging tasks, short decision-making processes and a high level of personal responsibility
     Room for innovative thinking and growth with the possibility to manage your own career path.
     A company culture which promotes continuous learning and diversity.
     Excellent career opportunities in a world leading nutrition company.
   
   
 
 
 
  
   #IncludingYou
    
    Diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging are cornerstones of ADM’s efforts to continue innovating, driving growth, and delivering outstanding performance. We are committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce and create welcoming, truly inclusive work environments — environments that enable every ADM colleague to feel comfortable on the job, make meaningful contributions to our success, and grow their career. We respect and value the unique backgrounds and experiences that each person can bring to ADM because we know that diversity of perspectives makes us better, together.
    
    For more information regarding our efforts to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging, please visit our website here: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion | ADM.
  
   
 
 
 
  
   #LI-Onsite

descriptionHTML:
Singapore
Singapore
Finance, Accounting, Audit

Job Description

ADM unlocks the power of nature to enrich the quality of life. We’re a premier global human and animal nutrition company, delivering solutions today with an eye to the future. We’re blazing new trails in health and well-being as our scientists develop groundbreaking products to support healthier living. We’re a cutting-edge innovator leading the way to a new future of plant-based consumer and industrial solutions to replace petroleum-based products. We’re an unmatched agricultural supply chain manager and processor, providing food security by connecting local needs with global capabilities. And we’re a leader in sustainability, scaling across entire value chains to help decarbonize our industry and safeguard our planet. From the seed of the idea to the outcome of the solution, we give customers an edge in solving the nutritional and sustainability challenges of today and tomorrow. Learn more at www.adm.com.

Your Responsibilities
The ADM Finance team plays a key role in the success of the business, providing management and stakeholders with high-quality, accurate, and timely financial information and analysis for both business support and development and external reporting requirements. To successfully deliver a world class service to the business, ADM seeks high caliber team players able to gain the depth and breadth of skills across different cultures in a progressive training program designed to equip you with the skills and experience required to become a first-class finance professional.

Talented graduates are our finance professionals and ultimately our finance leaders of tomorrow. Therefore, the development of young talent is critical for the success of our organization. As program participant, you will gain experience in an international environment within our Business Unit Finance, Global Business Services and Centers of Excellence functions. As Finance Trainee, you will have exposure to senior finance leaders in ADM.

Our program is designed for two years (plus optional 6 months) rotation in different finance functions. You will work closely with our highly skilled and experienced finance management professionals during your rotations. Our finance functions include the following: Global Business Services, Business Unit Controlling, Business Unit Financial Planning and Analysis, Statutory Accounting, Treasury, Credit and Tax. You will rotate to most of these functions for 3-6 months. The program offers you prospects for an international career and the chance to play an important role in the ADM finance organization.

After successfully completing our APAC Finance Trainee program, you are ready to take on a challenging role in the ADM finance function you will be assigned to.

Your Profile
  • Bachelor’s degree, ideally in finance, business or related discipline with a genuine interest for agribusiness, human nutrition and animal nutrition industry.
  • Fluent in English (spoken and written), an additional Asian language is an advantage
  • Internationally mobile – willing to accept assignments in different countries
  • Strong Team Player with excellent collaboration skills across different stakeholders
  • Strong interest to learn all aspects of finance and highly motivated to develop a finance career in a regional and global environment.
  • Proven ability to communicate confidently and effectively
  • Entrepreneurial, hands-on and self-motivated with a strong drive for success and continuous improvement
  • Attention to details and possess an aptitude for finanical data analysis and reporting
  • Advance proficiency in Microsoft Office skills such as complex formulas with Excel, pivots, lookups. Experience with Power BI, VBA, Access, Power Query or even Python is an added advantage.

Your Future Perspective
  • Challenging tasks, short decision-making processes and a high level of personal responsibility
  • Room for innovative thinking and growth with the possibility to manage your own career path.
  • A company culture which promotes continuous learning and diversity.
  • Excellent career opportunities in a world leading nutrition company.

#IncludingYou

Diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging are cornerstones of ADM’s efforts to continue innovating, driving growth, and delivering outstanding performance. We are committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce and create welcoming, truly inclusive work environments — environments that enable every ADM colleague to feel comfortable on the job, make meaningful contributions to our success, and grow their career. We respect and value the unique backgrounds and experiences that each person can bring to ADM because we know that diversity of perspectives makes us better, together.

For more information regarding our efforts to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging, please visit our website here: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion | ADM.

#LI-Onsite

companyInfo/companyDescription: AcePLP is a Singapore-based BIM services company with a strong track record in the Architectural, Engineering and Construction industries. We work closely with contractors and consultants to create, coordinate, and manage BIM data. We also work with facility owners and government agencies to digitize and archive paper drawings and asset information so that these can be used as BIM for Facilities Management (BIM for FM).
description:
Begin your engineering career by enrolling into our 26-month structured Career Advancement Programme (CAP). 
 This programme sets you on the pathway to become a Accredited BIM Professional for Digital Delivery Management. Your time on our programme counts towards the work experience requirement. Digital skills are crucial in the Built Environment sector. BIM is the way to digitally create and simulate building and infrastructure models before the actual construction. 
 
  
 AcePLP welcomes fresh graduates and mid-careerists from Architectural, Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, BIM, Mechatronics and Engineering with diploma/degree to enrol in our CAP. AcePLP’s 26-months CAP aligns you to the Built Environment career trajectory. It is the most established work-study programme in Singapore with 20-years proven track record of producing thousands of engineering professionals in the Built Environment. CAP Alumni have made valuable contributions in the development and management of digital models for buildings and infrastructure. You will have opportunities to learn on-the-job alongside industry experts and build your expertise after an initial 2-months classroom training with us. 
 
  
 Why Join Us? 
 We have the most established Work-Study Programme in the Built Environment sector with over 20 years track record. 
 
  An intensive free two-month technical BIM and CAD training will be provided. 
  Learn on-the-job as you work across building and infrastructure projects in Singapore with guidance from our experienced Trainers and Resource Managers. 
  Build your expertise and widen your professional network with us through our large database of clients, project assignments and alumnus. 
  This program counts towards the fulfilment of pre-requisite for the SUSS Bachelor of Building and Project Management and NUS Bachelor of Technology in Engineering, as well as towards the Digital Delivery Management (BIM) accreditation. 
  Sponsorship from AcePLP for further studies are available subject to terms and conditions apply. 
  Obtain accreditation for your DDM/BIM skills and Specialist BIM Diploma and/or building related Degree after 6 years in the building industry. 
 
 Am I an Eligible Candidate? 
 
  Entry level candidates and mid-careerists may apply. 
  Strong interest in pursuing a career in the Built Environment Sector. 
  Degree/Diploma in Built Environment-related fields: Architecture, Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, Structural Engineering, Green Building & Sustainability, Project or Construction Management and Facilities Management. 
  Other qualifications considered: Any engineering subjects, Intelligent Building Technology, Graphic Arts, Visual/Product/Interior Design, Landscape Architecture, Environmental Engineering, Mechatronic, Aeronautical, etc. 
  Professionals with prior experience in BIM may request for a skills test to fast-track their development at AcePLP. 
 
 You can apply here: https://aces.aceplp.com.sg/apply/nt/

This programme sets you on the pathway to become a Accredited BIM Professional for Digital Delivery Management. Your time on our programme counts towards the work experience requirement. Digital skills are crucial in the Built Environment sector. BIM is the way to digitally create and simulate building and infrastructure models before the actual construction.


AcePLP welcomes fresh graduates and mid-careerists from Architectural, Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, BIM, Mechatronics and Engineering with diploma/degree to enrol in our CAP. AcePLP’s 26-months CAP aligns you to the Built Environment career trajectory. It is the most established work-study programme in Singapore with 20-years proven track record of producing thousands of engineering professionals in the Built Environment. CAP Alumni have made valuable contributions in the development and management of digital models for buildings and infrastructure. You will have opportunities to learn on-the-job alongside industry experts and build your expertise after an initial 2-months classroom training with us.


Why Join Us?

We have the most established Work-Study Programme in the Built Environment sector with over 20 years track record.

  • An intensive free two-month technical BIM and CAD training will be provided.
  • Learn on-the-job as you work across building and infrastructure projects in Singapore with guidance from our experienced Trainers and Resource Managers.
  • Build your expertise and widen your professional network with us through our large database of clients, project assignments and alumnus.

Am I an Eligible Candidate?

  • Entry level candidates and mid-careerists may apply.
  • Strong interest in pursuing a career in the Built Environment Sector.

description:
Are you itching to dive headfirst into the fast-paced world of marketing and sales? Eminence Organization is on the hunt for dynamic individuals like yourself to join our squad at the ground level. Get set for an adrenaline-fueled journey packed with event planning, brainstorming ingenious marketing schemes, drumming up leads, diving deep into market insights, and fostering strong client connections. It's all about teamwork, so buckle up and let's rock this together!
Perks:

 Immerse yourself in a vibrant and inclusive work environment where your voice counts
 Collaborate with a crew of supportive comrades in a culture that celebrates victories
 Blaze your trail to success with crystal-clear career advancement opportunities
 Pack your bags for exciting travel escapades along the way

Qualifications:

 A flair for spinning tales and crafting captivating content, both written and verbal
