description:
Function(s): Audit 
     
    
   
  
  
   
    
     
      Work Type: Permanent 
     
    
   
  
  
   
    
     
      Start Date for Applications: 11 Mar 2024 
     
    
   
  
  
   
    
     
      Closing Date for Applications: 
     
    
   
  
  
   
    KPMG in Singapore is part of a global organization of independent professional services firms providing Audit, Tax and Advisory services. We operate in 143 countries and territories with more than 273,000 partners and employees working in member firms around the world. Each KPMG firm is a legally distinct and separate entity and describes itself as such. KPMG International Limited is a private English company limited by guarantee. KPMG International Limited and its related entities do not provide services to clients. 
   
  
  
   
    
     
      
       
        
         
          Job Description
          
        
        
         
           As an Audit Associate, you will gain exposure to top companies within one of the above industry clusters. You will work in teams to acquire an in-depth understanding of our client`s business, carry out the audit based on audit planning, prepare appropriate audit work papers, understand the relationships between objectives of the audit sections, the need for the sufficiency of audit evidence, and presentation of the conclusions.
         
          
          
         
          The Audit function is structured along four lines of business, each addressing a key industry cluster in the marketplace. Each line of business is further divided into sectors as a means to effectively organize technical and industry knowledge and dedicated teams to address the unique industry demands of the marketplace.
         
          
          
         
          Diversified Industrials & Infrastructure
          
         
          Government | Transport & Logistics | Building & Construction | Shipping | Diversified Industries | Communications
         
          
          
         
          Energy & Technology
          
         
          Airlines | Telecommunication | Technology | E-commerce | Software & Business Services | Chemicals & Pharmaceuticals | Energy & Natural Resources | Engineering
         
          
          
         
          Financial Services
          
         
          Retail Banking | Investment Banking | Insurance | Investment Management and Funds | Real Estate Investment Trust
         
          
          
         
          Real Estate, Consumer & Tourism
          
         
          Retail | Food & Beverage | Consumer Products | Industrial & Automotive | Tourism & Hospitality | Education | Real Estate | Life Sciences | Media & Entertainment | Healthcare
         
          
          
         
          Our industry-driven structure helps us to develop a deep understanding of our clients` businesses and the issues they face. This approach recognises that, in an increasingly competitive and complex market, the key differentiator is often the ability to demonstrate in-depth knowledge of our clients` businesses and the industry in which they operate.
         
          
          
         
          KPMG in Singapore invites highly motivated and dynamic graduates to join our growing audit practice.
         
          
          
         
          Requirements:
          
         
          Degree in accounting or finance related field 
          Works cooperatively and can build positive, constructive business relationships 
          Strives for continual Improvement 
          Takes accountability for delivering high quality, accurate work 
          Business curiosity that encompasses the use of data 
          Forward thinking and ready to embrace change and technological advancements in how you think, problem solve and approach tasks 
          Knowledge or interest in data analytics is essential 
         
        
       
       
        
         
          ⠀
          
        
       
      
       
     
    
   
  
  
   
    Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by KPMG Talent Acquisition team, personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.   At KPMG in Singapore we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We believe that diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. As an equal opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, race, gender identity or expression, colour, marital status, religion, sexual orientation, disability, or other non-merit factors. We celebrate the different talents that our people bring and support every staff member in their journey to achieve personal and professional growth. One of the ways we do this is through Take Charge: Flexi-work, our flexible working framework which enables agile and innovative teams to help deliver our business goals.
descriptionHTML:
Function(s): Audit
Work Type: Permanent
Start Date for Applications: 11 Mar 2024
Closing Date for Applications:

KPMG in Singapore is part of a global organization of independent professional services firms providing Audit, Tax and Advisory services. We operate in 143 countries and territories with more than 273,000 partners and employees working in member firms around the world. Each KPMG firm is a legally distinct and separate entity and describes itself as such. KPMG International Limited is a private English company limited by guarantee. KPMG International Limited and its related entities do not provide services to clients.

Job Description
As an Audit Associate, you will gain exposure to top companies within one of the above industry clusters. You will work in teams to acquire an in-depth understanding of our client`s business, carry out the audit based on audit planning, prepare appropriate audit work papers, understand the relationships between objectives of the audit sections, the need for the sufficiency of audit evidence, and presentation of the conclusions.

The Audit function is structured along four lines of business, each addressing a key industry cluster in the marketplace. Each line of business is further divided into sectors as a means to effectively organize technical and industry knowledge and dedicated teams to address the unique industry demands of the marketplace.

Diversified Industrials & Infrastructure
Government | Transport & Logistics | Building & Construction | Shipping | Diversified Industries | Communications

Energy & Technology
Airlines | Telecommunication | Technology | E-commerce | Software & Business Services | Chemicals & Pharmaceuticals | Energy & Natural Resources | Engineering

Financial Services
Retail Banking | Investment Banking | Insurance | Investment Management and Funds | Real Estate Investment Trust

Real Estate, Consumer & Tourism
Retail | Food & Beverage | Consumer Products | Industrial & Automotive | Tourism & Hospitality | Education | Real Estate | Life Sciences | Media & Entertainment | Healthcare

Our industry-driven structure helps us to develop a deep understanding of our clients` businesses and the issues they face. This approach recognises that, in an increasingly competitive and complex market, the key differentiator is often the ability to demonstrate in-depth knowledge of our clients` businesses and the industry in which they operate.

KPMG in Singapore invites highly motivated and dynamic graduates to join our growing audit practice.

Requirements:
  • Degree in accounting or finance related field
  • Works cooperatively and can build positive, constructive business relationships
  • Strives for continual Improvement
  • Takes accountability for delivering high quality, accurate work
  • Business curiosity that encompasses the use of data
  • Forward thinking and ready to embrace change and technological advancements in how you think, problem solve and approach tasks
  • Knowledge or interest in data analytics is essential
⠀

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by KPMG Talent Acquisition team, personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.

At KPMG in Singapore we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We believe that diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. As an equal opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, race, gender identity or expression, colour, marital status, religion, sexual orientation, disability, or other non-merit factors. We celebrate the different talents that our people bring and support every staff member in their journey to achieve personal and professional growth. One of the ways we do this is through Take Charge: Flexi-work, our flexible working framework which enables agile and innovative teams to help deliver our business goals.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Micron Technology is transforming how the world uses information to enrich life for all.

Micron's memory and storage solutions define what the world can do with data. Our more than 40,000 team members, in 17 different countries, work with countless customers to innovate every day and pursue the products that will shape how we live and work tomorrow.

We are a world leader in innovating memory and storage solutions that accelerate the transformation of information into intelligence, inspiring the world to learn, communicate and advance faster than ever. We deliver the world's broadest portfolio of technologies at the core of today's most significant disruptive breakthroughs such as artificial intelligence and autonomous vehicles.

We have the broadest and most innovative memory and storage portfolio in the industry. Our team of trailblazers, dreamers, visionaries and scientists have redefined innovation for more than 40 years while designing and building some of the world’s most advanced memory and storage technologies.
description:
Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all.
 
  Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing. JR39510 Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Intern (Polytechnic Students)
 
  We are seeking a highly motivated and enthusiastic individual to join our team as an Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) Intern. This internship provides a valuable opportunity for students or recent graduates interested in pursuing a career in the field of EHS.
  As an EHS Intern, you will gain practical experience, develop essential skills, and actively contribute to our organization's commitment to maintaining a safe and environmentally responsible workplace
 
   Work with various key stakeholders to identify opportunities for improving EHS practices and processes.
   Assist in conducting risk assessments, incident investigations, and safety audits, contributing to the development of effective mitigation strategies.
   Review current EHS processes, policies, and procedures to identify areas for improvement and propose practical solutions to enhance safety and compliance.
   Support the maintenance and organization of EHS-related documents, policies, procedures, and training materials, ensuring accurate and up-to-date information.
   Ensure compliance with the industry standards and regulatory requirements, by assisting in the preparation and coordination of customer and internal audits.
   Take on ad-hoc projects that provide exposure to various aspects of EHS management, gaining knowledge in the various disciplines of EHS.•
   Participate in Safety Committees, liaising with cross functional teams to enhance the organization’s safety culture.•
 
 
 
   Scope:
   
  
   Increase EHS knowledge by getting hands-on experience of managing the operations
   Understand the acts and legislations regulating EHS according to Singapore and Global standards.
   Gain a firsthand experience of EHS management within the Semiconductor Industry.
   Gain practical experience in the implementation of EHS programs and initiatives within a dynamic corporate environment.
   Gain experience in Fire Safety management in the corporate setting, by playing an integral part in its database maintenance regime.
   Learn from experienced professionals in the field of EHS, who will provide guidance, mentorship, and opportunities for professional growth.
   Gain comprehensive knowledge and experience of key EHS systems through various training sessions and workshops.
  
 
  Deliverable: Establish a robust Fire and Safety database which complies to internal and Singapore standards.
 
   Skillset Require:
   
  
   Written & spoken fluency in English
  
 
  Proficiency in Microsoft applications (e.g. Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
  Course of interest: Pursuing studies in Chemical/Mechanical Engineering
  Duration Period: min 4 months
 
  About Micron Technology, Inc.
  We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions transforming how the world uses information to enrich life for all. With a relentless focus on our customers, technology leadership, and manufacturing and operational excellence, Micron delivers a rich portfolio of high-performance DRAM, NAND, and NOR memory and storage products through our Micron® and Crucial® brands. Every day, the innovations that our people create fuel the data economy, enabling advances in artificial intelligence and 5G applications that unleash opportunities — from the data center to the intelligent edge and across the client and mobile user experience.  To learn more, please visit micron.com/careers  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.  To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact hrsupport_sg@micron.com
 
  Micron Prohibits the use of child labor and complies with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, and other international and industry labor standards.
 
  Micron does not charge candidates any recruitment fees or unlawfully collect any other payment from candidates as consideration for their employment with Micron.

Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing.

JR39510 Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Intern (Polytechnic Students)

We are seeking a highly motivated and enthusiastic individual to join our team as an Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) Intern. This internship provides a valuable opportunity for students or recent graduates interested in pursuing a career in the field of EHS.


As an EHS Intern, you will gain practical experience, develop essential skills, and actively contribute to our organization's commitment to maintaining a safe and environmentally responsible workplace

  • Work with various key stakeholders to identify opportunities for improving EHS practices and processes.
  • Assist in conducting risk assessments, incident investigations, and safety audits, contributing to the development of effective mitigation strategies.
  • Review current EHS processes, policies, and procedures to identify areas for improvement and propose practical solutions to enhance safety and compliance.
  • Support the maintenance and organization of EHS-related documents, policies, procedures, and training materials, ensuring accurate and up-to-date information.
  • Ensure compliance with the industry standards and regulatory requirements, by assisting in the preparation and coordination of customer and internal audits.
  • Take on ad-hoc projects that provide exposure to various aspects of EHS management, gaining knowledge in the various disciplines of EHS.•
  • Participate in Safety Committees, liaising with cross functional teams to enhance the organization’s safety culture.•

Scope:
  • Increase EHS knowledge by getting hands-on experience of managing the operations
  • Understand the acts and legislations regulating EHS according to Singapore and Global standards.
  • Gain a firsthand experience of EHS management within the Semiconductor Industry.
  • Gain practical experience in the implementation of EHS programs and initiatives within a dynamic corporate environment.
  • Gain experience in Fire Safety management in the corporate setting, by playing an integral part in its database maintenance regime.
  • Learn from experienced professionals in the field of EHS, who will provide guidance, mentorship, and opportunities for professional growth.
  • Gain comprehensive knowledge and experience of key EHS systems through various training sessions and workshops.


Deliverable:
Establish a robust Fire and Safety database which complies to internal and Singapore standards.


Skillset Require:
  • Written & spoken fluency in English

Proficiency in Microsoft applications (e.g. Word, PowerPoint, Excel)


Course of interest: Pursuing studies in Chemical/Mechanical Engineering


Duration Period: min 4 months

About Micron Technology, Inc.

We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions transforming how the world uses information to enrich life for all. With a relentless focus on our customers, technology leadership, and manufacturing and operational excellence, Micron delivers a rich portfolio of high-performance DRAM, NAND, and NOR memory and storage products through our Micron® and Crucial® brands. Every day, the innovations that our people create fuel the data economy, enabling advances in artificial intelligence and 5G applications that unleash opportunities — from the data center to the intelligent edge and across the client and mobile user experience.

To learn more, please visit micron.com/careers

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact hrsupport_sg@micron.com

Micron Prohibits the use of child labor and complies with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, and other international and industry labor standards.

Micron does not charge candidates any recruitment fees or unlawfully collect any other payment from candidates as consideration for their employment with Micron.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Have you ever thought of offering your skills and expertise to a multinational company?
 
Give your best to better energy and make the commitment with TotalEnergies. With over 500-plus professions in 130 countries, we offer high safety and environmental standards, strong ethical values, an innovation culture and wide-ranging career development. Be part of the global team whose mission is already shared by 105,000 employees : to be a world-class player in the energy transition
description:
Pays 
         
         Singapour 
        
        
         
          Lieu 
         
         Singapore 
        
        
         
          Lieu de travail 
         
         SINGAPORE-FRASERS TWR(SGP) 
        
        
         
          Domaine 
         
         Stratégie Economie Business 
        
        
         
          Type de contrat 
         
         Graduate 
        
        
         
          Expérience 
         
         Moins de 3 ans 
        
       
      
     
    
   
   
    
     
      
       
        
         
          Profil du candidat
          
        
       
      
      
       
        
         
          
           TotalEnergies Trading Graduate Program - 2024
           
            Are you looking to grow your career in the vibrant world of energy trading (Oil, Gas and Power)?
           
           
             Are you looking to discover a fulfilling and dynamic place to work as soon as you graduate?
           
           
           
             If yes, we would love to see your profile as we are now looking for multifaceted talents who are passionate about the energy-trading world to join our 2-year program.
           
           
           
             Don’t wait any longer, apply and join the TotalEnergies Trading Graduate Program in Singapore!
           
           
            Who do we look for?
           
             You hold a relevant Master’s Degree or equivalent from 2023 or 2024 such as in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Energy
             You have some international experience, for example you studied a semester abroad, you worked as an intern or volunteered in another country than the one you are originally from
             Standing together is one of our key values so it is essential that you demonstrate a good team spirit
             You are a forward-thinking and performance driven person with excellent interpersonal skills showing assertiveness, confidence and resilience and you have the ability to operate autonomously
             Innovation being at the heart of our DNA we hope to welcome people with an entrepreneurial and agile mind-set with excellent communication skills
             Most importantly, you have a strong interest for commodity trading and you are eager to widen your knowledge during this 2-year journey.
             You thrive in changing environments and you can deal with uncertainty or fast evolving situations
             You are fluent in English and globally mobile.
           
            
           
            Do you think you meet these requirements? If yes, don’t wait any longer and apply!
             
             
           
          
         
        
       
      
     
     
      
      
     
      
       
        
         
          Activités
          
        
       
      
      
      
       
        
         
          How do you apply?
          
          
            Upload your CV and feel free to share a short motivation statement
            Click on the link below and complete the three online assessments:
            https://afir.st/WJ4YQefGvu5xqH8w
            These tests assess your key behaviours, your motivations as well as your cognitive abilities. Each test can be completed independently (average completion time per test: 12 min). We appreciate that you may not have the time to complete these tests on the day of your application and this is why you will be able to complete them within up to five days from your application date. However, please kindly take note that the completion of the online assessments is compulsory for a valid application and that no reminder will be sent to you. It is possible to take the assessment on all supports (Mobile, IPad, PC) and in 12 languages so be mindful to select your mother tongue to feel at ease.
          
          
          
           
             As we want to provide you with an enriching experience, you will receive a synthesis of your assessment as soon as you have completed it!  And what’s next?
             
            
            
              Applications will remain open until end of April 2024. Should you be selected for Round 1, you will then be notified in May 2024.
              The interview process will involve up to 4 rounds and it will be a mix of remote and onsite sessions (HR online interview, sessions with our Managers and Traders including a case study and an assessment with our senior leaders). More details will be provided in due course!
              Successful applicants will join the program on October, 1st 2024.
            
             At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.
           
          
           
           
         
        
       
      
     
     
      
       
        
         
          Contexte et environnement
          
        
       
      
      
      
       
        
         
          
           Step into a thrilling, fast-paced trading environment where every moment counts.
          
         
        
       
      
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      
    
   
  
 
 
 
  
   
    
     
      
       
        
         
          Become one of the drivers of energy transition with TotalEnergies Trading Graduate Program.
          
          
            TotalEnergies is a multi-energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.
          
          
          
            TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping (T&S), an international trading company, puts its expertise to use in the global energy markets. With its biomass blending and trading activity, TotalEnergies T&S is an active participant in the development of sustainable biofuels. Our maritime transport expertise also helps to reduce the carbon footprint of sea transportation and we recently announced the time chartering of new vessels equipped with LNG propulsion.
          
          
          
            TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies (mainly gas, LNG and power). As such it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc). In such context TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.
          
          
          
            Oil, Gas & Power trading activities represent around 1200 positions worldwide.
          
          
          
            Our Culture:
          
          
          
            We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.
          
          
            Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.
          
          
            Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.
          
          
            We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.
          
          
          
            What do we offer?
          
          
          
            By joining our Trading Graduate Program you can shape your future; don’t wait any longer and start to build your career with us.
          
          
          
            Over two exciting years, you will rotate across four departments, where you will quickly understand how we operate as a company and gain a wide-ranging appreciation of our key functions preparing you to grow your career within the Trading business units.
          
          
            The rotations will take place in key trading support functions: Middle Office, Trading Operations and Market Analysis.
          
          
            The fourth rotation will be defined based on individual capabilities as well as business needs. It may include Credit Analysis, Quantitative Analysis, Shipping, Digital Lab etc…
          
          
            As part of the program, subject to performance, one of the rotations will be completed in a different country to where you started the program (Geneva or Houston) where you will develop your intercultural communication skills!
          
          
          
            The four rotations will consist of a blend of T&S (crude oil, oil products including biofuels) and TGP (mainly gas, LNG and power) assignments. This is undeniably a unique opportunity to experience an enriching multi-energies journey!
          
          
            Our program will be engaging and intense. In addition to usual Business activities, we are offering a comprehensive training program including:
          
          
          
            
           
             a purpose-built integration week
             on-the-job as well as online trainings and a dedicated training path
             regular mentoring sessions with our Senior Talent Developers
           
          
          
          
            We invite you to visit our Graduate Program section and to “Meet” some of our Graduates, watch our videos:
          
          
            Discover more about TotalEnergies Trading Graduate Program

TotalEnergies is a multi-energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.

TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping (T&S), an international trading company, puts its expertise to use in the global energy markets. TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies (mainly gas, LNG and power). Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc). In such context TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

Oil, Gas & Power trading activities represent around 1200 positions worldwide.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.
Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

description:
Role: (Full Spec available) 
 
  Maintain and upgrade the codebase and configuration of strategies within the firm’s automated trading framework. 
  Manage large datasets used in both research and production environments. 
  Collaboration closely with quant researchers and traders to understand the constantly evolving needs of the trading desks. 
 
 Requirements: 
 
  Graduate in June 2023, December 2024, or June 2024 
  Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical subject 
  Excellent knowledge of financial mathematics, derivative pricing and risk management 
  Strong knowledge of Python, C++ development skills and techniques 
  Executing compression and portfolio optimisation services 
 
 Perks 
 
  Best compensation in the market 
  Very friendly/collaborative environment 
  Heavy emphasis on upscaling you + investing in your development 
 
 Interested in applying? Please click on the ‘Easy Apply’ button. or contact me at rwong@hunterbond.com

  • Maintain and upgrade the codebase and configuration of strategies within the firm’s automated trading framework.
  • Manage large datasets used in both research and production environments.
  • Collaboration closely with quant researchers and traders to understand the constantly evolving needs of the trading desks.

Requirements:

  • Graduate in June 2023, December 2024, or June 2024
  • Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical subject
  • Excellent knowledge of financial mathematics, derivative pricing and risk management
  • Strong knowledge of Python, C++ development skills and techniques
  • Executing compression and portfolio optimisation services

Perks

  • Best compensation in the market
  • Very friendly/collaborative environment
  • Heavy emphasis on upscaling you + investing in your development

Interested in applying? Please click on the ‘Easy Apply’ button. or contact me at rwong@hunterbond.com

companyInfo/companyDescription:
LSEG

LSEG (London Stock Exchange Group) is more than a diversified global financial markets infrastructure and data business. We are dedicated, open-access partners with a commitment to excellence in delivering the services our customers expect from us. With extensive experience, deep knowledge and worldwide presence across financial markets, we enable businesses and economies around the world to fund innovation, manage risk and create jobs. It’s how we’ve contributed to supporting the financial stability and growth of communities and economies globally for more than 300 years.

Data & Analytics

Our acquisition of Refinitiv means we can provide the breadth and depth of financial data and best-in-class analytics that customers expect –driving innovation and growth across global markets.And our high-performance solutions –from trading, to market surveillance, to wealth solutions and more–help to enhance the performance of our customers.

FTSE Russell is a leading global provider of financial indexing, benchmarking and analytic services with more than $16 trillion benchmarked to our indices –and offers an extensive range of data services and research.

The combination of Refinitiv and FTSE Russell provides LSEG with leading capabilities in data, analytics, indices and benchmarks

Capital Markets

We offer our customers extensive access to capital markets and liquidity across multiple asset classes. We operate a broad range of international equity, fixed income, exchange-traded funds/exchange-traded products and foreign exchange markets. Our Group is home to several capital formation and execution venues: London Stock Exchange, AIM, Turquoise, CurveGlobal, FXall and Tradeweb (through a majority ownership interest).

Post Trade

We support our customers’ clearing and reporting obligations, providing risk, balance sheet and financial resource management solutions, whilst working with our other divisions to extend this support across the value chain.

A leading global clearing house with a strong presence across multiple asset classes, LCH helps financial institutions all over the world use their capital efficiently and manage counterparty risk. We work closely with sell-side clearing members and buy-side clients in conjunction with trading venues globally.

UnaVista, a regulated platform that helps customers meet their reporting compliance obligations and reduce operational and regulatory risk through reporting, reference data and analytics solutions, further complements our Post Trade offering.

Through a comprehensive suite of trusted financial market infrastructure services –and our open-access model –we provide the flexibility, stability and trust that enable our customers to pursue their ambitions with confidence and clarity.

LSEG is headquartered in the United Kingdom, with significant operations in 70 countries across EMEA, North America, Latin America and Asia Pacific. We employ 25,000 people globally, more than half located in Asia Pacific. LSEG’s ticker symbol is LSEG.
description:
We are excited to offer an opportunity for an aspiring Graduate Software Engineer to become an integral part of our dynamic team of seasoned developers. This role is perfectly tailored for recent graduates eager to embark on their professional journey within the technology sector.
   
   As a Graduate Software Engineer you will get to work on all levels of the technology stack, from cloud infrastructure, backend microservices, through to frontend UI's and everything inbetween.
   
   The ideal candidate will possess a profound enthusiasm for software development and a genuine curiosity about the latest technological innovations. Join us to begin your professional journey in an environment that supports your growth and curiosity!
 
 
 
   Responsibilities:
 
 
  
   
     Assist in the analysis, design, and implementation of complex software solutions, focusing on customer-centric design and delivery via public cloud.
   
  
   
     Assist in translating end-user needs into requirements, employing a lightweight agile design-led methodology.
   
  
   
     Participate in design sessions and planning for user stories by breaking down complex requests into smaller tasks.
   
  
   
     Contribute to the development of tools and applications by writing clean and efficient code.
   
  
   
     Collaborate with a team of software engineers under the guidance of senior team members, adopting an agile approach to software development.
   
  
   
     Build trusting relationships with team members and colleagues, fostering collaboration.
   
  
   
     Communicate effectively, learning to convey ideas with clarity and precision.
   
  
   
     Begin to build domain expertise in Financial market content, Sustainability and LSEG systems through guided learning and practical experience.
   
  
   
     Engage with the FinTech, big data, and academic community through participation in conferences, meetups, and workshops as an observer or learner, incorporating new techniques and technologies into your development.
   
 
 
 
   Required Skills and Experience:
 
 
  
   
     Recent graduate with a Diploma / Degree in Software Engineering / Computer Science / or equivalent background.
   
  
   
     Basic skills in software development, with exposure to NodeJS, Python, or other relevant programming languages through academic or personal projects or internships.
   
  
   
     Familiarity with web servers, databases, and cloud-based services, preferably AWS or Azure, or comparable technologies through academic or personal projects.
   
  
   
     Understanding of or exposure to containerised environments (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
   
  
   
     Awareness of CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code concepts (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible).
   
  
   
     Interest in learning about developing and deploying microservices architectures.
   
  
   
     Basic understanding of Linux operating systems and comfort with the CLI, as gained through coursework or personal exploration.
   
  
   
     Exposure to front-end development frameworks (ReactJS, Vue, Angular, etc.).
   
  
   
     Strong critical thinking skills and the ability to apply common sense and value judgment, with a willingness to learn from real-world processes.
   
  
   
     Demonstrate adaptability and eagerness to tackle challenges in a fast-paced environment, with strong problem-solving skills and time management.
   
  
   
     Ability to work both independently with guidance and as part of a team.
   
  
   
     A positive attitude toward learning new skills and technologies, with a keen interest in software development and a commitment to personal growth.
   
  
   
     Participation in open-source projects, hackathons, or other technical extracurricular activities is a plus, demonstrating a passion for technology and self-driven learning.
   
 
 
 
   The successful candidate will join the Sustainable Finance and Investment division of LSEG. Here you will work with SF&I business stakeholders and Technology department to deliver innovative sustainability products and services. As a global organisation, you will work with teams based around the world, including Singapore, London and New York.
 
 
 
   At LSEG, we believe that creating a diverse and inclusive organisation is fundamental to the way we deliver on our promise of creating essential partnerships and open opportunities. Our open culture is central to how we deliver our purpose – driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth – in everything we do.
 
 
 
   Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 70 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.
 
 
 
   LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.
 
 
 
   We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone’s race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.
 
 
 
   LSEG is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. Our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.
 
 
 
   Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of Integrity, Partnership, Excellence and Change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions.
 
 
 
   Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.
 
 
 
   LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.
 
 
 
   We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone’s race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs.
 
 
 
   Please take a moment to read this 
  
   privacy notice
   carefully, as it describes what personal information London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) (we) may hold about you, what it’s used for, and how it’s obtained, 
  
   your rights and how to contact us as a data subject
  .
 
 
   If you are submitting as a Recruitment Agency Partner, it is essential and your responsibility to ensure that candidates applying to LSEG are aware of this privacy notice.

description:
Responsibilities: 
 
  Responsible for sourcing on electronics and mechanical parts 
  Responsible obtain quotation and negotiate with suppliers 
  Responsible follow through purchase requisitions 
  Responsible prepares detailed estimates of time, parts usage and cost analysis 
  Responsible prepares service parts planning 
  Working closely with sales department to understand our customers current and future technical requirements 
  Propose innovative and cost-effective solutions to meet intended business objectives 
  Provide documentation and reporting support to Service department 
 
 Requirements: 
 
  No Experience Required! Fresh Graduates Welcome! 
  Candidate must possess at least Degree/Diploma/ITE in relevant engineering field 
  Good communication and interpersonal skills 
  Good document and report skills 
  Proactive with good initiatives, problem solving and analytical ability 
  Proficiency in Microsoft Office (especially in MS Excel) 
  Extensive knowledge of the semiconductor IC market and various electronic applications is advantage

description:
Working Location: Central 
 Working hours: 10am to 6pm (Monday to Friday) 
 
  
 We are looking for highly motivated individuals who aspire to grow and lead in management roles. 
 
  
 Your role: 
 
  Learning and understanding the different functions in the organization, from planning, to budgeting, to sales, and recruitment 
  Utilising digital marketing tools and mobile apps to engage clients and prospects on a daily basis 
  Building clientele base and working with clients on providing solutions and building long term relationships 
  Participating in meetings, workshops, and events 
  Compiling analysis and making presentations to other team members 
  Completing fieldwork and providing evaluation analysis of the company’s services 
  Gaining knowledge of management viewpoints, company policies, protocols, and processes 
  Fulfilling any requirements and meeting goals set out at the start of the traineeship 
  Observe experienced staffs to acquire knowledge of methods, procedures, and standards required for performance of departmental duties 
  Provide support as needed in the various departments, including data-entry, presentation creation, strategic planning, client service matters as needed 
  Prepare report on client’s portfolio performance and investments 
 
 Requirements 
 
  Minimum Diploma and above 
  Willing to learn and flexibility to adapt to working environment 
  Training and 1 to 1 mentorship will be provided 
 
 EA Reg. Number: R21100629 
 EA License Number: 22C1278

company: A*STAR Agency for Science, Technology and Research
companyInfo/companyDescription:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) drives mission-oriented research that advances scientific discovery and technological innovation. We play a key role in nurturing and developing talent and leaders for our Research Institutes, the wider research community, and industry.



Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore. As a Science and Technology Organisation, we bridge the gap between academia and industry in terms of research and development. In these endeavours, we seek to integrate the relevant capabilities of our research institutes and collaborate with the wider research community as well as other public sector agencies towards meaningful and impactful outcomes. Together with the other public sector entities, we develop industry sectors by:



integrating our capabilities to create impact with Multi-National Corporations and Globally Competitive Companies;

partnering Local Enterprises for productivity and gearing them for growth; and

nurturing R&D-driven Start-ups by seeding for surprises and shaping for success.

Our research, in addition, also contributes to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability. These serve to enhance lives in Singapore and beyond.
description:
A*GA supports top-class education at both local and overseas universities/ institutions to help passionate individuals realise their full potential. We also identify budding scientific talents through extensive outreach programmes and internships to nurture them into future scientific talents. 

 This role is under the Shared Services (SS) branch, which is a centralized hub to support administrative and operational requirements for scholarships, awards and internships. 

 Responsibilities:
 Support the application, issuance, and cancellation of Training Pass 
Manage TEP-related inquiries from students and supervisors 
Process monthly disbursements of stipends and allowances 
Perform goods receipt for goods/services delivered to A*GA 
Ensure timely updates to databases and departmental Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) 
Participate as a team member in providing user requirements, conducting user acceptance tests, etc., for ad-hoc digitalisation projects and system enhancements 
Carry out covering duties as a personal assistant to the Executive Director of A*GA 
Carry out other duties that may be assigned from time to time by the supervisor 

 Job Requirements:
 Proficient in MS Office applications, such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint 
Basic financial / accounting knowledge is preferred 
Experience in the application, issuance, and cancellation of Training Pass is preferred 
Meticulous, self-motivated, and resourceful 
Good interpersonal and communication skills to build rapport with fellow colleagues 
Diploma in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or other related fields are welcome to apply 
Candidates without experience, but display good aptitude may be considered. 
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. 
Type of Employment : Full-Time 
Minimum Experience : 2 Years 
Work Location : Biopolis

companyInfo/companyDescription: Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 500,000+ people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities.
description:
About Accenture Accenture is a leading global professional services company that helps the world’s leading businesses, governments and other organizations build their digital core, optimize their operations, accelerate revenue growth and enhance citizen services—creating tangible value at speed and scale. We are a talent and innovation led company with 738,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries. Technology is at the core of change today, and we are one of the world’s leaders in helping drive that change, with strong ecosystem relationships. We combine our strength in technology with unmatched industry experience, functional expertise and global delivery capability. We are uniquely able to deliver tangible outcomes because of our broad range of services, solutions and assets across Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations, Industry X and Accenture Song. These capabilities, together with our culture of shared success and commitment to creating 360° value, enable us to help our clients succeed and build trusted, lasting relationships. We measure our success by the 360° value we create for our clients, each other, our shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
 
  Come work at the heart of change.
 
  Take the first step to a fulfilling tech career at Accenture. You will be exposed to the exciting work within the Public Sector, helping Singapore achieve its Smart Nation vision as you develop your career. Enhance your skills through continuous learning and development opportunities to build and strengthen your expertise in the ever-growing technology space.
 
  You can also expect to receive professional training, mentorship and career coaching to help empower, drive, and guide you in your career aspirations and decisions.
 
  As a software engineering associate, you will: 
 
  Be involved in the development, coding, testing, deployment, and software maintenance of the applications and products.
  Team up with others, like yourself, to develop and deliver solutions with continuous innovation and bring new ideas to our clients, improving the way operations is run.
  Operate IT production services according to management protocols and Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
  Together with your team, support various phases of the Software Development Lifecycle, ensuring client satisfaction and delivery excellence.
  Provide operational support, ensuring production systems and devices are online and available.
  Opportunity to use some of the most advanced technology around such as cloud engineering and operations, automation, RPA and SRE, intelligent call centre technologies.
 
  Your role assignment will be based on business needs and your personal strengths.
 
 

 We would love to speak with you if you have: 
 
  A Diploma in Information Technology
  A willingness to learn and an interest in technology
  Good communication and interpersonal skills
  Flexibility and willingness to work on different projects, if required
 
 
  It would be advantageous if you are versed in the following tech stacks: 
 
  Java / J2EE / .Net / Fullstack development
  DevSecOps
  Data engineering / R / Python
  Low code development platforms
 
 
  All of our consulting professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills development. You’ll also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.
 
  Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.

Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Snaphunt is an AI-enabled recruiting platform that helps employers hire specialist talent for a skill and culture fit, quickly and conveniently.
 
Snaphunt uses specialist algorithms to understand employers’ requirements and sources and screens talent to provide them with targeted applicants, entirely without any human touch. Snaphunt also does away with all manual tasks related to recruitment. As a result, on Snaphunt, employers reduce time to hire by more than 30%, hiring effort by more than 50% and hiring costs by more than 90%.
 
For jobseekers, Snaphunt acts like a job search concierge. Once a jobseeker signs up on the platform, Snaphunt proposes them jobs that match their profile and aspirations while also bringing transparency to their job search by providing them with real-time updates.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Julius Baer is the leading Swiss wealth management group. We focus on servicing and advising sophisticated private clients from around the world, taking into account what truly matters to them – in their business and personal life, today and for future generations. Join us and Be Bär.

Headquartered in Zurich, we are present in more than 50 locations worldwide, including Dubai, Frankfurt, Geneva, Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mexico City, Milan, Monaco, Montevideo, Moscow, Mumbai, São Paulo, Singapore and Tokyo.

For more information, visit our website: www.juliusbaer.com
description:
At Julius Baer, we celebrate and value the individual qualities you bring, enabling you to be impactful, to be entrepreneurial, to be empowered, and to create value beyond wealth. Let’s shape the future of wealth management together. 
 Julius Baer is the leading Swiss private banking group with a focus on servicing and advising sophisticated private clients, and a premium brand in global wealth management. That is why a comprehensive range of services and first-class service quality are essential – as are the committed teams that provide them. 
  
  Are you a recent graduate and looking for a great career start? Join our 24-month Chief Risk Office (CRO) Analyst Programme as of Sep 2024 and shape the future of wealth management and beyond together with us. 
  
  The Chief Risk Office (CRO) division develops and oversees the global framework for risk identification, control, reporting, and management within the risk tolerance for the various business activities for Julius Baer, aiming at sustainable growth of the franchise. As a member of the CRO division, the incumbent is expected to abide by relevant principles and expectations as specified in the CRO Business Organisation Manual. 
  
  Compliance is part of the Risk, Legal and Compliance Division of Julius Baer and supports the Senior Management in ensuring compliance with external and internal regulations to actively manage operational, regulatory and reputational risks. 
 
 YOUR CHALLENGE 
 Join the CRO APAC Division and become part of the Singapore Compliance Team in Singapore . You will be actively involved in the implementation of the compliance programme of the bank and gaining first-hand experience in the private banking industry. 
 
 P er son al C on t r i b u t i o n a n d Re sponsi b i l i t i e s 
 
  Key contributor for SoC related matters in Asia 
  Actively collaborate in local know-how sharing groups (should there be any of relevance) 
  Continuously learn about new detection techniques applicable to BJB’s security landscape 
  Must be able to work across global and regional groups and communicate information risk matters effectively 
  Identification of monitoring needs and use cases 
  Proposal of solution(s) to cover identified needs (e.g. monitoring pattern) – at times, this is regulatory driven 
  Assistance during implementation of the proposed solution 
  Documentation of monitoring/response processes 
  Response to security events/incidents according to team agenda and, where available, based on processes/work instructions 
  Escalation of incidents where required 
  Involved in regulatory engagements (questionnaires, responses to regulatory circulars and advisories, etc) 
  Involved with security investigations and escalations (i.e. misconduct) 
  Keep abreast of new or changing regulatory requirements and technology advances and identify trends, potential new technologies, and emerging threats which may impact the business – this also includes potentially leading regulatory requirements’ remediation projects driven by Information Security Asia (i.e. MAS, HKMA) 
  Assist with periodic security audits and management reporting 
  Review and coordinate changes to information security policies, procedures, standards, and audit work programs in a continuous improvement model 
  From time to time, the incumbent may be asked to support the production and delivery of Information Security education and awareness to staff at various levels 
 
 
 YOUR PROFILE 
 P er son al a n d S o c i al 
 
  Strong inter-personal and communication skills (strong spoken and written English) 
  A hands-on individual who is willing to work independently to drive initiatives and tasks (under guidance), highly analytical with keen interest in security technologies 
  Able to work under pressure 
  Ability to prioritize and multi-task in a competitive environment 
 
 
 P r o f e ssi o n al a n d T e c hni c a l 
 
  Bachelor’s Degree in IT Security, Computer Science or Computer Engineering 
  Desire to learn broadly – across both technical and generalist aspects of the function 
 
 
 We are looking forward to receiving your full job application through our online application tool. Further interesting job opportunities can be found on our Career site . 
 Is this not quite what you are looking for? Set up a job alert by creating a candidate account here .

positionName: Chief Risk Office Information Security Analyst (24-month Analyst Programme)

description:
Overview:
 
  WELCOME TO SITA
 
  SITA is the leading specialist in air transport communications and information technology. We don’t just connect the global aviation industry, we apply decades of experience and expertise to address almost every core business, operational, baggage, and passenger process in air transport. As an organization, we cover 95% of all international air travel destinations and work with over 2,800 air transport and government customers in every corner of the globe. Immerse yourself in the dynamic world of technology while embracing our collaborative, and inclusive culture.
 
  Ready to redefine air travel? The journey starts here, with you at SITA.
 
  ABOUT THE ROLE & TEAM:
 
 
   As a Cloud Specialist, Graduate you will assist the Service Operations team to ensure service delivery quality is maintained through direct assistance in implementing and improving working processes and procedures. You will be accountable for performing all Service Operations activities according to SITA standards and procedures maximizing customer satisfaction by the delivery of first class support activities.
 
 
 
   Reporting to the Director, Service Operations you will be a part of the Service & Infrastructure Operations team responsible for providing Service & Infrastructure Operations support to internal and external customers in accordance with the terms of the customer contract and Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
 
 
 
   At SITA, we are meeting the new needs of travel ...today! Are you ready to join us?
 
 
 
   WHAT YOU WILL DO: 
 
 
  Carry out proactive fault monitoring and incident management support to the highest standards and co-ordinate the resolution with the appropriate resolver groups.
   Ensure shortest restoral times possible, initiating the timely escalations to specialized resolver groups inside and outside SITA, according to the customer contracts, SLAs and monitoring requirements.
   Proactively detect problems related to service and infrastructure operations and delivery services, conduct diagnostics and provide service request ownership to ensure resolution of customer problems.
   Report and escalate all observed problems to proper SITA operational escalation points.
   Carry out preventive and proactive maintenance of equipment and monitoring of systems and services in accordance with agreed schedules and customer expectations.
 
 
 
   EXPERIENCE: 
 
 
  University Degree in Computer Engineering/Systems Engineering/Information Systems;
   Basic knowledge in Operating Systems - Linux / Windows;
   Keen interest in IT Infrastructure systems including server management (HP/Dell Servers), Operating System administration;
   Keen interest in Cloud technologies including Public (Azure/AWS) Cloud and Private Cloud (VMware);
   Good communication skills, fluent in English
   Must be a team player
   Must obtain your degree by 2024
   No more than 12 months relevant post graduate experience, excluding undergraduate placement/ internship experience.
 
 
 
   WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT:
 
 
   Participate in structured rotations allowing you great exposure to different teams and technologies.
   Get assigned to a Buddy and a Mentor that will guide you throughout your Graduate experience.
   18-month contractual assignment with a high possibility of conversion.
   Shift based work assignment (7.45am- 4.35pm/ 12noon- 8.45pm), alternate weeks
   Each month you are also expected to work on 1xSat and 1xSun (not every weekend). For each Sat or Sun that you are working, you will be compensated with an Off day on either Monday or Friday
   Monthly shift allowance will also be provided on top of your basic salary and a end of contract bonus.
   Free shuttle bus provided from Tampines MRT.
 
 
  WHAT WE OFFER:
 
  SITA’s workplace is all about diversity, many different countries and cultures are represented in our workforce. We collaborate in our impressive offices, embracing a hybrid work format. As part of our global benefits, we offer:
 
   Flex Week: Work from home up to 2 days/week (depending on your Team's needs).
 
  Flex Day: You may wish to flex your arrival time at the office to beat rush hours or leave earlier for personal commitments. We encourage open communication with your manager about your needs and routine.
 
  Flex-Location: Enjoy up to 30 workdays of benefits, anywhere in the world!
  Employee Wellbeing: Benefit from the Employee Assistance Program (EAP) provided by SITA, a yearly free service offering practical advice in various aspects of your life.
  Professional Development: Enhance your skills with our training platforms, inclusive of LinkedIn Learning!
  Competitive Benefits: Access competitive benefits tailored to the local market and your employment status.
 
  SITA is an Equal Opportunity Employer and values a diverse workforce. In support of our Employment Equity Program, women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply and self-identify in the application process.
descriptionHTML:
Overview:


WELCOME TO SITA


SITA is the leading specialist in air transport communications and information technology. We don’t just connect the global aviation industry, we apply decades of experience and expertise to address almost every core business, operational, baggage, and passenger process in air transport. As an organization, we cover 95% of all international air travel destinations and work with over 2,800 air transport and government customers in every corner of the globe. Immerse yourself in the dynamic world of technology while embracing our collaborative, and inclusive culture.


Ready to redefine air travel? The journey starts here, with you at SITA.


ABOUT THE ROLE & TEAM:


As a Cloud Specialist, Graduate you will assist the Service Operations team to ensure service delivery quality is maintained through direct assistance in implementing and improving working processes and procedures. You will be accountable for performing all Service Operations activities according to SITA standards and procedures maximizing customer satisfaction by the delivery of first class support activities.

Reporting to the Director, Service Operations you will be a part of the Service & Infrastructure Operations team responsible for providing Service & Infrastructure Operations support to internal and external customers in accordance with the terms of the customer contract and Service Level Agreements (SLAs).

At SITA, we are meeting the new needs of travel ...today! Are you ready to join us?

WHAT YOU WILL DO:
  • Carry out proactive fault monitoring and incident management support to the highest standards and co-ordinate the resolution with the appropriate resolver groups.
  • Ensure shortest restoral times possible, initiating the timely escalations to specialized resolver groups inside and outside SITA, according to the customer contracts, SLAs and monitoring requirements.
  • Proactively detect problems related to service and infrastructure operations and delivery services, conduct diagnostics and provide service request ownership to ensure resolution of customer problems.
  • Report and escalate all observed problems to proper SITA operational escalation points.
  • Carry out preventive and proactive maintenance of equipment and monitoring of systems and services in accordance with agreed schedules and customer expectations.

EXPERIENCE:
  • University Degree in Computer Engineering/Systems Engineering/Information Systems;
  • Basic knowledge in Operating Systems - Linux / Windows;
  • Keen interest in IT Infrastructure systems including server management (HP/Dell Servers), Operating System administration;
  • Keen interest in Cloud technologies including Public (Azure/AWS) Cloud and Private Cloud (VMware);
  • Good communication skills, fluent in English
  • Must be a team player
  • Must obtain your degree by 2024
  • No more than 12 months relevant post graduate experience, excluding undergraduate placement/ internship experience.

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT:
  • Participate in structured rotations allowing you great exposure to different teams and technologies.
  • Get assigned to a Buddy and a Mentor that will guide you throughout your Graduate experience.
  • 18-month contractual assignment with a high possibility of conversion.
  • Shift based work assignment (7.45am- 4.35pm/ 12noon- 8.45pm), alternate weeks
  • Each month you are also expected to work on 1xSat and 1xSun (not every weekend). For each Sat or Sun that you are working, you will be compensated with an Off day on either Monday or Friday
  • Monthly shift allowance will also be provided on top of your basic salary and a end of contract bonus.
  • Free shuttle bus provided from Tampines MRT.


WHAT WE OFFER:


SITA’s workplace is all about diversity, many different countries and cultures are represented in our workforce. We collaborate in our impressive offices, embracing a hybrid work format. As part of our global benefits, we offer:


Flex Week: Work from home up to 2 days/week (depending on your Team's needs).

  • Flex Day: You may wish to flex your arrival time at the office to beat rush hours or leave earlier for personal commitments. We encourage open communication with your manager about your needs and routine.

Flex-Location: Enjoy up to 30 workdays of benefits, anywhere in the world!

Employee Wellbeing: Benefit from the Employee Assistance Program (EAP) provided by SITA, a yearly free service offering practical advice in various aspects of your life.

Professional Development: Enhance your skills with our training platforms, inclusive of LinkedIn Learning!

Competitive Benefits: Access competitive benefits tailored to the local market and your employment status.


SITA is an Equal Opportunity Employer and values a diverse workforce. In support of our Employment Equity Program, women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply and self-identify in the application process.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
With a payout capital of S$1,000,000 and a financial grade of C1, we are capable of undertaking all scope of building conservation, maintenance and repair works, as well as ensuring a supply of quality skilled tradesmen to enhance clients’ operational needs. 



Aegis Building & Engineering Pte Ltd was established in 2002. Over the years, our relentless pursuit of providing the best maintenance and repair services for conserved and general buildings has earned us unrivalled reputation in the industry and made us a clear leader in the field.



We have gone from strength to strength by maintaining strong long-term working relationships with key clients such as Marina Bay Sands, Shangri-la Hotel, Hilton Hotel, Wyeth, Pfizer and many others.
description:
We are seeking self-driven and result oriented individuals to join us as Management Trainee. During the job rotation period, the Management Trainee(s) will be placed in the various functional teams to undergo on-the-job training in all areas of the Company. The Management Trainee(s) will perform sales role upon successful completion of the job rotation. 
 
  
 Key roles and responsibilities 
 
  Work closely with the management and the various internal teams. 
  Gain knowledge of policies, operations and processes of the Company. 
  Complete assigned tasks and assisting with day-to- day operations in various job rotations. 
  Learn techniques to manage customers and achieve sales target. 
  Manage work initiatives and projects. 
  Prepare and deliver appropriate presentations. 
  Undertake any other duties assigned by the Management to support the business. 
 
 Requirements 
 
  Fresh poly graduates are welcomed to apply 
  Proficiency in MS Office 
  Strong verbal, written and presentation skills 
  Effective communication skills 
  Ability to work under stress and multitask 
  Ability to work on weekends for Sales and Operation job rotations 
  Good problem solving and critical thinking skills

description:
Company
   
  
   Pacific Refreshments Pte Ltd (The Coca-Cola Company)
   
     coca-cola.com
   
   
 
 
  
   Designation
   
  
   Environment, Health and Safety Intern
   
 
 
  
   Date Listed
   
  
   01 Mar 2024
   
 
 
  
   Job Type
   
  
   Entry Level / Junior Executive
   
     Intern/TS
   
   
 
 
  
   Job Period
   
  
   From Jun 2024, For At Least 6 Months
   
 
 
  
   Profession
   
  
   Security / Safety / Investigation
   
 
 
  
   Industry
   
  
   Manufacturing Food / Lifestyle / Packaging
   
 
 
  
   Location Name
   
  
   1 Tuas Bay Drive, Singapore 637557
   
 
 
  
   Address
   
  
   1 Tuas Bay Dr, Singapore 637557
   
 
 
  
   Map
   
 
 
 
  
   Allowance / Remuneration
   
  
   $900 - 1,500 monthly 
  
 
 
 
  
   Company Profile
   
  
   Pacific Refreshments Pte Ltd (The Coca-Cola Company) is a strategic concentrate manufacturing plant in Asia. We are an export facility, specializing in the manufacturing of concentrates and beverage bases, with a complex portfolio, supporting the ASEAN, South Pacific and Southwest Asia business units. We are on a journey of growth - having completed the construction and expansion of our site towards doubling our manufacturing capacity in recent years. We have also embarked on our digital transformation journey, striving to be the Lighthouse for the Consumer Products Supply (CPS) plants in Asia and to be a leader in digital transformation.
    Pacific Refreshments Pte Ltd is a winner of the ‘2020 HR Asia Best Companies to Work For’ Award. 
  
 
 
  
   Job Description
   
  
   What You’ll Do For Us:
    This role will offer exposure to a variety of EHS regulations and provide an opportunity to develop your analytical and problem-solving skills. Also, it will allow you to contribute positively towards fostering a safe and healthy work environment. You’ll be working hand-in-hand with experienced EHS practitioners and other key personnel in the organization, providing you with an ideal platform for career growth in the health and safety industry.
   
     Assisting in the development, implementation, and maintenance of safety and health programs, systems, and procedures.
     Monitoring hazardous and non-hazardous waste management, as well as management of regulated substances like Hazardous substances, Flammable materials.
     Assisting in coordinating and delivering EHS training programs to employees, organizing of various site wide safety & sustainability awareness campaigns.
     Assisting in emergency response planning and drills.
     Assisting in data management & analytics for safety & sustainability performance to identify improvement opportunities.
     Be part of the sustainability team to work on water, energy improvement & carbon net zero projects.
   
    Qualifications & Requirements:
   
     Currently enrolled in or a recent graduate from a degree program in Environmental Science, Occupational Health and Safety, Sustainability or a relevant field.
     Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work well in a team.
     Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
     Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Words, Excel, PowerPoint)
     Self-motivated and have a proactive approach to work.
     Prior internships, projects or volunteer work in digitalization fields are desirable.
   
    What We Can Do For You:
   
     Gaining exposure to company growth and digitalization strategies
     Exposure to a wide range of EHS tasks and assignments which serves as an effective launching pad for your career,
     Opportunity to work across various departments, interact with professionals at all levels.
     Panoramic view of the industry operations and a chance to understand how EHS strategies.
   
    If this sounds like something you're interested to explore further, we look forward to meeting you in our Happiness Factory! 
  
 
 
  
   Application Instructions
   
  
   Please apply for this position by submitting your text CV using InternSG or link your resume in your application.
    Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
