descriptionHTML:
Company
Pico X Health Technology Pte Ltd
picoxhealth.com
Designation
Web Content Administrator
Date Listed
22 Feb 2024
Job Type
Entry Level / Junior Executive
Intern/TS
Job Period
Immediate Start, For At Least 3 Months
Profession
Editorial / Linguist / Writing
Industry
Healthcare / Fitness / Sports
Location Name
Singapore
Work from Home
Allowance / Remuneration
$850 - 1,600 monthly
Company Profile

Pico X is an attitude towards life, a belief system that promotes healthy and eco-friendly living. At the heart of this philosophy is the understanding that our health and the health of the environment are inextricably linked.

Overall, Pico X represents a lifestyle that prioritises health and the environment. The brand's commitment to natural ingredients, waste reduction, and sustainability sets it apart from other personal care brands. With Pico X, consumers can make a positive impact on their health and the planet.

Pico X started with the understanding that our personal health is closely tied to our homes and the wider world in which we live. The environments we inhabit have a significant impact on our physical, mental, and emotional wellbeing, and our homes serve as a crucial starting point for maintaining good health, Sustainable Health.

A clean and comfortable home can promote good mental health, while proper ventilation and lighting can reduce the risk of physical illnesses. However, the health of our homes is also inter-related with the health of the world around us, as environmental factors such as air pollution and water contamination can negatively impact our health.

Living a lifestyle that focuses on environmental, family, and health is a holistic approach to wellness that emphasizes the interconnectedness of these three aspects of our lives. This lifestyle is centered around making choices that promote the well-being of ourselves, our families, and the environment.

Pico X as one of the innovators of sustainable health, taking a holistic approach to wellness, we can create a happier, healthier, and more fulfilling life for ourselves and our families, while also contributing to a healthier planet for future generations.

Job Description

We are seeking a proactive and passionate intern from Myanmar to join our Web Portal Management team. This role is ideal for someone looking to gain extensive experience in the non-technical aspects of managing a dynamic web portal. The intern will play a crucial role in content management, user experience optimisation, and the overall operational efficiency of our web portal. This position offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the strategic planning and execution of digital content, ensuring our web portal remains engaging, informative, and user-friendly. The successful candidate will be working in Singapore during the period. Lodging will be provided.

Key Responsibilities

  • Content Coordination: Assist in the planning, scheduling, and management of content across the portal. Work closely with content creators to ensure timely publication of articles, blogs, and multimedia content.
  • User Experience (UX) Optimization: Monitor user feedback and web analytics to propose improvements for the web portal's design and content layout, aiming to enhance user satisfaction and engagement.
  • Quality Control: Ensure all content published meets our quality standards and adheres to our editorial guidelines. Conduct regular reviews of the web portal to identify and correct any issues.
  • Market Research: Conduct research on current trends in digital content, competitor analysis, and user behavior to recommend strategies for content enhancement and portal growth.
  • Collaboration with Technical Team: While the role is non-technical, collaboration with the technical team is essential. Communicate user feedback and operational requirements to support the technical maintenance and improvement of the portal.
  • Reporting and Analytics: Assist in compiling reports on web portal performance, including traffic analytics, user engagement metrics, and content performance. Use data to inform content strategy and improvements.
  • Administrative Support: Provide administrative support for the web portal team, including scheduling meetings, preparing presentations, and managing communication with internal and external stakeholders.

Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in or a recent graduate of a Bachelor's degree program in Business Administration, Communications, Marketing, or a related field.
  • Strong interest in digital media, content creation, and web portal management.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Basic understanding of web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics) is a plus.
  • Creative thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Learning Opportunities

  • Gain hands-on experience in managing a comprehensive web portal.
  • Develop skills in content strategy, user experience optimization, and digital marketing.
  • Work with cross-functional teams, including content creators, UX designers, and technical staff.
  • Understand web analytics and how to use data to inform strategic decisions.
  • Build a portfolio of work demonstrating your contributions to the success and growth of the web portal.

Application Process

Please submit your resume, a cover letter explaining your interest in the role, and any relevant coursework or projects. Shortlisted candidates will be invited for an interview.

Application Instructions
Please apply for this position by submitting your text CV using InternSG.
Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Join our community of solvers. 

We’re inspiring and empowering our people to change the world. Here, you’ll learn with purpose, lead with heart and put your skills to work to make a meaningful difference in the world. As part of a diverse team, you’ll build trust and create innovative client solutions in unexpected ways.

At PwC, our purpose is to build trust in society and solve important problems. Our purpose, vision and values are what connects the more than 327,000+ people across the PwC global network of firms who are committed to delivering quality in assurance, advisory and tax services. 

Are you ready to make an impact?
description:
Line of Service Internal Firm Services 
 
 Industry/Sector Not Applicable 
 
 Specialism IFS - Human Capital (HC) 
 
 Management Level Senior Associate 
 
 Job Description & Summary Job Description Summary 
  We believe that challenges are better solved together. That's why you'll join a diverse, global community of solvers - an unexpected mix of people that come together to build trust in society and solve important problems. With us, you are encouraged to lead with your heart and values, and where your unique skills are developed and put to work in unexpected and exciting ways, superpowered by technology. 
  
  Firmwide Corporate Services 
  
  Our Firmwide Corporate Services unite to help build our competitive advantage with first class support internally. Spanning Administration, Business Development, Chairman’s Office, Compliance, Finance, Human Resources, Learning and Development, Legal, Marketing and Communications, Operations and Change Management, and Technology, we power our lines of services to make sure all of us have the right sources, services and technology to be the best we can be. 
  
  Not all of us work directly with external clients. Some of our most talented people choose to harness their skills, experience, expertise and service excellence within PwC. The possibilities are endless and our business landscape is changing everyday. 
 
 
  How will you value-add? 
 
 
 
  In 2020, PwC made a global science-based commitment to achieve net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2030. The commitment includes supporting our clients to reduce their emissions as well as reducing those from the PwC network’s operations and suppliers. We are looking for a Corporate Sustainability (Net Zero) Senior Associate to be part of our responsible business team, who helps to deliver PwC Singapore's programmes across inclusion & diversity, wellbeing, culture & value and corporate responsibility and also the larger global Net Zero team. 
  
  You will be instrumental in driving our efforts and initiatives to achieve Net Zero by 2030. You will work collaboratively with internal stakeholders to develop tools and campaigns to raise awareness and promote sustainability initiatives within PwC Singapore. Key roles and responsibilities would include: 
  
   Support the ESG Leader to achieve the Net Zero aim by 2030. 
   Manage periodic reporting, tracking and managing of data related to sustainability to develop strategy to reduce carbon emissions and for assurance reporting 
   Identify and evaluate emission reduction opportunities and pathways including organising and running programs to engage employees to drive positive change 
   Engage with key supply chain partners to review sustainability implications of material contracts 
   Manage effective communications strategy internally and externally including working with key relationship managers in maintaining partnerships with external stakeholders such as NGOs and clients (including members of the Singapore Low Carbon Network). 
   Design, drive and implement RB campaigns (i.e. Inclusion Week, Ecoweek, Wellbeing Week and Giving Week, Veganuary) 
  
  
  About you 
  
   Passionate about climate change and sustainability 
   Preferably a recent graduate in sustainability / environmental science / engineering / communications. 
   Knowledge of trends and best practice within people experience/human resources, particularly the areas of inclusion and diversity and wellbeing (employee mental health, development, engagement) 
   Good interpersonal skills including strong communication skills, to develop good working relationships with stakeholders 
   Adaptable and agile to manage stakeholder requirements 
   Good project management and coordination skills to manage multiple projects 
   Deliver high quality work, in a conscientious and professional manner 
   Strong sense of responsibility, accountability and initiative 
   Proficient use of Microsoft office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint) and preferably familiar with Google suite 
   Preferably with work experience from a large organisation/corporate 
  
 
 
 Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified) Degrees/Field of Study required: 
 Degrees/Field of Study preferred: 
 
 Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified) 
 
 Required Skills 
 
 Optional Skills 
 
 Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified) 
 
 Travel Requirements Not Specified 
 
 Available for Work Visa Sponsorship? Yes 
 
 Government Clearance Required? No 
 
 Job Posting End Date

companyInfo/companyDescription: Pepperl+Fuchs is a worldwide company with its headquarters in Mannheim, Germany. The company manufactures products for fabrication and process automation and is specialized in sensor manufacturing, for example sensors which are used in automatic doors in elevators.Pepperl+Fuchs was founded in 1945 by Walter Pepperl and Ludwig Fuchs as a radio repair shop.
description:
You want to make your ideas reality … 
        … and extend your limits at the same time? 
        Then you've come to the right place! We can offer you plenty of space for your ideas, excellent development possibilities and exciting challenges. 
        In automotive production, water treatment plants or chemical systems - around the world, electronic sensors and automation components by Pepperl+Fuchs guarantee smooth and safe operations. We know that dedicated and highly motivated employees are crucial to our success. As we want to continue growing, we hope to discover young talents that would be interested in: 
        2024 ENGINEERING TRAINEE PROGRAM (ETP), SINGAPORE 
        Program Overview: 
        The Engineering Trainee Program (ETP) is an exciting 2-year program where fresh University graduates from selected Engineering courses will be exposed to various facets of engineering knowledge and application, through a structured rotation in three engineering departments. 
        This unique journey provides a strong foundation and a broad overview of best practices in engineering, whilst supporting your personal and professional growth - through mentorship and opportunity to engage in meaningful projects that will make an impact in the real world. 
        Program Requirements: 
        To be successful in this program, you will need to meet the following criteria:
         
         Working towards a degree at University in either Electronics & Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, Industrial Engineering or equivalent 
         Due to graduate in 2024 and available to enroll in this program from July 2024 onwards 
         Passionate on topics related to problem solving, technology and innovation 
         Strong communication skills, proactive and able to work well in a collaborative environment 
         Positive energy with a committed and enthusiastic can-do attitude 
        
        Have we piqued your interest? 
        If the above describes you, then please send your applications online quoting "ETP". We look forward to your application!
descriptionHTML:
You want to make your ideas reality …

… and extend your limits at the same time?

Then you've come to the right place! We can offer you plenty of space for your ideas, excellent development possibilities and exciting challenges.

In automotive production, water treatment plants or chemical systems - around the world, electronic sensors and automation components by Pepperl+Fuchs guarantee smooth and safe operations. We know that dedicated and highly motivated employees are crucial to our success. As we want to continue growing, we hope to discover young talents that would be interested in:

2024 ENGINEERING TRAINEE PROGRAM (ETP), SINGAPORE

Program Overview:

The Engineering Trainee Program (ETP) is an exciting 2-year program where fresh University graduates from selected Engineering courses will be exposed to various facets of engineering knowledge and application, through a structured rotation in three engineering departments.

This unique journey provides a strong foundation and a broad overview of best practices in engineering, whilst supporting your personal and professional growth - through mentorship and opportunity to engage in meaningful projects that will make an impact in the real world.

Program Requirements:

To be successful in this program, you will need to meet the following criteria:

  • Working towards a degree at University in either Electronics & Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, Industrial Engineering or equivalent
  • Due to graduate in 2024 and available to enroll in this program from July 2024 onwards
  • Passionate on topics related to problem solving, technology and innovation
  • Strong communication skills, proactive and able to work well in a collaborative environment
  • Positive energy with a committed and enthusiastic can-do attitude

Have we piqued your interest?

If the above describes you, then please send your applications online quoting "ETP". We look forward to your application!

companyInfo/companyDescription:
La Société générale est une des principales banques françaises et une des plus anciennes. 

Les trois piliers de Société générale, au cœur du développement du modèle de banque relationnelle, sont :

Les réseaux de détail en France (Société générale, Crédit du Nord et Boursorama)
Les réseaux de détail à l'international (BHFM)
La banque de financement et d’investissement (SG CIB) qui gère d’un côté la Banque de financement et les Fixed Income, le financement structuré, la dette, le forex, et de l'autre côté les Equity et les activités de conseil.

En soutien au développement de ses trois piliers, les deux autres lignes métiers du Groupe sont :

Services Financiers Spécialisés & Assurances
Banque Privée, Gestion d’actifs et Services aux investisseurs
description:
Responsibilities 
     
     
      
       Exchange incentive program paperwork submission for clients and tasks automations 
       White Space analysis (Sales Research), pipeline / opportunities development: shortlist new prospects from client lists (received from event organizer, industry portals,) identify new client segments, for example Family Office study. 
       Organizing our Sales database into centralized location and maintain it. 
       Analyzing Coalition Data against some of the Prospects we are interested in targeting. 
       Running gap analysis across all market activities, for existing EQD client execution with potential Prime opportunities, clients who use our SG analytical tools, come up with a list who may benefit for us to target. 
       Ensures all trades are booked and allocated to client accounts. 
       Manage trade related breaks, client reporting, margin requirements and reporting. 
       Manage client requests and escalate accordingly. 
       Assist in client onboarding operationally including portfolio setup, KYC document collection, reporting configuration, trade confirmations and margin requirements. 
       Work closely with other teams (Traders, Sales, Middle & Back Office, IT) to ensure a seamless client experience. 
       Improve and help with monitoring of Algos. 
      
     
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Profile required 
     
     
      ACADEMIC BACKGROUND AND CERTIFICATIONS, EXPERIENCE
       
       Bachelor’s degree in related field or above; 
       Fresh graduates / graduates with less than 1 year of experience welcome to apply; 
       Fluency in Mandarin would be a plus 
      
      OPERATIONAL SKILLS
       
       Show willingness to understand global markets and increase technical skills and knowledge with a focus on Asian equities 
       Technical skills for Equity Derivatives – options, greeks knowledge, Delta One Swaps 
       Technical skills for Excel / Data, light coding (VBA / python) knowledge a plus 
       Sales & Marketing skills, client-oriented 
       Can interact, communicate and work well with team members and other desks / divisions (Trading, Strategy & Engineering) 
      
      BEHAVIORAL SKILLS
       Strong team spirit, consistently embodied by a helpful, inclusive, and respectful behavior in interacting with our internal and external partners.
       
       Behavioral competencies in terms of compliance, risk management and regulations. 
       Showcase learning ability to train on products, systems and front to back processes. 
       Responsible, efficient, and reasonable approach to all parts of the business. 
       Flawless respect of our Code of Conduct and Ethical guidelines. 
      
      We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidate will be notified. 
     
     Business insight 
     
     
      Company Description
       Societe Generale is one of the leading European financial services groups. Based on a diversified and integrated banking model, the Group combines financial strength and proven expertise in innovation with a strategy of sustainable growth. Committed to the positive transformations of the world’s societies and economies, Societe Generale seeks to build together with its clients, a better and sustainable future through responsible and innovative financial solutions. Active in the real economy for over 150 years, with a solid position in Europe and connected to the rest of the world, Societe Generale has over 117,000 employees in 66 countries and supports 25 million individual clients, businesses and institutional investors worldwide (figures as of August 2023). We have a presence in 11 locations across Asia Pacific. With our regional headquarters in Hong Kong – a core hub of the worldwide Societe Generale Group – we employ around 2,300 employees in the region. In addition, Societe Generale's Global Solution Centre (SGGSC) in Bangalore and Chennai supports the Group in Asia Pacific and globally with customised business solutions.
       For more information, follow us on LinkedIn @Société Générale or visit our website www.societegenerale.asia. 
     
    
   
  
 
 
 
  
   
    
     
      We are an equal opportunities employer and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. Societe Generale is committed to recognizing and promoting all talents, regardless of their beliefs, age, disability, parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, membership of a political, religious, trade union or minority organisation, or any other characteristic that could be subject to discrimination. 
     
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Reference: 240004TA 
    
    
     Entity: Societe Generale Singapore Branch 
    
    
     Starting date: 2024/03/20 
    
    
     Publication date: 2024/02/20

description:
The Cognizant Graduate Program 
 Cognizant Life Science Manufacturing Group (also known as Zenith Technologies) is a world leader in delivering digital transformation solutions for the Life Sciences industry. Through our knowledge and expertise in Digital, Manufacturing execution system s & process automation, we are focused on optimizing the performance of manufacturing enterprises via innovative technologies, whilst maintaining compliance. Our specialist engineering teams have the aptitude to deliver and support Pharma 4.0 architectures and solutions covering all IT, OT and IoT applications, infrastructures, and services. 
 Cognizant's culture is highly collaborative, with associates working together on cross-functional or cross-business projects across the world. Cognizant's graduate training program prepares aspiring, capable and qualified individuals to work and thrive in a rapidly changing, technology-driven world. 
 Delivered by a team committed to developing leaders of tomorrow, our graduate training program equips you with the skills sought by industry leaders so that you can take our clients' businesses forward. The ability to navigate a dynamic environment, being people-oriented, and having a passion for technology and learning are key factors for success. 
 Role Description 
 
  Each trainee will be trained and mentored in one or more of the following areas: 
  Be part of a multidisciplinary team to deliver large projects to the required technical & industry standard. 
  Design, Implementation, Interfacing, testing & qualification in the Life Sciences sector 
  Manufacturing technologies: SCADA, DCS, PLC, Instrumentation, DeltaV, Machine Vision and MES 
  Minimum Entry Requirements 
  Fresh Professionals with a Degree in Chemical and BioPharma/ Biotech Engineering, Pharmaceutical, Electronic & Electrical Engineering, Automation and Process Control, Instrumentation and Control or similar disciplines 
  Interest in Automation and the Pharmaceutical Industry 
  Team player with strong communication and interpersonal skills. 
  Self-motivator with a positive attitude and eager to make a difference 
  
 Sounds like something you might be interested in? Get in touch. 
 Create a profile with us at https://careers.cognizant.com/studentandinterns/global/en/. For more information, please contact CampusAPAC@cognizant.com 
 At Cognizant, we are improving people’s lives and helping them work more efficiently using technology. Continuous application of our digital knowledge – guided by human inspiration and commitment – creates, grows and sustains opportunities for those whose lives we touch. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for digital, you could be part of the next great wave of change in business. To find out more, please visit careers.cognizant.com.

description:
Note: Applicants with immediate availability preferred. Applicants only available during summer are welcome to apply. 
 
  
 About JobTech 
 JobTech is the world's leading artificial intelligence and big labour data analytics product company that empowers leaders to develop people for new work realities, driven by real labour market needs and individuals' personal aspirations. JobTech is growing rapidly with global big names customers from both private and public sectors. 
 
  
 About the Team 
 The JobTech team is an enthusiastic bunch, obsessed with solving human capital business problems in talent development, using deep technology and labour market data. We embrace empowerment and appreciate the depth of every member’s area of expertise. We are hands-on dreamers who are willing to invest in projects and people. If you think you should be part of this awesome team looking to scale faster and better, don’t be shy and let us know! 
 
  
 Responsibilities 
 
  Assist with market research, competitor analysis, and industry trends to support business decision-making. 
  Contribute to the development of business plans, strategies, and presentations. 
  Assist in the creation and maintenance of reports, spreadsheets, and databases. 
  Support the marketing and sales teams with various tasks, including campaign analysis, lead generation, and customer research. 
  May require occasional travel to participate in on-site campaign activities. 
  Collaborate with cross-functional teams on special projects and initiatives. 
  Provide administrative support as needed, including scheduling meetings, taking notes, and managing documentation. 
 
 Requirements 
 
  Currently enrolled in a Diploma or Bachelor's in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field. A level graduates are welcome to apply. 
  Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. 
  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment. 
  Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and other business software applications. 
  Ability to multitask, prioritize tasks, and manage time efficiently. 
  Positive attitude, eagerness to learn, and willingness to take on new challenges. 
  Previous internship experience in a business-related role is a plus.

companyInfo/companyDescription: Founded in 1979, Seagate is a world leader in hard disk drives and storage solutions. From the videos, music and documents we share with friends and family on social networks, to servers that form the backbone of enterprise data centers and cloud-based computing, to desktop and notebook computers that fuel our personal productivity, Seagate products help more people store, share and protect their valuable digital content.
description:
About our group:
  
  
  
    Material Science Lab is part of the Research and Development facilities located in Shugart building to support all HDD and some non-HDD material related selection, qualification, failure analysis, etc. The function of the lab includes performing components level material, coating and adhesive selection and pro-active qualification for new products and performing failure analysis on the drives that failed different designed reliability or functional tests, etc. to help in improving the cleanliness/material/coating/adhesive robustness. In addition, perform drives failure analysis to all pre-launch and post launch (e.g., customers’ returns) drives to help in resolving and improving drives quality. 
  
 
 
 
  
   About the role - you will:
  
  
  
   
     Perform proactive components/material outgassing/extraction analysis and support drive failure analysis in terms of organic contamination related area. Investigates, develops, and improvises organic methods and techniques to resolve organic issues. 
    Develops solutions to technical problems through the application of materials science and engineering principles, theories, and concepts. Investigates and tests drives/components level for organic issues.
     Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Demonstrates good judgement in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments. This job is a fully qualified, career-oriented, journey-level position.
     Run Gas Chromatography/Mass Spectrometer (GC/MS) – Auto Thermal Desorption (ATD) involving daily machine tuning, weekly calibration, worldwide correlation, troubleshooting, and analysis using machine learning macro. Perform drives/components outgassing/chemical extraction and data analysis to provide technical advice in organic contamination related area. Applying AI or relevant automation expertise to streamline the process of automating organic analysis.
   
  
 
 
 
  
    About you:
  
  
  
   
     Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and work with multiple priorities. 
    Strong team player, collaborative approach and resourceful
     Meticulous personality, self-motivated and able to work independently.
     Strong analytical skills, able to resolve a wide range of issues in creative ways.
   
  
 
 
 
  
    Your experience includes:
  
  
  
   
     Job requires at least a degree (Bachelor or Masters) in Applied Sciences especially Chemistry, Material Science or Engineering field. Preferable with relevant Gas Chromatography/Mass Spectrometer (GC/MS) experience (i.e., operation, troubleshooting & analysis).
     Experience in Fourier Transform Infra-Red Spectrometer (FTIR) and Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM) / Energy Dispersive X-ray (EDX) analysis will be an advantage.
   
  
 
 
 
  
    Location:
  
  
  
    The Shugart site (named after Seagate’s founder, Al Shugart) is a research and design center. Easily accessible from the One-North MRT Station, many employees choose to take mass transportation to work. Being a purpose-built building, The Shugart has excellent employee recreational facilities. Take an active break at our badminton courts, table tennis tables, in-house gym, and recreation rooms. Our yoga and Zumba classes are very popular. We also offer classes and interest groups in photography, gardening, and foreign languages, and have various on-site celebrations, and community volunteer opportunities.
   
    Location: Shugart, Singapore Travel: None

companyInfo/companyDescription:
IATA signifie International Air Transport Association (Association Internationale du Transport Aérien, en français).

C’est une association qui regroupe la majorité des compagnies aériennes du monde, soit près de 240 compagnies aériennes membres.

Elle rassemble ainsi les principales compagnies aériennes de transport de passagers et de fret du monde, qui représentent 84% du trafic aérien mondial.
descriptionHTML:
Employment Type: Internship
Contract Duration: 6 Months

At IATA, we speak for the airlines of the world, serving and supporting over 300 of them across all continents. We are passionate and knowledgeable about the aviation industry, and we strive to make it safer, smarter, more sustainable and more inclusive. We celebrate diversity and inclusion in our workforce, and we respect and value the different backgrounds, perspectives and skills of our employees. We also care about our employees’ wellbeing, and we provide flexible work arrangements, travel benefits, family-friendly policies, equal pay and a day off on your birthday. We believe in giving back to the community and encourage our staff to participate in volunteering activities that support causes they care about. We encourage you to join our global community of aviation enthusiasts, and we will do our best to make you feel comfortable during the interview process. IATA is more than a trade association; it is a vision of a better future for air travel.

About the team you are joining

You will report to the Head, Corporate Communications, and support the roll-out of communications activities of the IATA Corporate Communications Team.

What your day would be like

  • Media relations;
  • Internal communications;
  • Social media;
  • Video production;
  • Visual communications;
  • Events.

We would love to hear from you if

  • You have excellent communication and analytical skills;
  • Experience in video production/editing (Adobe Premiere Pro / Adobe After Effects / Final Cut Pro / Apple Motion), visual communications (Adobe Photoshop / Illustrator) would be an asset;
  • Be an effective team player in a multicultural working environment;
  • Excellent PC skills, particularly with MS Office Programs (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook) and MS Project; and Proficient in English. Knowledge of any other language would be an asset.
  • Come join us if you are a recent graduate in Communications or a related field of study!

Travel Required: N

Learn more about IATA’s role in the industry, our benefits, and the team at iata/careers/. We are looking forward to hearing from you!

description:
A fast-expanding Cyber Security firm with ongoing high-profile projects across Singapore and Southeast Asia is seeking for Graduates or Junior Engineers with strong potential to join the growing specialist teams. 
 Comprehensive Cyber Security training will be provided to bring Graduate level or Junior level engineers up to speed. There will be a both an investment in desk training and on-the-job training. 
 The Opportunity 
 This will be an excellent opportunity for those who are about to graduate or have graduated and are seeking their steps into the Cyber Security world. Through this training program and Cyber Security firm, you will have the chance to develop and improving your skills. 
 What we are seeking for: 
 
  A degree related to Cyber Security, Information Security, Computer Science or similar 
  Certifications relating to Cyber Security training is an advantage (not required) 
  Internship experience or part time or any work experience relating to IT Security or Cybersecurity (advantageous) 
  General knowledge of the Cyber Security industry, trends, updates, news, interests 
  Good grasp of basic concepts of Cyber Security solutions (i.e. SIEM, UEBA, SOAR, Endpoint, DLP, Threat Analysis, ML/AI, Firewall, IPS and any other types of security) 
  Showing a strong initiative, motivation, and drive towards learning Cyber Security 
  Ability to communicate well, hold a discussion, ability to speak up and confidently 
  Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills and a passion for information/Cyber security 
 
 What Is On Offer: 
 
  Permanent position 
  Comprehensive training provided to graduates and juniors 
  Expansion plans and opportunities for further progression 
  Competitive remuneration and benefits 
  Excellent Cyber Security exposure on major public and private projects 
 
 What’s Next: 
 If you are interested to join this Cyber Security firm and to be an integral part of their growth across South East Asia region then we would like to hear from you. 
 Full support and training will be provided to meet your career objectives. 
 Please reply directly to this posting with your CV or send us your details to application@engagegroup.com.sg 
 We apologise that due to the high volume of applicants we may be unable to respond to everyone. Should you not hear from us, please assume your application was unsuccessful for this time round and good luck for the next.

description:
Are You Ready for a Thrilling Professional Journey?
Do you want a workspace that continually fosters personal growth, a vibrant culture that fuels your motivation, and opportunities that align with your accomplishments?
Here, our mission is to deliver top-tier sales solutions to our esteemed clients.
As we set our sights on expansion, we're in search of individuals who bring a passion for exceptional customer service, a zest for life, and strong teamwork.
Boredom is not on our agenda! Your daily adventure includes:

 Sales and Marketing coaching on clients' products and services
 Engaging personal development and skill enhancement workshops
 Delivering sales and marketing solutions through the power of face-to-face interactions
 Championing brand awareness on behalf of our clients and driving customer acquisition
 Managing campaigns and territories with finesse

We're on the lookout for those who:

 Yearn for a platform to unearth their true potential
 Seek a role where each day presents excitement and challenges
 Have unwavering belief in their capacity to thrive in a performance-driven environment

Ready to uncover more? Apply now and embark on your journey with us!
Job Types: Full-time, Fresh graduate, Student job
Salary: $2,500.00 - $3,500.00 per month
Benefits:

 Gym membership
 Professional development

Schedule:

 Day shift
 Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

 Performance bonus
 Signing bonus

Work Location: In person

companyInfo/companyDescription:
What makes Save the Children exceptional? We’re passionately committed to one goal: Giving all children the best chance for the future they deserve – a healthy start in life, the opportunity to learn and protection from harm. Every day and in times of crisis. Here in the U.S. and around the world. Whatever it takes. In fact, we’ve been the world’s leading charity for children for 100 years. 

Don’t take our word for it… Charity watch groups give us top ratings for achieving incredible results for children – with proven efficiency, effectiveness and accountability. Independent of any government or religious affiliations. 

But we can't do it without you!
description:
The Opportunity 
 Save the Children is the world’s leading independent organization for children, working in 117 countries with more than 25,000 staff. In April 2020, Save the Children launched the Center for Utilizing Behavioral Insights for Children (CUBIC) in Asia. CUBIC is the first “nudge unit” in the world to focus specifically on the most marginalized children’s rights and welfare. Our goal is to apply behavioral science in order to reach more children and have an even greater impact on their lives. 
 Projects 
 CUBIC is currently seeking a Master’s (or Ph. D.) level intern(s) to support its projects during the summer of 2024, including, but not restricted to: 
 
  
   Reducing children’s engagement in hazardous work in Cote d’Ivoire. 
  
  
   Increasing childhood and pregnant women vaccination in the Philippines. 
  
  
   Enhancing code of ethics actions in the United States. 
  
  
   Increasing student retention in El Salvador. 
  
  
   Improving humanitarian targeting in Sri Lanka. 
  
  
   Reducing child marriage and teenage pregnancy in Zambia and in the Philippines. 
  
  
   Increasing safeguarding reporting in Ukraine. 
  
  
   Ensuring girls attendprimary education in Afghanistan. 
  
  
   Supporting activism among girls in China, Indonesia, Mexico and Vietnam. 
  
  
   Increasing reporting of children’s sexual abuse in Spain. 
  
  
   Various capacity-building initiatives. 
  
  
   Improving time management skills and prioritization of tasks among SCI's leadership. 
  
 
 Internship Objectives 
 The intern will be integrated into the 12-person CUBIC team and will have the opportunity to get involved in multiple projects – the expectation for the intern is that s/he would primarily contribute to: 
 
  Desk Review 
 
 
  
   Conducting desk research that includes literature reviews, data availability, and project documentation on behavioral issues/previous evidence on specific topics etc. 
  
  
   Conducting stakeholder/policy mapping. 
  
  
   Providing help with Institutional Review Board (IRB) or Ethical Committee (EC) submissions. 
  
 
 
  Data analysis 
 
 
  
   Conducting statistical analysis of existing surveys, census, other available datasets and impact evaluations (experience with STATA highly preferred; experience with SPSS and R programming is a plus). 
  
  
   Coding and analyzing qualitative data. 
  
  
   Presentation of data in compelling and comprehensible ways. 
  
 
 
  Analytical work 
 
 
  
   Supporting the preparation of presentations at every stage of the project. 
  
  
   Supporting the design of experiments (DOE). 
  
  
   Drafting and/or editing project briefs, reports, and case studies. 
  
  
   Drafting academic papers for journal submission, where results are suitable for publication. 
  
  
   Assisting with behavioral design training sessions and capacity building initiatives. 
  
  
   Other tasks as per the intern’s time and interest and needs of CUBIC. 
  
 
 Skills Required 
 
  Must be enrolled in/or a recent graduate of a Master’s program in Social Psychology, Sociology, Economics, Behavioral Economics, Behavioral Science, Public Policy, Anthropology or a related field. 
  Candidates fluent in Spanish and/or French, in addition to English are encouraged to apply. 
  Strong qualitative or mixed methods skills for social research (experience working with data analysis software such as NVivo, ATLAS.ti or similar). 
  Strong quantitative, research, and data analytic skills (experience working with data analysis software such as STATA, R or Python). 
  Strong understanding of Behavioral Science concepts and methodologies. 
  Basic understanding of Randomized Controlled Trials (RCTs). 
  Strong management, organizational, and interpersonal skills. 
  Excellent English communication and writing skills, and ability to present data and analysis in compelling and understandable formats. 
 
 Time Requirements 
 Full time internship – graduate students between their first and second year at university who would be able to dedicate 35 hours a week to the team for a minimum of 10-12 weeks between May and September 2024. 
 Part time internship – we also encourage candidates to apply on a part-time basis to dedicate 10-12h a week for 9 consecutive months. 
 There is a strong possibility of extending the internship if both sides agree for a period of 9 months on a part-time basis. 
 Supervisor 
 CUBIC’s Head of Behavioral Science Research and other team members. 
 Conditions 
 The Intern would be engaged on a voluntary basis and would sign a volunteer contract with Save the Children. The working schedule would be determined by the intern; however, attendance during regular calls with our country partner teams would be important. 
 Location 
 Remote – Our preference is for the intern to be based in Asia, Africa, the Middle East or Eastern Europe, between UTC and UTC + 8 time zones, due to meeting scheduling requirements. However, all locations will be considered. 
 The Organisation 
 We employ approximately 25,000 people across the globe and work on the ground in over 100 countries to help children affected by crises, or those that need better healthcare, education and child protection. We also campaign and advocate at the highest levels to realise the right of children and to ensure their voices are heard. 
 We are working towards three breakthroughs in how the world treats children by 2030: 
 
  No child dies from preventable causes before their 5th birthday 
  All children learn from a quality basic education and that, 
  Violence against children is no longer tolerated 
 
 We know that great people make a great organization, and that our employees play a crucial role in helping us achieve our ambitions for children. We value our people and offer a meaningful and rewarding career, along with a collaborative and inclusive workplace where ambition, creativity, and integrity are highly valued. 
 Application Information 
 To apply to this opportunity, please click on the below link to complete a short survey by Sunday, March 17th (Please note that you will be asked at the end of the survey to submit your CV in pdf format). 
 CUBIC 2024 Internship Application 
 Please contact Indrajeet Ghatge ( Indrajeet.ghatge@savethechildren.org ) if you are not able to access the survey link. 
 A copy of the full role profile can be found at www.savethechildren.net/careers 
  Closing Date for Application: 17 March 2024 
 We need to keep children safe so our selection process, which includes rigorous background checks, reflects our commitment to the protection of children from abuse. 
 
 All employees are expected to carry out their duties in accordance with our global anti-harassment policy.
 


 
  The Organization 
   We employ approximately 25,000 people across the globe and work on the ground in over 100 countries to help children affected by crises, or those that need better healthcare, education and child protection. We also campaign and advocate at the highest levels to realise the right of children and to ensure their voices are heard. We are working towards three breakthroughs in how the world treats children by 2030: 
   
   
  
   No child dies from preventable causes before their 5th birthday 
   All children learn from a quality basic education and that, 
   Violence against children is no longer tolerated 
  
   We know that great people make a great organization, and that our employees play a crucial role in helping us achieve our ambitions for children.We value our people and offer a meaningful and rewarding career, along with a collaborative and inclusive workplace where ambition, creativity, and integrity are highly valued. 
   
   Application Information: 
   Please apply using a cover letter and up-to-date CV as a single document. Please also include details of your current remuneration and salary expectations. A copy of the full role profile can be found at www.savethechildren.net/jobs We need to keep children safe so our selection process reflects our commitment to the protection of children from abuse.

The Intern would be engaged on a voluntary basis and would sign a volunteer contract with Save the Children. The working schedule would be determined by the intern; however, attendance during regular calls with our country partner teams would be important.

Location

Remote – Our preference is for the intern to be based in Asia, Africa, the Middle East or Eastern Europe, between UTC and UTC + 8 time zones, due to meeting scheduling requirements. However, all locations will be considered.

The Organisation

We employ approximately 25,000 people across the globe and work on the ground in over 100 countries to help children affected by crises, or those that need better healthcare, education and child protection. We also campaign and advocate at the highest levels to realise the right of children and to ensure their voices are heard.

We are working towards three breakthroughs in how the world treats children by 2030:

  • No child dies from preventable causes before their 5th birthday
  • All children learn from a quality basic education and that,
  • Violence against children is no longer tolerated

We know that great people make a great organization, and that our employees play a crucial role in helping us achieve our ambitions for children. We value our people and offer a meaningful and rewarding career, along with a collaborative and inclusive workplace where ambition, creativity, and integrity are highly valued.

Application Information

To apply to this opportunity, please click on the below link to complete a short survey by Sunday, March 17th (Please note that you will be asked at the end of the survey to submit your CV in pdf format).

CUBIC 2024 Internship Application

Please contact Indrajeet Ghatge ( Indrajeet.ghatge@savethechildren.org ) if you are not able to access the survey link.

A copy of the full role profile can be found at www.savethechildren.net/careers


Closing Date for Application: 17 March 2024

We need to keep children safe so our selection process, which includes rigorous background checks, reflects our commitment to the protection of children from abuse.

All employees are expected to carry out their duties in accordance with our global anti-harassment policy.


The Organization
We employ approximately 25,000 people across the globe and work on the ground in over 100 countries to help children affected by crises, or those that need better healthcare, education and child protection. We also campaign and advocate at the highest levels to realise the right of children and to ensure their voices are heard. We are working towards three breakthroughs in how the world treats children by 2030:

  • No child dies from preventable causes before their 5th birthday
  • All children learn from a quality basic education and that,
  • Violence against children is no longer tolerated

We know that great people make a great organization, and that our employees play a crucial role in helping us achieve our ambitions for children.We value our people and offer a meaningful and rewarding career, along with a collaborative and inclusive workplace where ambition, creativity, and integrity are highly valued.

Application Information:
Please apply using a cover letter and up-to-date CV as a single document. Please also include details of your current remuneration and salary expectations. A copy of the full role profile can be found at www.savethechildren.net/jobs We need to keep children safe so our selection process reflects our commitment to the protection of children from abuse.

description:
Established in 1995, AAL is a leading global breakbulk and heavy lift project cargo operator. Our customers represent dynamic industries like energy, oil & gas, mining, forestry, leisure, agriculture, and construction – and our vision is to be the best at what we do and to create sustainable growth and an unparalleled reputation, built on trust and service.
  
 We are seeking an enthusiastic and driven individual to join our dynamic team as Shipping Trainee. This is a remarkable opportunity for fresh graduates to kick-start their career in the shipping industry. As a Shipping Trainee with AAL, you will receive comprehensive training in various areas, empowering you to excel in this exciting field.
 
  Key Responsibilities:
  Over the 18-month traineeship, the objective is for the trainee to develop a comprehensive understanding of AAL's services and clients. Focusing on building comprehensive, interdisciplinary knowledge of each department's responsibility, including Chartering, Operations, Finance, QHSE, and Engineering.
 
   Participate in on-the-job training and rotational assignments in different departments.
   Collaborate with team members to support day-to-day operations.
   Assist in the development and implementation of strategic initiatives.
   Engage in continuous learning and development opportunities.
 
 
  What We Offer:
 
   Extensive training in all aspects of MPP shipping services to equip you with essential skills.
   Mentorship from experienced professionals who will guide you throughout your learning journey.
   Opportunities to work in an international team, fostering cultural diversity and global collaboration.
   Exposure to a globally operating company, providing insights into the shipping industry's vital role in international trade.
   Working from an overseas office.
   Continuous learning and development opportunities to support your professional growth.
 
 
  Qualifications:
 
   Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Maritime Studies, Logistics, International trade, Shipping related engineering fields etc.).
   Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
   Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.
   Eagerness to learn and grow within the shipping industry.
   Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
 
 
  Join our team and embark on a rewarding career in the shipping industry as a Trainee. Make a significant impact in the global trade landscape, working with a diverse and dedicated team. Apply now and take the first step towards an exciting future!

description:
Company
   
  
   EssilorLuxottica Asia Pacific Pte Ltd
   
     essilor.com
   
   
 
 
  
   Designation
   
  
   Regional Business Planning & Analytics Intern
   
 
 
  
   Date Listed
   
  
   22 Feb 2024
   
 
 
  
   Job Type
   
  
   Entry Level / Junior Executive
   
     Intern/TS
   
   
 
 
  
   Job Period
   
  
   From Jul 2024, For At Least 5 Months
   
 
 
  
   Profession
   
  
   Consulting
   
 
 
  
   Industry
   
  
   Wholesale Trade
   
 
 
  
   Location Name
   
  
   Temasek Avenue, Millenia Tower, Singapore
   
 
 
  
   Address
   
  
   1 Temasek Ave, Singapore 039192
   
 
 
  
   Map
   
 
 
 
  
   Allowance / Remuneration
   
  
   $1,400 - 1,500 monthly 
  
 
 
 
  
   Company Profile
   
  
   WHO WE ARE
    We are EssilorLuxottica, a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of ophthalmic lenses, frames and sunglasses. The Company brings together the complementary expertise of two industry pioneers, one in advanced lens technologies and the other in the craftsmanship of iconic eyewear, to create a vertically integrated business that is uniquely positioned to address the world’s evolving vision needs and the global demand of a growing eyewear industry.
   
    With over 180,000 dedicated employees in 150 countries driving our iconic brands, our people are creative, entrepreneurial and celebrated for their unique perspectives and individuality. Committed to vision, we enable people to “see more and be more” thanks to our innovative designs and lens technologies, exceptional quality and cutting-edge processing methods. Every day we impact the lives of millions by changing the way people see the world. 
  
 
 
  
   Job Description
   
  
   JOB SCOPE AND MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
    Mission of the Position: The mission is to support the Business Planning and Analysis team in their data analysis efforts and contribute to data-driven decision-making within the organization. This role plays an important part in collecting, processing, and interpreting data to provide valuable insights that will help drive business growth and efficiency.
   
     Essential Expected Results: Data Integrity and Quality Assurance: Ensure data accuracy, reliability, and consistency by implementing effective data quality assurance processes.
     Reporting and Visualization: Support in maintaining current reporting structure providing timeliness. Prepare comprehensive reports and visualizations that communicate analytical findings in a clear and concise manner to stakeholders and management.
     Support Business Planning and Analysis Team: Assist the Business Analysts in ad-hoc analysis and modeling as required to address specific business challenges and in daily processes and communication exchange to support day-to-day activities;
   
    Challenges of the Job:
   
     Data Complexity: Dealing with vast amounts of data from multiple sources, structured or semi-structured / EssilorLuxottica and others, can be very challenging. The candidate must be adept at handling and organizing data effectively.
     Time Management: Balancing multiple tasks and deadlines requires good time management skills to ensure timely and accurate delivery of analytical outputs.
   
    Main Success Factors:
   
     Analytical Skills: Strong analytical abilities are essential to collect, interpret, and draw insights from data sets.
     Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools (e.g. Excel, Power Point, Outlook) and inclination to learn other data analysis tools, databases, and spreadsheet software is critical to achieve the best results on the role.
     Communication Skills: Clear and concise communication is vital to present findings to stakeholders and contribute to data-driven discussions.
   
   
    AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITIES AND RELATED ACTIVITIES:
   
     Analytics and Forecasting: Support the team with business performances’ actuals and forecast analysis, reporting and presentation for SEA + Korea region, with a weekly/monthly/quarterly frequency, identifying key sales growth elements using existing key performance indicators, with the space of proposing new ones;
     Business Reporting: Maintain and develop standard team reports, and contribute to support the team in reviewing them according to the new business needs;
     Cross team collaboration: Support the regional stakeholders from various functions for ad-hoc projects and activities with data-driven information and contribution;
   
   
    KEY REQUIREMENTS:
   
     Recently graduated / currently studying with accredited and recognized universities in the region with STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) background;
     Strong analytical mindset and problem-solving attitude;
     Proven ability on Microsoft Office main tools (e.g. Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook) for basic analytical usage, and strong passion to improve;
     Any other database or data tools (e.g. Power Query, Access) are highly appreciated;
     Proficiency in English language communication, both written and spoken;
     Proactivity and positive attitude to adapt to fast-changing environments; Good organization and priority setting inclination.
   
    We are seeking for full time intern who can commit from May to Aug/ Jul to Dec, the longer availability would be preferred due to business complexity. Should you wish to apply, kindly indicate your available for full time internship in the resume and advice if it's a credit bearing / non credit bearing internship. Thank you. 
  
 
 
  
   Application Instructions
   
  
   Please apply for this position by submitting your text CV using InternSG.
    Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Summary 
  Salary
  S$4,000 - S$4,000 / Monthly 
  
  Job Type
  
  
  Seniority
  
 
  Junior 
 
  Years of Experience
  At least 0 years 
  
  Tech Stacks
  Java SQL
 


 Job Description 
  
 
  
   Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem. 
    Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next. 
    The Infosys Company Led Training (CLT) is a program in partnership with TeSA, driven by IMDA. 
    CLT is a structured development program that aims to enable fresh graduates to acquire specialist, expert or mastery-level competencies for jobs in demand by the industry, especially those that support Digital Economy. 
    If your passion is to build solutions that really make a difference to enterprises, the community and your world, Infosys is the right place for you. 
   
    Selected candidate (Singaporean) will be offered a full-time position with training provided + Joining Bonus.
    
    Roles and Responsibilities: 
    
    Requirements Gathering 
    Design 
    Architecture 
    Development 
    Testing 
    Implementation 
    Warranty 
    Transition 
    Production Support 
    Maintenance 
    Knowledge Management 
    
   Skills /Competencies: 
    
    Essential: Degree in computer sciences or related. 
    0-3 years of working experience. 
    Must be a Singapore Citizen 
    Preferred Java programming with SQL database experience. 
    
   Additional Skills: 
    
    Be able to think logically and a team player. 
    Good analytical abilities 
    Strong written and verbal communication skills. 
    Attention to detail, good analytical and problem-solving skills

    • Attention to detail, good analytical and problem-solving skills

companyInfo/companyDescription: Emerson is a diversified global manufacturing and technology company. It offers a wide range of products and services in the areas of network power, process management, industrial automation, and tools and storage businesses. Recognized widely for its engineering capabilities and management excellence, Emerson has over 66,000 employees and 130 manufacturing locations worldwide.
description:
Job Summary 
 If you are a Sales Operations professional looking for an opportunity to grow, Emerson has an exciting opportunity for you! Based in our Singapore location, you will be responsible for driving and optimizing our sales processes and strategies to ensure maximum efficiency and effectiveness in achieving sales targets. Your key responsibilities will include leading all aspects of sales data analysis, forecasting, and pipeline management, as well as implementing and maintaining sales automation tools and CRM systems. Additionally, you will play a vital role in coordinating cross-functional teams, finding opportunities for process improvements, and providing actionable insights to the sales leadership team. Your dedication and expertise will be meaningful in supporting the sales team and driving the overall success of our organization. 
 In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be: 
 
  Effectively manage the lead process from lead to PO including all vital supporting systems and strategies. 
  Build tools and datasets which can be used to monitor and optimize the sales pipeline, ensuring accurate forecasting and timely deal closures. 
  Analyze sales data and metrics to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement throughout the sales pipeline. 
  Partner with sales enablement teams and align with sales leaders to develop and implement outreach and conversion strategies that achieve customer acquisition and retention goals. 
  Participate in Asia Pacific teams as a key focal point for sales operations, defining and tracking progress throughout program life cycles. 
  Work and collaborate across sales, marketing, sales enablement and product management functions to build pipeline, effectivity and engagement metrics which help prioritize investment and resources. 
  Align and deliver sales persona user scenarios against key toolsets 
  Stay updated on industry trends, competitor activities, and emerging sales technologies to drive innovation and maintain a competitive edge. 
 
 Who You Are: 
 You work through formal and informal channels to build broad-based relationships and support. You adjust communication content and style to meet the needs of diverse partners. You make significant progress and remain calm and composed, even when things are uncertain. You focus efforts on continuous improvement; have a curiosity about for identifying and seizing opportunities for alignment and integration. You formulate a clear strategy and maps the aggressive steps that will clearly accelerate the organization toward its strategic goals. 
 For This Role, You Will Need: 
 
  Bachelor's Degree or equivalent in Business, Marketing, or any related field. 
  Proven experience in Sales Operations or a similar role, preferably with a focus on customer acquisition and retention. 
  Excellent understanding of sales processes, methodologies, and CRM systems. 
  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. 
  Proficiency in using sales analytics tools, CRM systems, and Microsoft Office Suite. 
  Knowledge of the industry, market trends, and competitive landscape. 
  Ability to travel up to 20% of the time, sometimes internationally 
 
 Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart: 
 
  MBA or other higher level education preferred 
  Proven success in a sales function 
 
 Our Offer to You: 
 By joining Emerson, you will be allowed to make a difference through the work you do. 
 Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets. We also offer comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees. 
 We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, and equity and embraces inclusion. We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship. 
 We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential. We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company. 
 We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work setup where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office. 
 Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities. 
 Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent. 
 Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion 
 At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers. 
 This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson . 
 If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .
 


 WHY EMERSON 
 Our Commitment to Our People 
 At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration. 
 We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor. 
 
 At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together. 
 Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation 
 If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com . 
 
 ABOUT EMERSON 
 Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability. 
 With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety. 
 
 We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go! 
 No calls or agencies please.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Since inception in 2000, Sea Tech has built a strong reputation for reliable, highly efficient and environmentally friendly vessel designs operating globally. We take pride in building a strong bond with clients, from inception, to delivery, and beyond, by listening to their operational requirements to ensure best-customised solutions.



As a center for marine and offshore excellence, SeaTech covers the complete set of design, engineering and consulting disciplines in-house. Clients receive high quality services at cost-effective rates due to our multi-talented team using the latest modern technology.



Embracing Singapore’s “Can Do” spirit, we reach out globally but deliver locally, through regional offices in Singapore, China, India, Myanmar, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Malaysia, Korea, Australia, Germany.
description:
JobScope 
 
  Capable to produce P&ID, E/R arrangement, Shafting drawings 
 
 
  Familiar with IMO, Class rules & regulation and industrial standard. 
 
 
  Familiar with marine system and equipment 
 
 
  Experience in marine vessel P&ID system design, equipment sizing and arrangement, propulsion and power generation. 
 
 
  
 Requirement 
 
  Diploma/Degree in Naval Architecture, Marine Engineering, or relevant courses 
 
 
  Preferably with 3 to 4 years Mechanical Field related to shipbuilding. Fresh graduate may apply and 6-months OJT will be provided. 
 
 
  Able to do calculations, develop ship piping system, Engine Room Layouts, HVAC, Shafting, etc 
 
 
  Advanced level skills in drafting and MS. Office (Excel & PPT) 
 
 
  Possess good interpersonal and communication skills 
 
 
  Able to multi-task and able to work in a fast-paced environment 
 
 · Applicants without prior experience are also welcomed to apply 
 
  
  
 *We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.*

What you can expect: 
 
  Comprehensive rotations: 2-year program with at least 3 different rotations across product design and development functions, such as Design, Art Direction and Category Management teams 
  International assignments and learning trips to build your market exposure and global working experience

  Entrepreneurial spirit

description:
33 Auction is excited to announce the launch of a dedicated Luxury Department. We are seeking highly skilled and passionate individuals to join our team as Senior and Junior Jewellery Specialists . Fully incorporated and registered in Singapore since 2009 with presence in Jakarta and Beijing, 33 Auction is an established auction house renowned for its expertise in Modern and Contemporary Asian Art. As pioneers of a new category, you will have the opportunity to actively curate and promote this segment of auctions and selling exhibitions. 
 Responsibilities: 
 Valuation and Authentication: 
 
  Conduct thorough research and authentication of jewellery pieces, including gemstones, diamonds, and precious metals. 
 
 
  Stay updated on industry trends, market fluctuations, and regulatory changes related to jewellery, providing insights and recommendations to the management team. 
 
 
  
 Consignment Getting and Client Engagement: 
 
  Develop and execute strategies to sell and acquire high-quality jewellery consignments for auction. 
 
 
  Provide expert guidance and support to clients, including collectors, investors, and sellers, on jewellery valuation, acquisition, and investment opportunities. 
 
 
  Collaborate with marketing and PR teams to promote jewellery auctions and engage with potential clients through various channels, including events, exhibitions, and digital platforms. 
 
 
  
 Cataloguing and Auction Support: 
 
  Lead the cataloging process, ensuring accurate descriptions, detailed condition reports, and high-quality imagery of jewellery items. 
 
 
  Actively participate in auction previews, auctions, and post-sale processes, including client engagement, bidding assistance, and post-sale follow-ups. 
 
 
  Mentor and train junior staff members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional development within the Jewellery Department. 
 
 Qualifications: 
 
  Degree educated or equivalent 
 
 
  GIA Graduate Gemmologist or equivalent qualifications, with multiple years of experience in the gemological field 
 
 
  Experience in the auction industry is strongly preferred and a must for the senior position. 
 
 
  Strong network and proven track record of sourcing and selling high-value jewellery pieces. 
 
 
  Compensation witll commensurate with experience. 
 
 
  Candidates will less experience will be considered for junior role. 
 
 
  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage with clients at all levels. 
 
 
  Proficiency in relevant software and database systems for cataloging and inventory management. 
 
 
  Fluent in English and Mandarin or another Asian language 
 
 
  Demonstrate a positive, creative and can-do work attitude 
 
 
  Able to work well independently and as well as in a team.

33 Auction is excited to announce the launch of a dedicated Luxury Department. We are seeking highly skilled and passionate individuals to join our team as Senior and Junior Jewellery Specialists . Fully incorporated and registered in Singapore since 2009 with presence in Jakarta and Beijing, 33 Auction is an established auction house renowned for its expertise in Modern and Contemporary Asian Art. As pioneers of a new category, you will have the opportunity to actively curate and promote this segment of auctions and selling exhibitions.

Responsibilities:

Valuation and Authentication:

  • Conduct thorough research and authentication of jewellery pieces, including gemstones, diamonds, and precious metals.

Cataloguing and Auction Support:

  • Lead the cataloging process, ensuring accurate descriptions, detailed condition reports, and high-quality imagery of jewellery items.
  • Actively participate in auction previews, auctions, and post-sale processes, including client engagement, bidding assistance, and post-sale follow-ups.
  • Mentor and train junior staff members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional development within the Jewellery Department.

Qualifications:

  • Degree educated or equivalent
  • GIA Graduate Gemmologist or equivalent qualifications, with multiple years of experience in the gemological field
  • Experience in the auction industry is strongly preferred and a must for the senior position.
  • Strong network and proven track record of sourcing and selling high-value jewellery pieces.
  • Compensation witll commensurate with experience.
  • Candidates will less experience will be considered for junior role.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage with clients at all levels.
  • Proficiency in relevant software and database systems for cataloging and inventory management.
  • Fluent in English and Mandarin or another Asian language
  • Demonstrate a positive, creative and can-do work attitude
  • Able to work well independently and as well as in a team.

description:
Your job responsibilities include but not limited to : 
 
  Creating marketing and social media campaigns and strategies, including budget planning, content ideation, creation and implementation schedules monthly (social calendar) 
  Managing Company’s social media platforms. 
  Working with management to create relevant content for the necessary platforms. 
  Creating creative content and designing social media campaigns and posts 
  Providing weekly reports on projects being worked on. 
  Aiding in growing and expands company social media presence into new social media platforms, plus increases presence on existing platforms including Tiktok, Facebook and Instagram 
  Ensures brand consistency in marketing and social media messages 
  Replying and engaging in conversations on social media platforms (Reputation Management) 
  Other ad-hoc duties required by management in relevant job scope. 
  Bonus incentive if sales team hits target. 
 
 Requirements : 
 
  Diploma in any relevant field of work (Fresh graduates welcome) 
  Basic skills in Photoshop, Illustrator and relevant softwares needed. 
  Create and innovation individual who is passionate about marketing and social media 
  Proficient in social media sites 
  Committed individual who is also able to work independently.
