companyInfo/companyDescription: Emerson is a diversified global manufacturing and technology company. It offers a wide range of products and services in the areas of network power, process management, industrial automation, and tools and storage businesses. Recognized widely for its engineering capabilities and management excellence, Emerson has over 66,000 employees and 130 manufacturing locations worldwide.
description:
Job Summary 
 If you are a Service professional looking to grow your career in Field Servicing, then Emerson has a great opportunity for you! Based in Singapore, the Senior / Flow Service Engineer will support the commissioning, troubleshooting, configuring & repairing of flowmeters and other Emerson measurement products. 
 
  In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be: 
  
   
    Provide remote and onsite support for the start-up & commissioning of critical measurement systems & products and general fault finding related to customer process issues, including site visits for data collection. 
    Perform on-site preventive maintenance and verification of flowmeters. 
    Provide technical support and presales support to Sales Team & customers. 
    To assist and support in the Service Business growth by promoting Training, Service Center Repairs, Commissioning and Maintenance Contract. 
    To complete required documentation for service activities such as field service, Commissioning and Calibration reports by required deadlines. 
    Support Factory Acceptance Test and Site Acceptance test. 
    Provide technical assistance and other duties assigned by supervisor. 
    Be able and willing to perform emergency call-out services to provide customers with fast and efficient services. 
    Execute the requested job in the best way to meet customer’s deadlines and expectations. 
    Keep workshop/workplace(s) tidy, in order and representative. 
    Ensure all in-field activities are carried out safely complying with company Environmental Health & Safety (EHS) guidelines and procedures. 
   
  
  
   Who You Are: 
  
  You quickly and decisively take action in fast-changing, unpredictable situations. You anticipate customer needs and provide services that are beyond customer expectations. You always keep the end in sight; puts in extra effort to meet targets. You adapt quickly to changing resource requirements. You facilitate an open dialogue with a wide variety of contributors and customers. 
  
   For This Role, You Will Need: 
  
  
   
    Minimum 3 years of working within a Field Service Engineer position with demonstrable experience of in the instrumentation field, particularly in site commissioning, troubleshooting and maintenance of flow products and other field instruments. 
    Experience with Flowmeters, pressure, level and temperature transmitters. 
    Fast learner and know-how attitude in resolving issues. 
    Customer orientated, self-directed and ability to multitask between various service assignments. 
    Strong knowledge on flow instruments and flow system. 
    Ability to interpret maintenance manuals, schematics, and wiring diagrams. 
    Competent in MS Office suite. 
    Good written and verbal English skills. 
    Resourceful and self-motivated with high degrees of integrity. 
    Strong analytical, problem solving, and teamwork skill required. 
   
  
  
   Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart: 
  
  
   
    Degree /Diploma in Instrumentation /Electronics /Mechatronic Engineering 
   
  
  Our Offer To You: 
  By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do. 
  Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets. We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees. 
  We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion. We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship. 
  We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential. We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company. 
  We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office. 
  Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities. 
  Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent. 
  Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion 
 
 At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers. 
 This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson . 
 If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .
 


 WHY EMERSON 
 Our Commitment to Our People 
 At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration. 
 We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor. 
 
 At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together. 
 Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation 
 If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com . 
 
 ABOUT EMERSON 
 Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability. 
 With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety. 
 
 We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go! 
 No calls or agencies please.

If you are a Service professional looking to grow your career in Field Servicing, then Emerson has a great opportunity for you! Based in Singapore, the Senior / Flow Service Engineer will support the commissioning, troubleshooting, configuring & repairing of flowmeters and other Emerson measurement products.

In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:

  • Provide remote and onsite support for the start-up & commissioning of critical measurement systems & products and general fault finding related to customer process issues, including site visits for data collection.

You quickly and decisively take action in fast-changing, unpredictable situations. You anticipate customer needs and provide services that are beyond customer expectations. You always keep the end in sight; puts in extra effort to meet targets. You adapt quickly to changing resource requirements. Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities.

Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson .

We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. description:
Job Highlights 
 
  Working with luxury and sports cars every day 
  Open friendly and fun work place 
  Uniform provided 
 
 Job Description 
 Enthusiastic Vehicle Technician required to join an independent workshop specialising in luxury and sports car brands. Would suit recent graduate or young person with a passion for the Automotive Industry. 
 Principal accountabilities 
 
  Carry out vehicle servicing, maintenance and repairs on a variety of different makes and models of cars both new and classic cars. 
  Responsible, reliable and able to work unsupervised to a high level of quality. 
 
 Knowledge, Skills and Experience: 
 A sound automotive and engineering knowledge required. Service, advanced repair and diagnosis experience is essential . 
 
  Qualified to NiTEC2 or equivalent in Motor Vehicle mechanical and Electrical systems 
  Engine Management (Petrol Engines) 
  Automotive Electrical Diagnostics and problem solving 
  Air Conditioning and Climate Control 
  Electronic and hydraulic Controlled Transmissions 
  Occupant Safety Systems 
  Electronic Stability Systems 
  Adaptive Damping Systems/Active Body Control Electronic Diagnosis 
  Fluent English with other languages an advantage (Good written and verbal communication skills in English and other different languages an advantage. 
  Confident to communicate with customers 
  Minimum 5 years’ work experience in an automotive technical role, preferably with extensive product experience with any British automotive brands. 
  Must have clean driving license. 
 
 Personal attributes / behavioral skills for position 
 
  Well presented, with professional mannerisms 
  Adaptable, quick thinking, decisive, showing strong initiative and self-determination 
  Meticulous in detail 
  Demonstrates a methodical approach. 
  Good team working habits. 
  Flexible approach to working hours.

Enthusiastic Vehicle Technician required to join an independent workshop specialising in luxury and sports car brands. Would suit recent graduate or young person with a passion for the Automotive Industry.

  • Fluent English with other languages an advantage (Good written and verbal communication skills in English and other different languages an advantage.

Company

     nytc.earth

   Address
   
  
   53 Ubi Ave 1, Singapore 408934
   
 
 
  
   Map
   
 
 
 
  
   Allowance / Remuneration
   
  
   $600 - 800 monthly 
  
 
 
 
  
   Company Profile
   
  
   NYTC International Group is an ever-expanding umbrella organization focused on supplying services throughout a large range of industries worldwide. Our range of services include: Manufacturing, Construction, Renovation, Interior Design, Acoustics, Soundproofing, Noise Control, General Design, Graphic Design & Print, Web Design, Internet Marketing, SEO, Marketing, Importing and Exporting and much, much more. 
  
 
 
  
   Job Description
  
   
  
   
     
    
     Create engaging and aesthetic content for social media, blogs, and email marketing
     Respond to inquiries and comments on social media platforms
     Develop and manage social media networks, websites, and online communities
     List and manage products on various e-commerce platforms
     Maintain accurate product information including pricing and inventory
     Handle packing and shipping of online orders
     Assist with photoshoots and pop-up booths
     Perform ad-hoc administrative tasks
     Utilize basic graphic and video editing skills for content creation
    
      Requirements:
     
    
     Minimum education: marketing-related diploma
     Relevant working experience preferred
     Knowledge in design, digital marketing, or e-commerce
     Strong communication and listening skills
     Aesthetic and clean design sensibility
     Ability to work efficiently with attention to detail
     Eagerness to learn and adapt
     Highly motivated and proactive
     Students and fresh graduates welcome
     Passion for e-commerce and digital media
    
     **Job Type:** Internship
     **Contract Length:** 3 - 6 months (possible extension)
     **Intern Job Type:** Full-time (9am - 5pm)
     **Salary:** S$ 600.00 - S$ 800.00
     
     Benefits:
     
    
     Hands-on experience in business development and strategy
     Exposure to a dynamic and collaborative work environment
     Mentorship from experienced industry professionals
    
    
  
 
 
  
   Application Instructions
   
  
   Please apply for this position by submitting your text CV using InternSG.
    Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 300 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 84,200 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Basel, Switzerland with additional offices in Europe and Asia. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.
description:
Our Singapore Office is EXPANDING and we are seeking for motivated and enthusiastic Assistant Editors to join our team!!
As an Assistant Editor, you will be responsible for helping authors and researchers worldwide publish their latest scientific research results. You will work closely with our editorial team to manage the submission and peer-review process for academic journals that is within your domain of expertise!
As an Assistant Editor you will:

 Support the editorial process for academic research journals in your domain of expertise
 Organize peer review for submitted manuscripts and coordinate editorial decisions
 Handle email communication between the parties involved in the publication process
 Collaborate with other members of the editorial team and production team
 Ensure that scholarly articles are accurately edited and published according to tight deadlines with a high degree of consistency

Requirements:

 Master’s or Ph.D. in Biology, Chemistry, Engineering, Physics, Computer Science, Materials Science, Agriculture, Medicine and Pharmacy, Ecology and Environmental Sciences.
 Strong English skills in written and spoken language.
 The ability to multi-task, attention to detail.
 Organizational and time management skills.
 Professional experience with scholarship publishing is an advantage.
 Previous editorial experience is desirable, but not required. Fresh graduates are also welcome to apply.

What we offer:

 Career Learning Development
 Attractive Incentives & Reward Schemes
 Flat Organizational Structures
 Travel Trips to the Other MDPI Offices
 Opportunities to participate in conferences worldwide.
 To Have Access to Online Training Programs & Attend the Best Scientific Conferences
 Competitive Salary, Benefits and Equity
 Personal Health Insurance (Inclusive of Medical & Dental)

If you are a recent graduate with a passion for scientific research and a desire to learn and grow in a fast-paced publishing environment, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity to join our expanding team!
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Fresh graduate
Salary: $3,600.00 - $5,000.00 per month
Benefits:

 Additional leave
 Dental insurance
 Health insurance
 Parental leave
 Professional development
 Promotion to permanent employee

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

 13th month salary
 Performance bonus
 Tips

Education:

 Bachelor's or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

 Research laboratory: 1 year (Preferred)

companyInfo/companyDescription:
ClearSK Healthcare Pte Ltd manages the award-winning ClearSK® chain of 12 medi-aesthetics clinics island-wide in Singapore and 3 overseas branches in Shanghai /Suzhou. As a Singapore leading aesthetics chain, it will be a great opportunity for you to grow and learn in a multi-disciplinary environment with medical and management professionals. You will find yourself working in a challenging environment, where your capabilities will be developed to the max.


To fit in with our culture of excellence, we look for only the F.I.T.: Fast, Innovative and Trainable as well as commitment, integrity and professional skills
description:
Job Description
Join Our Team and Shape the Future of the Medical-Aesthetics Industry!
ClearSK Healthcare, a renowned chain of medical aesthetic clinics operating in Singapore, Shanghai, Hangzhou, and Kuala Lumpur, is on the hunt for a driven and seasoned Digital Marketing Assistant Manager / Manager to become part of our dynamic team.
Job Highlights:

 Attractive remuneration package
 5-day work week
 Hybrid WFH option
 Free aesthetics treatments up to SGD6000 per annum

Responsibilities:

 Participate in a 3-month job rotation at the front desk and conversion centers of our Singapore and/or Shanghai clinics, gaining direct experience in aesthetic clinic operations and customer service, essential for a comprehensive understanding of the client-facing aspects of the business, crucial for a marketing manager role.
 Develop, manage, and optimize ads and social media content across various platforms in different languages, including Google, Facebook, Instagram, Xiao Hong Shu, and WeChat.
 Plan, execute, and manage Google SEM and SEO campaigns, including Youtube and various digital platforms, to incorporate Paid Media and Web Analytics.
 Leverage excellent communication skills to engage potential customers, turning inquiries into appointments or sales.
 Drive the implementation of omnichannel marketing strategies, enhancing customer interaction and service.
 Stay on the cutting edge by continuously learning and integrating new technologies, such as ChatGPT, into our marketing strategies.
 Work closely with in-house marketing and sales team to drive sales events, in-house marketing campaigns, and customers reviews.
 Assist in planning, organizing, and executing online sales events.
 Project manage in the development of new eshops.

Qualifications:

 Bachelor's degree in Marketing, E commerce, Business or any related field. Applications from recent graduates are highly encouraged.
 At least 2-4 years of experience in digital marketing and Google Digital Ads, SEO, and SEM, ideally in the healthcare or aesthetics industry.
 Expert in digital marketing platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Adobe Launch).
 Has general understanding of WordPress knowledge & Shopify in terms of maintenance, launch, shop construction and admin system.
 Exceptional communication skills and fluent in both Eng and Chin, able to cater to English-speaking & PRC customers.
 Experience with omnichannel marketing.
 A willingness to learn and incorporate new technologies.
 Strong organizational and time management skills to handle multiple priorities effectively.

Application process:
Should you wish to be considered for shortlisting, please complete the attached Google Form at the link below prior to submitting your application on Indeed:
https://forms.gle/hRJVt819mXFCyWXp8
Please be advised that only candidates who have completed the form and are subsequently shortlisted will be notified.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $6,000.00 - $9,000.00 per month
Supplemental pay types:

 Yearly bonus

Work Location: In person

 Attend conferences to expand professional knowledge and skills.

positionName: Junior Marketing Associate- ASAP, 1 On 1 Mentorship

description:
WE ARE HIRING!
.
We are looking for Management Trainees to help us develop and implement our growth strategies. This position is best suited for candidates who want to gain valuable experience in a managerial role with advancement potential.
.
During your traineeship, you’ll learn how to identify and apply important strategies and business processes. You’ll learn the nuts and bolts of our company’s functions and operations and support our management team with daily tasks. Strong analytical skills and effective communication are important management trainee qualifications you should have to succeed in this role.
.
WHAT TO EXPECT:

 The 2-year rotational program gives you exposure to various roles within the operations/facilities you are assigned


 Learn about the various areas of Operations within the industry


 Opportunity for placement in a Managerial Position under a year (for excellent performers)


 Specialization Options after 1 year: Operations Management in Beauty; Operations Management in F&B; Operations Management in Project and Marketing; and Operations Management in Logistics


 Hands-on leadership training and a path to a successful career at Initia!


 Access to various training and exclusive mentorship.

.
THE JOB:

 Familiarize and get to know all the functions and operations of the outlet.


 Oversee an efficient and effective day-to-day operation of the branch/outlet.


 Participate in the company's strategic planning.


 Assist manager in completing daily tasks and implementing new policies.


 Provide management and administrative support.


 Ensure strong product and all-around operational knowledge.


 Attend to customers’ needs and queries.


 Handle and resolve customer complaints.


 Ensure to give a wonderful salon experience for each customer and guarantee their satisfaction.


 Coach and develop colleagues to ensure standards are being maintained.

.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

 Graduate with a Bachelor's Degree in any related course.


 Graduates with no experience or entry-level are welcome to apply.


 Passionate about being trained in Operations and willingness to learn.


 Strong & effective verbal and written communication skills.


 Well-groomed and professional outlook that best suits our outlet’s Image.


 Customer-oriented and passionate about serving customers.


 Confident and leader type.


 Can join our team as soon as possible.

.
WHY APPLY?

 Structured career development and guaranteed managerial/supervisory career path.


 Intensive all-operations training to hone you into becoming one of our future managers.


 Exposure to all of the operational and managerial functions through job rotation.


 Be fully trained by our top-tier professionals and mentors.


 Participate in multiple hands-on projects.


 Gain valuable experience in the beauty, F&B, retail, and art industries.


 Entitled to Public Holidays and annual Paid Leave Credits.


 Generous Birthday Gift vouchers.


 Incentives and reward schemes.


 Competitive base salary.


 Grooming Allowance


 Staff Discounts

.
INITIA GROUP is the biggest brand concept leader in Singapore & Malaysia. We have been in the beauty and F&B industry for years and are now in Art, Retail, and Photo Studios. We are a fast-paced growing company, bringing all unique and on-trend concepts. We have a lot of expansions going on and we need additional talents in our growing family.
.
If you’re excited about our company’s vision for this position and want to start the path of becoming one of our future leaders, we’d like to hear from you.
.
You may visit our website to learn more about us: https://initia.sg/
.
APPLY NOW AND BE ONE OF OUR FUTURE MANAGERS!
Job Types: Full-time, Fresh graduate
Salary: $3,500.00 per month
Benefits:

 Employee discount
 Professional development
 Promotion to permanent employee

Schedule:

 Day shift

Education:

 Bachelor's or equivalent (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

description:
Peak Ocean is looking for candidates experience in FPSO or Offshore processing facilities. 
 22nd February, 2024 
  Purpose: To independently handle the piping material activities, prepare, manage, and produce the critical engineering deliverables for the assigned project (that may include short-term assignment to Construction, Commissioning, and Offshore) effectively and efficiently according to the specified technical requirements, timelines, and within budget, and deal independently with and resolve all the issues of the project, and provide guidance to the assigned members.  Responsibilities: 
 
  Works independently to perform the assigned task and develops a solution to technical/engineering and related problems by analyzing the issue or data, interpreting the analysis, and evaluating various options/measures using experience, precedents, and professional references with minimal or no supervision or guidance. 
  Understands technical requirements of project specifications and standards, local statutory and regulatory requirements, Classification society requirements, and applicable codes and standard industry practices to carry out the piping activities and prepare piping deliverables for assigned projects. 
  Carries out the pipe wall thickness calculations using applicable design code. Prepares the piping material specification and valve specification by using and modifying the COMPANY corporate specifications suitably to match the project-specific requirements. 
  Prepares piping insulation specification, and flange management specification (bolt torquing and tensioning) by using the COMPANY corporate specifications and modifying these to meet the project requirement. 
  Prepares bill of materials for piping bulk items (like pipe, flanges, and fittings), valves, piping specialty items, gaskets, stud bolts and nuts, and pipe support materials. 
  Provides piping unit weight inputs for weight control reports. 
  Prepares data sheets for process-critical and non-critical piping specialty items obtaining the process parameters required for the design and manufacturing of process-critical items. 
  Prepares requisitions for piping bulk items, valves, piping specialty items, gaskets, stud bolts and nuts, spring supports, cargo tank heating coil (marine), valve remote control system (marine) and performs a technical evaluation of bids received from various suppliers to ensure shortlisted vendors meet technical requirements as per project specifications, and provides an assessment on technically acceptable bids for Buyer to follow up tender evaluation further to conclude and award the purchaser order. 
  Conducts kick-off meetings with successful suppliers to ensure a clear understanding of the scope of supply, technical requirements, documentation, and delivery conditions to enable the supplier to execute the work strictly as per the purchase order, reviews supplier drawings and documents, and shares the relevant data with engineering contractor to get it incorporated in piping layout design. 
  Works closely with suppliers and contractors concerned to resolve technical issues and visits supplier’s manufacturing facilities to witness the FAT, where necessary. 
  Provides technical support and advice to construction yard and commissioning work at the site. Where necessary, provides off-site support and guidance. 
  Supports the Lead Piping Engineer and assists in preparing lessons learned during the course of execution of the project for further processing through MIMS. 
  Shares the knowledge and experience with team members and guides the engineers in carrying out the assigned task the right a correctively. 
 
  Qualifications: 
  
 
  Bachelor in Mechanical Engineering or Master of Engineering. Alternatively Diploma in Mechanical Engineering with relevant years of experience. 
  Minimum 15 years of relevant working experience in piping engineering in the oil and gas sector, preferably in FPSO or Offshore processing facilities for graduates or a minimum of 12 years of relevant working experience for diploma holders. For a Masters’s degree holder, a minimum of 10 years of relevant working experience is required. 
  MS Office, AutoCAD, E3D, Navisworks, CAESAR-II. 
  Mainly in the office environment. Occasional visits may be required to supplier/manufacturing facilities. Visits or short-term posting to fabrication yard, project site, or offshore facility

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Welcome to Empire Group. We specialize  in providing world-class, professional Interpreting and Translation services throughout the UK and around the globe, with clients in the USA, Europe, Middle East, Africa and Asia. We offer a 24 hour, 7 days a week, 365 days a year service to all our clients.

We have over 10 years of trading experience in the public, private and corporate sectors. Our Board of Company Advisors has a combined expertise of over 80 years in providing services. This is why we consistently meet and exceed the expectations of our clients.

We believe that the key to our success is an ethical approach to the services we provide. By doing what’s right for you and your business, we aim to make your life a little easier. Our professional services are personally tailored to evolve with your specific needs.

We ensure high quality recruitment, including strict vetting and assessment for all candidates and sub-contractors that provide services for Empire Group. We pride ourselves on finding individuals of the highest caliber to support our clients.

description:
Job Opening Details: 
 - 6 months contract 
 - UAT for front-end system for corporate users 
 - Work location in EAST Area (Changi, Tampines) 
 - Candidates without relevant experience are welcomed to apply 
 
  Responsibilities 
   
   · Work closely with UAT Team Lead to ensure requirements and scope are clearly understood. 
   
  
   Conduct UAT testing for business deliverables including new markets or products, application decommissions, operational improvements, and industry-driven regulatory changes. 
   Assist Test Lead to track UAT issues, and publish daily EOD test status. 
   Perform end to end testing with full understanding of the Business Requirements and Functional Specs. 
   Communicate to UAT Team Lead on open issues and defects, run book execution progress, and risks. 
   Ensure UAT artifacts and sign-offs are saved as the UAT audit trail. 
   Able to understand business requirements/functional requirements and translate them into test cases. 
   Able to execute test scripts, raise defects in tracking system (e.g. Jira) and follow through on defect resolution 
   Able to collaborate with business and technology team to Ensure effective end to end testing. 
  
 
 
  Requirements 
   
   · At least 1+ years of experience in performing UAT testing or Business Analyst 
   
  
   Strong communication skills both written and verbal 
   Strong analytical skill 
   Attention to details 
   Has knowledge in at least on one of the following: 
   Electronic Banking (e.g. internet banking), 
   Channels Banking (e.g. File transfer service, SWIFTnet, SWIFT) 
   Payments (e.g. Domestic Wire, Cross Border Wire, G3 Bulk Payment, G3 FAST) 
   Liquidity (e.g. Sweeping and Pooling) 
   Statements (e.g. MT940, Camt) 
   APIs
descriptionHTML:
Job Opening Details:

- 6 months contract

- UAT for front-end system for corporate users

- Work location in EAST Area (Changi, Tampines)

- Candidates without relevant experience are welcomed to apply

Responsibilities

· Work closely with UAT Team Lead to ensure requirements and scope are clearly understood.
  • Conduct UAT testing for business deliverables including new markets or products, application decommissions, operational improvements, and industry-driven regulatory changes.
  • Assist Test Lead to track UAT issues, and publish daily EOD test status.
  • Perform end to end testing with full understanding of the Business Requirements and Functional Specs.
  • Communicate to UAT Team Lead on open issues and defects, run book execution progress, and risks.
  • Ensure UAT artifacts and sign-offs are saved as the UAT audit trail.
  • Able to understand business requirements/functional requirements and translate them into test cases.
  • Able to execute test scripts, raise defects in tracking system (e.g. Jira) and follow through on defect resolution
  • Able to collaborate with business and technology team to Ensure effective end to end testing.
Requirements

· At least 1+ years of experience in performing UAT testing or Business Analyst
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal
  • Strong analytical skill
  • Attention to details
  • Has knowledge in at least on one of the following:
  • Electronic Banking (e.g. internet banking),
  • Channels Banking (e.g. File transfer service, SWIFTnet, SWIFT)
  • Payments (e.g. Domestic Wire, Cross Border Wire, G3 Bulk Payment, G3 FAST)
  • Liquidity (e.g. Sweeping and Pooling)
  • Statements (e.g. MT940, Camt)
  • APIs

description:

Sales & Marketing Associate
About Us:Join our innovative team and be part of a company that values creativity, growth, and collaboration. We're looking for passionate individuals who are ready to take on the challenge of driving sales and creating impactful marketing strategies.
What You'll Do:As a Sales & Marketing Associate, you will be involved in exciting projects that include:

 Developing and executing creative marketing campaigns.
 Identifying and pursuing new business opportunities.
 Building and maintaining strong relationships with clients.
 Collaborating with cross-functional teams to achieve common goals.

What We Offer:

 Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
 Comprehensive training and mentorship programs.
 Opportunities for career advancement and professional development.
 A supportive and inclusive work environment.
 Exciting projects and a chance to make a real impact.

Requirements:

 Fresh graduates, gap year enthusiasts, and ORD personnel are welcome to apply.
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
 Creative thinking and problem-solving abilities.
 Eagerness to learn and adapt in a dynamic work environment.
 Team player mentality.

How to Apply:If you're ready to embark on a rewarding journey with us, send your resume.
Join us in shaping the future of the sales & marketing industry! Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to grow both personally and professionally. We can't wait to welcome you to our vibrant team.

description:
The Role
  We are looking for a self-motivated, approachable, and business-savvy technology lawyer to join our in-house legal team to support Apryse’s growing business and team in the Asia-Pacific region (APAC).
  The ideal candidate has experience working with software licensing transactions and intellectual property rights, learns quickly and is passionate about delivering exceptional legal work in an efficient and pragmatic manner. The candidate will play an important role in Apryse’s legal department and business, supporting our sales efforts, compliance team and other day-to-day legal matters.
  Location
  Singapore
  Key Responsibilities
 
   Draft and negotiate software license agreements, reseller agreements and other commercial contracts.
   Provide day-to-day legal advice and pragmatically resolve issues that arise across the business, primarily focused on supporting our sales and compliance teams.
   Support negotiations in connection with compliance opportunities and misuse of open source licensing.
   Work with legal and business stakeholders to develop and support processes for contracting and other legal matters to improve efficiency, scalability and productivity of sales process.
   Work collaboratively and efficiently with external legal counsel where required.
   Assist with privacy matters and other regulatory compliance efforts.
 
  Requirements
 
   Law degree from an accredited law school.
   Minimum of 4 years of relevant commercial legal experience (ideally in a major law firm and/or in-house at a software company).
   Extensive experience working with software licensing agreements and technology-related transactions.
   An understanding of intellectual property rights issues related to software.
   Strong negotiation skills with the ability to understand the interplay of legal and business terms, and to advocate a strong position while maintaining a positive relationship with the other party.
   Ability to grasp legal and business issues and provide tailored advice in plain language to non-legal stakeholders.
   Creative problem-solver who can take a leadership role in transactions and resolve complex issues in creative, efficient, and practical ways.
   Proactive, service-oriented attitude, strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build collaborative business relationships at all levels of the organization.
   impeccable attention to detail, organized and able to self-motivate and work well independently and as part of a team in a dynamic environment.
 
  Nice to haves:
 
   Fluency in another language.
   Experience working with and supporting sales teams.
   Experience supporting IP compliance and protection efforts in APAC region.
   Experience negotiating agreements with government entities in APAC.
   Familiarity with open source software.
   Experience with privacy regulations.
 
 
  Company Description
  Apryse is the industry-leading provider of document software development (SDK) technology powering everything from traditional desktop software to innovative web and mobile applications. With a broad international portfolio of combined companies, products, and leading technologies, we are actively changing the way the world works with documents to make work better and life simpler.
  We are also a fast-growing company, chosen as one of Canada's Top Small & Medium Employers of 2022 by Mediacorp Canada Inc and selected among Canada’s best employers for recent graduates with its addition to the 2022 Career Directory.
  Since having secured a $95M strategic growth investment in 2019, we have grown from approximately 50 employees to over 370, made eleven acquisitions, and in 2021, Thoma Bravo, the top private investment firm in the world for software, came on board with another strategic growth investment.
  Customers like IBM, Autodesk, DocuSign, Boeing, Microsoft (and many more!) come to us to realize their web and mobile strategies for document management, editing, and collaboration as the #1-ranked commercial document SDK of choice for companies worldwide. As a result, you can find our document technology in thousands of solutions, including those of household names, used by millions across virtually every industry. Our XODO app alone has 25M unique installs - and counting - and the highest ratings among PDF productivity apps on the largest online app marketplaces.
  Internally, we foster an atmosphere of opportunity, growth, and success for every individual amidst an exciting and challenging entrepreneurial culture. Career progression is based on merit, not tenure. Every member of our vibrant team is empowered to be a contributor, innovator, and successful leader.
  Ready to join our team?
  If you are interested in helping Apryse deliver on its commitments and taking your career to the next level, we invite you to apply online now.
  Please note that due to the high volume of applications received, only short-listed candidates will be contacted.
  We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.
  Thank you for your interest in Apryse!
descriptionHTML:
The Role

We are looking for a self-motivated, approachable, and business-savvy technology lawyer to join our in-house legal team to support Apryse’s growing business and team in the Asia-Pacific region (APAC).

The ideal candidate has experience working with software licensing transactions and intellectual property rights, learns quickly and is passionate about delivering exceptional legal work in an efficient and pragmatic manner. The candidate will play an important role in Apryse’s legal department and business, supporting our sales efforts, compliance team and other day-to-day legal matters.

Location

Singapore

Key Responsibilities

  • Draft and negotiate software license agreements, reseller agreements and other commercial contracts.
  • Provide day-to-day legal advice and pragmatically resolve issues that arise across the business, primarily focused on supporting our sales and compliance teams.
  • Support negotiations in connection with compliance opportunities and misuse of open source licensing.
  • Work with legal and business stakeholders to develop and support processes for contracting and other legal matters to improve efficiency, scalability and productivity of sales process.
  • Work collaboratively and efficiently with external legal counsel where required.
  • Assist with privacy matters and other regulatory compliance efforts.

Requirements

  • Law degree from an accredited law school.
  • Minimum of 4 years of relevant commercial legal experience (ideally in a major law firm and/or in-house at a software company).
  • Extensive experience working with software licensing agreements and technology-related transactions.
  • An understanding of intellectual property rights issues related to software.
  • Strong negotiation skills with the ability to understand the interplay of legal and business terms, and to advocate a strong position while maintaining a positive relationship with the other party.
  • Ability to grasp legal and business issues and provide tailored advice in plain language to non-legal stakeholders.
  • Creative problem-solver who can take a leadership role in transactions and resolve complex issues in creative, efficient, and practical ways.
  • Proactive, service-oriented attitude, strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build collaborative business relationships at all levels of the organization.
  • impeccable attention to detail, organized and able to self-motivate and work well independently and as part of a team in a dynamic environment.

Nice to haves:

  • Fluency in another language.
  • Experience working with and supporting sales teams.
  • Experience supporting IP compliance and protection efforts in APAC region.
  • Experience negotiating agreements with government entities in APAC.
  • Familiarity with open source software.
  • Experience with privacy regulations.


Company Description

Apryse is the industry-leading provider of document software development (SDK) technology powering everything from traditional desktop software to innovative web and mobile applications. With a broad international portfolio of combined companies, products, and leading technologies, we are actively changing the way the world works with documents to make work better and life simpler.

We are also a fast-growing company, chosen as one of Canada's Top Small & Medium Employers of 2022 by Mediacorp Canada Inc and selected among Canada’s best employers for recent graduates with its addition to the 2022 Career Directory.

Since having secured a $95M strategic growth investment in 2019, we have grown from approximately 50 employees to over 370, made eleven acquisitions, and in 2021, Thoma Bravo, the top private investment firm in the world for software, came on board with another strategic growth investment.

Customers like IBM, Autodesk, DocuSign, Boeing, Microsoft (and many more!) come to us to realize their web and mobile strategies for document management, editing, and collaboration as the #1-ranked commercial document SDK of choice for companies worldwide. As a result, you can find our document technology in thousands of solutions, including those of household names, used by millions across virtually every industry. Our XODO app alone has 25M unique installs - and counting - and the highest ratings among PDF productivity apps on the largest online app marketplaces.

Internally, we foster an atmosphere of opportunity, growth, and success for every individual amidst an exciting and challenging entrepreneurial culture. Career progression is based on merit, not tenure. Every member of our vibrant team is empowered to be a contributor, innovator, and successful leader.

Ready to join our team?

If you are interested in helping Apryse deliver on its commitments and taking your career to the next level, we invite you to apply online now.

Please note that due to the high volume of applications received, only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.

Thank you for your interest in Apryse!

description:
Binance is the leading global blockchain ecosystem and cryptocurrency infrastructure provider whose suite of financial products includes the world’s largest digital-asset exchange. 
 
 
  Our mission is to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.
 
 
 
   If you’re looking for a fast-paced, mission-driven organization where opportunities to learn and excel are endless, then Binance is the place for you.
 
 
 
   About Binance Accelerator Program
 
 
   
 
 
   Binance Accelerator Program is a concise fixed-term program designed for Early Career Talent to have an immersive experience in the rapidly expanding Web3 space. You will be given the opportunity to experience life at Binance and understand what goes on behind the scenes of the worlds’ leading blockchain ecosystem. Alongside your job, there will also be a focus on networking and development, which will expand your professional network and build transferable skills to propel you forward in your career. Learn about BAP Program HERE
 
 
   
 
 
   Who may apply
 
 
 
   Current university students and recent graduates
 
 
 
   We are looking for young talents to join our team responsible for engineering the next-generation products for our internal and external customers.
  
 Responsibilities
 
   Assist in the design, development, testing, and deployment of robust, scalable and efficient web applications.
   Collaborate with UX/UI designers to create user-friendly and intuitive interfaces.
   Work alongside the product team to understand end-user requirements, formulate use cases, and translate learnings into a pragmatic and effective technical solution.
   Conduct debugging and troubleshooting in all stages of the development process.
   Write and maintain quality code, and ensuring designs are in compliance with specifications.
   Provide technical assistance to other team members and participate in code reviews.
 
  Requirements
 
   Must be a full-time undergraduate/graduate student in good academic standing. Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
   Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5 and CSS3.
   Strong knowledge of JavaScript, and experience with Vue.js (preferred) or ReactJS.
   Exposure to RESTful API integration.
   Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX.
   Experience with Version Control/Git.
   Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
   Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a flexible attitude.
   Excellent communication skills.
   Ability to start the job in March/April 2024 for a up-to-6-months duration.
 
 
 
   Working at Binance
 
 
  Be a part of the world’s leading blockchain ecosystem that continues to grow and offers excellent career development opportunities
  Work alongside diverse, world-class talent in an environment where learning and growth opportunities are endless
  Tackle fast-paced, challenging and unique projects
  Work in a truly global organization, with international teams and a flat organizational structure
  Competitive salary and benefits
  Flexible working hours, remote-first, and casual work attire
 
 
 
   Learn more about how Binancians embody the organization’s core values, creating a unified culture that enables collaboration, excellence, and growth.
   
 
 
  
 
  Apply today to be a part of the Web3 revolution!
   
 
 
  
 
  Binance is committed to being an equal opportunity employer. We believe that having a diverse workforce is fundamental to our success.
   
 
 
  
 
  By submitting a job application, you confirm that you have read and agree to our Candidate Privacy Notice.

description:
Your job responsibilities include but not limited to:

 Creating marketing and social media campaigns and strategies, including budget planning, content ideation, creation and implementation schedules monthly (social calendar)
 Managing Company’s social media platforms including TIKTOK videos content creation
 Working with management to create relevant content for the necessary platforms.
 Creating creative content and designing social media campaigns and posts
 Providing weekly reports on projects being worked on.
 Aiding in growing and expands company social media presence into new social media platforms, plus increases presence on existing platforms including Facebook and Instagram
 Ensures brand consistency in marketing and social media messages
 Replying and engaging in conversations on social media platforms (Reputation Management)
 Other ad-hoc duties required by management in relevant job scope.
 Bonus incentive if sales team hits target.

Requirements:

 Diploma in any relevant field of work (Fresh graduates welcome)
 Basic skills in Photoshop, Illustrator and relevant softwares needed.
 Create and innovation individual who is passionate about marketing and social media
 Proficient in social media sites
 Committed individual who is also able to work independently.

Job Types: Internship, Permanent
Salary: $2,200.00 - $3,000.00 per month
Work Location: In person

description:
WE are looking to grow our team with talented people and achieve great things together!

 Guided Career Advancement
 Flexible Hours
 Quality Leads provided (No canvassing or cold-call)
 Monthly jobs are guaranteed
 Dynamic and Fun-Loving Environment
 Training provided
 Overseas Trip
 High Incentive and Commission based
 Friendly, Hybrid and Vibrant working culture

1. Role Description:
This position reports to the Operations director and interfaces with sub contractors and customers through the whole interior project management phase. We are committed to groom individuals to become an interior designer equipped with good project management skill.
2. Sepcific Responsibilities
Individual to be involved in:
A. Interior design and project management from start to end.
B. Creation of 3D interior drawing and layout plan.
C. Carpentry measurement and drawing
D. Assisting customers for materials and colors selection.
E. Creation of the workflow plan and oversee each phase of the project.
3. Competencies
A. Understanding customer's requirement and propose space plans and functional designs to customers
B. Create interior layout floor plan drawings using Adobe Illustrator software
C. Create interior 3D design renders using Sketch Up and Coohom softwares
D. Take carpentry measurements and create carpentry detailed drawing using AutoCad software
E. Material selection and color pairing
F. Understanding interior renovation essentials and items to be used throughout the project phase
G. Create work flow plan using Adobe Illustrator and time plan using Google Calendar and manage the whole interior project phase
4. Duration of traineeship and attachment offered:
- 6 months
5. Approved Training Allowance

 Fresh Graduates --$2000.00
 Non Mature Mid Career Individuals --$2100.00
 Mature Mid Career Individuals --$2700.00

6. This position is open for both recent graduates and mid career individuals (mature and non mature). Graduates interested in this position should possess a Poly Diploma Qualification. Mid career individuals from any qualification level can apply.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $2,700.00 - $6,000.00 per month
Benefits:

 Flexible schedule
 Professional development
 Promotion to permanent employee

Schedule:

 Day shift
 Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

 13th month salary
 Commission pay
 Performance bonus
 Yearly bonus

Education:

 Local Polytechnic Diploma (Preferred)

Experience:

 Interior design: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

 Singapore 737856 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

 Singapore 737856: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Willingness to travel:

 25% (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

companyInfo/companyDescription:
We Listen. 
We Learn. 
We Create.  
We Amplify. 
We Collaborate. 
We Integrate.
We Care. 

Hitachi Solutions North America is a 100% Microsoft platform focused, cloud-services systems integrator. Our team of world-class specialists deliver end-to-end, sustainable innovations and solutions that support and accelerate our customers’ data and business system modernization initiatives.

We unlock and bring potential forward.

Visit https://global.hitachi-solutions.com/careers/ to view our open positions.
description:
Company Description
  Hitachi Solutions is a core IT Company of the Hitachi Group, which employs over 330,000 people worldwide. Headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, Hitachi Solutions' reach extends to group companies in Japan and abroad, working with a worldwide network of alliance partners. We strive to provide ideal solutions and products to customers in a diverse set of countries and regions including Asia, North America, and Europe.
  Using a portfolio of management consulting, implementation, and support services, we help our clients compete with the largest global enterprises leveraging powerful, affordable, and easy to use industry solutions built on Microsoft technologies.
  Our vision is to help our customers achieve their vision through superior products, prices, and people. Hitachi solutions has been recognized as the 2023 Microsoft Asia Pacific Region Business Applications Partner of the Year and 2023 Microsoft Singapore Intelligent Line of Business – Business Applications Partner of the Year. Job Description
  Job Description
  The Benefits
  Annual Performance Review, Annual Training, Learning portal access to unlimited online training courses, Milestone celebrations, Gifts on special occasions, Flexible benefit plan, Weekly lunch reimbursement, Health Insurance for you, your spouse and children under top health insurance providers from day 1, Life insurance, Employee assistance program on mental health, Wellness and recreation benefit, Paid holiday and sick leave credits, Annual Team Outing, Quarterly Team Building Activities, Regular Face-to-face and virtual engagement activities, Rewards and recognition
 
  Job Overview
  This role is open to Business and Engineering fresh graduates and Supply Chain professionals who would like to consider a career in the IT industry! You will spend time training with other team members on Microsoft Dynamics 365 technologies and how to become a Business Analyst in the IT Consulting industry.
  As a Supply Chain Business Analyst, you will work closely in the system development and implementation of the Microsoft Dynamics ERP system, that will be used by Hitachi's global clients. You will work closely with clients to gather requirements and understand their business processes.
  Upon completion of the training and shadowing, you will have opportunities to work with global projects in the APAC region. A flexible attitude is a must. You may expect to be assigned to a flexible work shift or possible business travel opportunities outside Singapore.
  The key responsibilities will include:
 
   Understand, communicate, interpret client business processes and requirements.
   Document requirements into a business requirements document.
   Configure Dynamics ERP Supply Chain modules – Customer Service, Field Service, Remote Assist.
   Strong communication skills
   Knowledge of all Microsoft Office Programs
   Knowledge of fundamental business operations or procedures (inventory management, procurement, sales)
 
 
  EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full time, Permanent position
  WORK SCHEDULE: 9 AM to 6 PM SGT
  WORK LOCATION: Hybrid (Mix of work from home and onsite). Office address is at 150 Beach Road #21-07 Gateway West Group Singapore
  Qualifications
  QUALIFICATIONS
 
   Bachelors degree is required
   Excellent written and verbal communication skills
   Familiar with ERP applications, Microsoft Dynamics is preferred
   Proficient with Excel, Outlook and Word.
 
   Additional Information
  OUR COMPETITIVE EDGE
  We work together in a dynamic and rewarding work environment. We have an experienced leadership team, excellent technology and product expertise, and strong relationships with a broad base of customers and partners.
  We offer competitive compensation and benefits package, regular performance review, performance bonuses, and regular trainings.
 
  What is it like working here?
 
   We pride ourselves on being industry leaders and providing an enjoyable work environment where our people can grow personally and professionally. Hitachi is the place people can develop skills they’re excited about.
   We recognize our profitability and project success comes from our team—great people doing great things. As such, we pursue profitable growth and expanded opportunities for our team.
   We offer challenging and diverse work across multiple industries and reward creativity and entrepreneurial innovation.
 
 
   We respect, encourage, and support each individual needs to continually learn and grow personally and professionally. We are committed to fostering our people.
   We believe that investing in our community is just as important as investing in our organization. To that extent, we fundraise, volunteer, and allocate funds to support local charities.
   We listen. Every employee has something important to say that can contribute to enriching our environment.
   We compensate fairly. And while employees might come for the paycheck, they stay for the people. Our people are the reason we are exceptional. This is something we never forget.
 
 
  Frequently Asked Questions
  Job Applicant Data Protection Policy 
  Beware of scams
  Our recruiting team may communicate with candidates via our @hitachisolutions.com domain email address and/or via our SmartRecruiters (Applicant Tracking System) notification@smartrecruiters.com domain email address regarding your application and interview requests.
  All offers will originate from our @hitachisolutions.com domain email address. If you receive an offer or information from someone purporting to be an employee of Hitachi Solutions from any other domain, it may not be legitimate. 
  Hitachi Solutions is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at all levels. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to creating a workplace that is inclusive and welcoming to everyone, and we believe that a diverse workforce is essential to our success. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply for our job openings and we will consider all candidates for employment regardless of their background.
descriptionHTML:
Company Description


Hitachi Solutions is a core IT Company of the Hitachi Group, which employs over 330,000 people worldwide. Headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, Hitachi Solutions' reach extends to group companies in Japan and abroad, working with a worldwide network of alliance partners. We strive to provide ideal solutions and products to customers in a diverse set of countries and regions including Asia, North America, and Europe.

Using a portfolio of management consulting, implementation, and support services, we help our clients compete with the largest global enterprises leveraging powerful, affordable, and easy to use industry solutions built on Microsoft technologies.

Our vision is to help our customers achieve their vision through superior products, prices, and people. Hitachi solutions has been recognized as the 2023 Microsoft Asia Pacific Region Business Applications Partner of the Year and 2023 Microsoft Singapore Intelligent Line of Business – Business Applications Partner of the Year.


Job Description


Job Description

The Benefits

Annual Performance Review, Annual Training, Learning portal access to unlimited online training courses, Milestone celebrations, Gifts on special occasions, Flexible benefit plan, Weekly lunch reimbursement, Health Insurance for you, your spouse and children under top health insurance providers from day 1, Life insurance, Employee assistance program on mental health, Wellness and recreation benefit, Paid holiday and sick leave credits, Annual Team Outing, Quarterly Team Building Activities, Regular Face-to-face and virtual engagement activities, Rewards and recognition


Job Overview

This role is open to Business and Engineering fresh graduates and Supply Chain professionals who would like to consider a career in the IT industry! You will spend time training with other team members on Microsoft Dynamics 365 technologies and how to become a Business Analyst in the IT Consulting industry.

As a Supply Chain Business Analyst, you will work closely in the system development and implementation of the Microsoft Dynamics ERP system, that will be used by Hitachi's global clients. You will work closely with clients to gather requirements and understand their business processes.

Upon completion of the training and shadowing, you will have opportunities to work with global projects in the APAC region. A flexible attitude is a must. You may expect to be assigned to a flexible work shift or possible business travel opportunities outside Singapore.

The key responsibilities will include:

  • Understand, communicate, interpret client business processes and requirements.
  • Document requirements into a business requirements document.
  • Configure Dynamics ERP Supply Chain modules – Customer Service, Field Service, Remote Assist.
  • Strong communication skills
  • Knowledge of all Microsoft Office Programs
  • Knowledge of fundamental business operations or procedures (inventory management, procurement, sales)


EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full time, Permanent position

WORK SCHEDULE: 9 AM to 6 PM SGT

WORK LOCATION: Hybrid (Mix of work from home and onsite). Office address is at 150 Beach Road #21-07 Gateway West Group Singapore


Qualifications


QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelors degree is required
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Familiar with ERP applications, Microsoft Dynamics is preferred
  • Proficient with Excel, Outlook and Word.

Additional Information


OUR COMPETITIVE EDGE

We work together in a dynamic and rewarding work environment. We have an experienced leadership team, excellent technology and product expertise, and strong relationships with a broad base of customers
and partners.

We offer competitive compensation and benefits package, regular performance review, performance bonuses, and regular trainings.


What is it like working here?

  • We pride ourselves on being industry leaders and providing an enjoyable work environment where our people can grow personally and professionally. Hitachi is the place people can develop skills they’re excited about.

  • We recognize our profitability and project success comes from our team—great people doing great things. As such, we pursue profitable growth and expanded opportunities for our team.

  • We offer challenging and diverse work across multiple industries and reward creativity and entrepreneurial innovation.

  • We respect, encourage, and support each individual needs to continually learn and grow personally and professionally. We are committed to fostering our people.

  • We believe that investing in our community is just as important as investing in our organization. To that extent, we fundraise, volunteer, and allocate funds to support local charities.

  • We listen. Every employee has something important to say that can contribute to enriching our environment.

  • We compensate fairly. And while employees might come for the paycheck, they stay for the people. Our people are the reason we are exceptional. This is something we never forget.


Frequently Asked Questions

Job Applicant Data Protection Policy

Beware of scams

Our recruiting team may communicate with candidates via our @hitachisolutions.com domain email address and/or via our SmartRecruiters (Applicant Tracking System) notification@smartrecruiters.com domain email address regarding your application and interview requests.

All offers will originate from our @hitachisolutions.com domain email address. If you receive an offer or information from someone purporting to be an employee of Hitachi Solutions from any other domain, it may not be legitimate.

Hitachi Solutions is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at all levels. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to creating a workplace that is inclusive and welcoming to everyone, and we believe that a diverse workforce is essential to our success. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply for our job openings and we will consider all candidates for employment regardless of their background.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
A leading provider of pre-school education in Singapore as well the Asia Pacific. With centres in Singapore and in 15 countries spanning over 4 continents, the company commands an unmatched local and international presence.

The Modern Montessori International Group (MMI) is fully committed and passionate about providing only the best in pre-school learning and education.
 
The Montessori method of education is one that is based on self-directed activity, hands-on learning and collaborative play. Every material in a Montessori classroom supports an aspect of child development, creating a match between the child’s natural interests and the available activities.
description:
FREELANCE ART TEACHER
We are expanding!!! Enrichment Centre currently seeking a passionate and dedicated Art and Craft Teacher to join our team and inspire the next generation of creative minds. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in arts and crafts, a love for teaching, and the ability to foster a positive and engaging learning environment for our children.
THIS ROLE INVOLVES:

 Educate children on basic art principles and techniques while encouraging creative expression and nurturing artistic abilities.
 Facilitate and encourage a learning experience which provides students with the opportunity to achieve their individual potential.
 Create positive classroom environment that is conducive in learning, by interacting and engaging with children.
 Foster and promote social development in the student by encouraging good behaviour and positive interaction with others.
 Execute lesson plans according and facilitate art teaching in a group setting.

· Able to teach students of different age group (from age 3 to 12 Years)

 Preferably with experience in DSA Programme

IDEAL TRAINER LOOKS LIKE THIS:

 Students and Graduates welcome.

· Possess at least 'O' level Art background/Certificate/Diploma
· Good communication & interpersonal skills

 Prior experience in teaching art and craft or a related field
 A strong portfolio showcasing a variety of artistic techniques and mediums.
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
 A genuine passion for working with children and fostering their creative development.

*
JOB TYPES:
- Full-time,
- Part-time,
- Freelance
BENEFITS
Competitive pay scale
Please apply online and indicate your current and expected salary. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Send in your application today, and we'll be in touch if you are shortlisted for the role.
Hope to hear from you soon!

Salary: From $20.00 per hour
Benefits:

 Flexible schedule

Schedule:

 Day shift

 Overtime pay
 Performance bonus

description:
Company Description
  Hitachi Solutions is a core IT Company of the Hitachi Group, which employs over 330,000 people worldwide. Headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, Hitachi Solutions' reach extends to group companies in Japan and abroad, working with a worldwide network of alliance partners. We strive to provide ideal solutions and products to customers in a diverse set of countries and regions including Asia, North America, and Europe.
  Using a portfolio of management consulting, implementation, and support services, we help our clients compete with the largest global enterprises leveraging powerful, affordable, and easy to use industry solutions built on Microsoft technologies.
  Our vision is to help our customers achieve their vision through superior products, prices, and people. Hitachi solutions has been recognized as the 2023 Microsoft Asia Pacific Region Business Applications Partner of the Year and 2023 Microsoft Singapore Intelligent Line of Business – Business Applications Partner of the Year. Job Description
  The Benefits
  Annual Performance Review, Annual Training, Learning portal access to unlimited online training courses, Milestone celebrations, Gifts on special occasions, Flexible benefit plan, Weekly lunch reimbursement. Health Insurance for you, your spouse and children under top health insurance providers from day 1, Life insurance, Employee assistance program on mental health, Wellness and recreation benefit. Paid holiday and sick leave credits, Annual Team Outing, Quarterly Team Building Activities, Regular Face-to-face and virtual engagement activities, Rewards and recognition.
  Job Overview
 
  This role is open to fresh graduates and professionals with 1-2 years of experience! You will spend time training with other team members on Microsoft Dynamics 365 technologies and you will work on delivering Agile innovative solutions built on the Microsoft stack.
  Upon successful completion of the training program, you will have opportunities to work with global projects in the APAC region. A flexible attitude is a must. You may expect to be assigned to a flexible work shift or possible business travel opportunities outside Singapore.
 
  Nature of the Role: Software Developer/Systems Developer
  Scope of work:
 
   Assist with application development, software maintenance and systems administration.
   Engagement in a project from initial concept through solution delivery
   Assist in documenting all related technical processes.
   Assist in completing pending or on-going tasks currently being handled by the technical department.
   Give new ideas and process to his/her assigned department.
   Performs related duties as assigned.
   Assist in configure D365 F&O Security roles and duties.
   Assist in data migration.
 
  EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full time, Permanent position
  WORK SCHEDULE: 9 AM to 6 PM SGT
  WORK LOCATION: Hybrid (Mix of work from home and onsite). Office address is at 150 Beach Road #21-07 Gateway West Group Singapore
  Qualifications
  
 
   Fresh graduate or professionals with 1-2 years experience
   Bachelor's Degree in IT, Computer Science or other related field
   Strong understanding on Object Oriented Programming (OOP)
   Programming knowledge on C# .NET and/or Java
   Good understanding on SQL server technology
   Good understanding on Windows server technology
   Knowledge in Technical Writing
   Has attention to details. Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
   Amenable to work in a flexible work shift or be assigned to a project outside Singapore
 
   Additional Information
  OUR COMPETITIVE EDGE
  We work together in a dynamic and rewarding work environment. We have an experienced leadership team, excellent technology and product expertise, and strong relationships with a broad base of customers and partners.
  We offer competitive compensation and benefits package, regular performance review, performance bonuses, and regular trainings.
 
  What is it like working here?
 
   We pride ourselves on being industry leaders and providing an enjoyable work environment where our people can grow personally and professionally. Hitachi is the place people can develop skills they’re excited about.
   We recognize our profitability and project success comes from our team—great people doing great things. As such, we pursue profitable growth and expanded opportunities for our team.
   We offer challenging and diverse work across multiple industries and reward creativity and entrepreneurial innovation.
 
 
   We respect, encourage, and support each individual needs to continually learn and grow personally and professionally. We are committed to fostering our people.
   We believe that investing in our community is just as important as investing in our organization. To that extent, we fundraise, volunteer, and allocate funds to support local charities.
   We listen. Every employee has something important to say that can contribute to enriching our environment.
   We compensate fairly. And while employees might come for the paycheck, they stay for the people. Our people are the reason we are exceptional. This is something we never forget.
 
 
  Frequently Asked Questions
  Job Applicant Data Protection Policy 
  Beware of scams
  Our recruiting team may communicate with candidates via our @hitachisolutions.com domain email address and/or via our SmartRecruiters (Applicant Tracking System) notification@smartrecruiters.com domain email address regarding your application and interview requests.
  All offers will originate from our @hitachisolutions.com domain email address. If you receive an offer or information from someone purporting to be an employee of Hitachi Solutions from any other domain, it may not be legitimate. 
  Hitachi Solutions is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at all levels. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to creating a workplace that is inclusive and welcoming to everyone, and we believe that a diverse workforce is essential to our success. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply for our job openings and we will consider all candidates for employment regardless of their background.

companyInfo/companyDescription: Soundzipper is a Singapore based acoustics consultancy with one main goal; “making life sound better” through creative and holistic solutions to acoustic problems, considering not just equipment and technical requirements but also the intangible aspects of aesthetics and usability.
description:
Do you have a background in sound engineering / architecture / interior design and want to explore a new but related field of sound & acoustics? Soundzipper is looking for an enthusiastic intern who has a deep desire to learn and understand acoustics, who will be guided directly by our principal acoustics consultant.
If you are an architect or interior designer, you will learn to design with a difference, giving you an edge in your future projects.
If you are a sound engineer, you will learn how a space can affect your recording / music production capabilities, enabling you to hone your craft.
This internship programme or short-term work arrangement (3-6 months) will enable you to pick up valuable acoustical knowledge from first-hand experience in a variety of spaces. This job is an exciting entry-level opportunity to learn about sound and acoustics, and how these elements in architecture contribute to users’ spatial experiences. Training will be provided.
You will:

 Experience and learn how a multitude of spaces such as recording studios, private cinemas and music schools are built
 Learn how to use industry standard equipment in acoustical survey projects.
 Take part in the acoustics design process by drawing layout plans and diagrams used to build acoustically sound structures.
 Help people overcome their noise and sound problems
 Help create acoustic reports of the highest standards with guidance from the consultant
 Learn to run acoustics software and perform acoustical simulations
 Get hands-on experience with an acoustics project from design to completion
 Achieve “acoustic thinking”

Requirements:

 Final year student or recent graduate from an audio recording / sound engineering or architectural / interior design major
 Excellent command of English – spoken and written
 Able to work in a start-up environment, with minimal supervision
 Proficiency in architectural drafting would be a considered plus
 Good understanding / deep desire to understand how sound works in spaces
 Willingness to travel to project sites – travel allowance will be provided
 Duration: Minimum 3 months – maximum 6 months

Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Job Type: InternshipContract length: 6 months
Salary: $1,000.00 - $1,500.00 per month
Benefits:

 Flexible schedule
 Work from home

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Education:

 Bachelor's or equivalent (Required)

License/Certification:

 authorization to work in Singapore? (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Singapore 189352
